loans.name: Zainura

texts.ru: Камолова Зайнура проживает в городе Яван.Возраст 40 лет, замужем и имеет 4 детей.Уже около пяти лет занимается разведением крупно рогатого скота. Для того, чтобы улучшить условия  ухода , она планирует получить кредит и использовать его для покупки стройматериалов и сделать ремонт а в коровнике. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zainura K. lives in the town of Yavan. She is 40 years old, married and has four children. For the past five years she has raised cattle. In order to improve their quality of care, she plans to take out a loan that she will use to purchase building materials to repair to their cowshed. She will be able to repay the loan within ten months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cowshed repairs

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Mrs Rosalinda T., 47 years old, is married and a resident of Roxas, Zamboanga del Norte. Her husband is a fisherman. The fish caught by her husband will be sold at the public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years already.

Because they wanted to buy fishing nets, both agreed to join Paglaum MPC in May 14, 2008 to have access to a loan. But aside from financial assistance they received, they also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance, savings etc. Since she wants to be more productive, she is applying for a loan amounting to 5,000PHP. She believes that with Paglaum’s help, and with the patience & diligence of her husband, she is looking forward to being a successful vendor someday and can own a stall at the public market.

loans.use: to buy fish for sale

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Mrs. Isabel F., 43 years old, is married and lives at Irasan, Roxas, Zamboanga del Norte. She had to find ways to earn a living, that’s why she began raising pigs with their neighborhood, and the sharing of profit upon sale was divided depending on their agreement, mostly 60:40 or 70:30.

With her desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own. Needing capital for piglets and feed, she decided to join Paglaum MPC. Fortunately, she was able to start up her business and still does it today. Now, she is requesting 5,000PHP to buy additional feed. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefits her family, aside from the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pigpen.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pig raising

loans.name: Rajabmurod

texts.ru: Краев Раджабмурод живет в городе Яван. Занимается животноводством. Возраст 27 лет , женат и имеет троих детей. Покупает бычков  откармливает их , а затем продает на рынке.Сейчас один из соседей предлагает ему породистую корову по очень низкой цене , и поэтому он обратился к нам за кредитом , чтобы иметь возможность купить корову. Таким образом он сможет зазаняться разведением этой породы . Кроме того,сможет получать высококачественное молоко. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rajabmurod Q. lives in the town of Yavan, and breeds cattle. He is 27 years old, married and has three children. He buys steers that he fattens for market. One of his neighbors has offered him a purebred cow at a very low price, and therefore he has turned to us for a loan in order to make it possible to purchase the cow and branch out into raising that breed. Moreover, he will obtain high-quality milk. He will be able to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Gertrude's Group

texts.en:
Gertrude N. is the leader of her group and a business lady with a retail shop as her business. She is a married lady with 5 children and she cares for one cousin. The loans have been so helpful especially now that her husband has two wives and his attention towards his children and family is all divided.

Gertrude uses her loans to buy more products for the shop like sugar, cooking oil, flour, etc., and as a result the profits and savings help to run her home. She is also a farmer on a small scale and this food enables her to save the money she would have used on buying food to pay school fees and clothe her children. She needs another loan for her shop, to expand it.

loans.use: expanding the inventory of her small shop

loans.name: Uldash

texts.ru: Мамадаминов Юлдош житель города Яван. Проживает со своей семьей . Возраст 66 лет. Имеет шестерых детей. Дети уже довольно взрослые и помогают отцу. Занимаются все вместе земледелием. Имеют арендованный участок земли, который засеивают пшеницей. Планируемый кредит хотят использовать для покупки семян и удобрений. Полученный урожай  реализуют на рынке и смогут получить неплохой доход. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Uldash M. resides in the town of Yavan, where he lives with his family. He is 66 years old and has six grown children who help their father. Together, they farm a rented parcel of land, which they sow with wheat. They want to use the loan to purchase seed and fertilizer. The harvest will be sold in the market for a reasonable profit. Uldash will be able to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.en:
Mrs. Teodosia G., a 41-year-old mother of two children in San Vicente, Dapitan City, is married to a laborer.  Because surviving only on his income was difficult, she started a sari-sari, a small convenience store, selling primarily to the people in her neighbourhood.  

With the help of financing from the Paglaum Cooperative, which she joined last April, she has been able to finance the daily needs of her family. Having already received and repaid three loans, she is now requesting $225 to purchase additional stocks for her store. 

Teodosia is looking forward to seeing her sari-sari develop into a mini-mart someday.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Ruzigul

texts.ru: Музафарова Рузигуль живет в городе Яван. Домохозяйка , но имеет зозяйство , где разводит крупно рогатый скот. В данный момент у нее возникла проблема с комбикормом для животных. Поэтому она решила получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить сено и другого вида комбикорма. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.Рузигуль  40 лет и у нее есть шестеро детей , которые ей помогают ухаживать за животными.
texts.en:
Ruzigul M. lives in the town of Yavan. She is a housewife, but she also has a farm where she raises cattle. She now has a problem with animal feed and has decided to take out a loan to purchase hay and other types of fodder. She will be able to repay the loan within 12 months. Ruzigul is 40 years old and has six children who help her care for the animals.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hay

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
M. Esther is a very hardworking lady who owns and operates a retail shop. In fact, she has operated her shop for the past 8 years.

This is the 7th loan she has requested on behalf of her group, and she notes that her shop has been doing extremely well ever since she started receiving loans. More specifically, as a result of the prior loans, her shop is well-stocked with goods and thus attracts many customers because her customers know that they can find whatever they need at her shop. Accordingly, she has generated savings which has thereby enabled her to pay for her children's school fees, purchase cows (which produce milk for her family), and secure a plot of land. She is now seeking another loan to re-stock her shop with additional goods.

loans.use: To further expand her retail shop by purchasing additional goods (e.g., sugar, soap, powder, cooking oil, and cereals)

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Mrs. Alma T., a 32-year-old married woman with 4 kids, lives in Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a fisherman.  She and her husband only received elementary-level education, so they know that they cannot obtain high-paying jobs.  

Nevertheless, they have a great deal of determination and courage and, as a result, they applied for membership at Paglaum MPC because they had heard of the cooperative's lending operations.  They have often thought about venturing into the fishing and fish-selling business, but they had insufficient capital on hand to get the business of the ground.  

Due to her desire to help her husband, she applied for a loan in the amount of Php 10,000 from the cooperative. Their neighbors are their customers, yet such neighbors also display their goods and products in the market.  The small business is doing so well that she has now decided to expand the business and to hopefully one day own a pumpboat of their own.  Alma is able to pay her loan on a timely basis, so she is always in good standing with her loan.  In the future, she wants to make sure that all of her children complete their studies. She has high hopes that God will bless their business.

loans.use: To expand the business by purchasing a fish net and other fishing accessories

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
A 33-year-old woman from Biasong, Analyn V. is coping with with the challenges of her fishing business. Mrs. Analyn V., married with 2 kids, started her business from a mere capital of Php 3,000. She joined Paglaum MPC for the chance to receive loans. Her husband who is a fisherman is very supportive in taking care of their business.

They bring their catch to the nearest market and even sell some around their barangay. The small business has been doing so well that she confidently decided to expand. She has it in mind to maintain a good credit standing, and then, whatever may happened, she can always run to the cooperative. She envisions acquiring an additional fishing boat. She also dreams of renovating their little house and saving now for education for their children.

loans.use: additional capital for fishing business

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida B. is 46 years old with six children. She is married to a fisherman who works in tandem for fish selling. Zenaida and her husband manage their fishing business which started from a small sailboat. She also has floaters to help guard their fish cages. As much as possible, they have to have all the needed fishing accessories so there would be no chance of low or zero catch. Zenaida personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities.

She became a member of Paglaum MPC, and Zenaida has been a member in good standing for almost 3 years now. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to Php 15,000 for the purchase of new nets and to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish at the nearby fish market. In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from their daily sales. She wishes to see their children have stable jobs.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment needed for fishing

loans.name: Hosamoh

texts.ru: Рахмонова Хосамох проживает в городе Яван. Замужем и имеет пятерых детей. нигде не работает , но дома имеет небольшое хозяйство , где имеет несколько голов крупно и мелкорогатого скота. Для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье животных хочет получить кредит и купить одного породистго бычка. Это сможет дать ей возможность получать породистое потомство. погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 есяцев.
texts.en:
Hosamoh R. lives in the town of Yavan. She is married and has five children. She does not work outside the home, but has a small farm where she has several head of large and small-horned cattle. To increase the size of the herd, she would like to take out a loan to purchase a purebred bull. This would enable her to acquire purebred offspring. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Niyozbibi

texts.ru: Халилова Ниезбиби живет в городе Яван.Возраст 39 лет , замужем и имеет двоих детей. Занимается животноводством уже 5 лет. Имеет хозяйство . Обратилась за кредитом для того, чтобы купить еще одну дойную корову. Получаемое молоко сможет продавать соседям и таким образом сможет получить дополнительную прибыль. Погасить  кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Niyozbibi H. lives in the town of Yavan. She is 39 years old, married and has two children. She has a farm, and for the past five years has raised cattle. She has applied for a loan in order to purchase an additional milk cow. She will be able to sell the milk to the neighbors and realize a reasonable profit. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow

loans.name: Uguloy

texts.ru: Джураева Угулой проживает в городе Яван.Пять лет назад оствалась одна с четырьмя детьми на руках. Ее муж умер и теперь она одна обеспечивает и воспитывает своих детей. Взяв в руки  дело мужа , а он занимался куплепродажей крупно-рогатого скота , сама занялась этим делом. Доход получаемый от ее дела хватает только , чтобы прокормить семью. Она планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы купить еще одного бычка . Таким образом у нее будет дополнительная возможность заработать. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Uguloy J. lives in the town of Yavan. Five years ago she became a single parent of four children. Her husband died and now she supports and raises the children by herself. She took over her husband's business, the buying and selling of cattle, and now does the work herself. The income she receives from this business is just enough to feed the family. She plans to take out a loan to buy another bull, giving her an additional source of revenue. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Quvat

texts.ru: Адинаев Куват житель одного из отдаленных кишлаков города Яван.Женат и имеет шестерых детей. Работает в средней школе -учителем начальных классов. Кроме того , занимается животноводством. Каждую неделю в четверг и в воскресенье ходит на рынок , где покупает и перепродает бычков. Кредит запрашивает для того. чтобы увеличить товарооборот и таким образом получить большую прибыль. Это улучшит его финансовое положение . Погасить кредит сможет в течение 18 месяцев.
texts.en:
Quvat O. lives in a village on the outskirts of Yavan. He is married and has six children. He works as a elementary school teacher, and raises cattle as a sideline. Every week on Thursday and Sunday he goes to market where he buys and sells cattle. He is requesting a loan in order to increase turnover and, as a result, profits. This will improve his financial position. He will be able to repay the loan within 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Changiloy

texts.ru: Бобоерова Чангилой проживает в городе Яван. Домохозяйка.Замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Единственным источником дохода ее семьи является животноводство. Они вместе с мужем занимаются разведением крупно-рогатого скота. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы закупить сено и комбикорм. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Changiloy B. lives in the town of Yavan. She is a housewife and has six children. Her family's sole source of income is raising cattle, which she and her husband care for together. She would like a loan to purchase hay and feed. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hay

loans.name: Olena

texts.en:
Olena is a married woman with two children, Natalia and Dmytro. She sells men's clothing at a city market. She explains that her business is in a good location and that she sells such clothes for affordable prices, which makes for a successful business.

Olena has been in this business for 10 years. She decided to work for herself in order to help her husband, Dmytro, provide for their family. Her long-term goal is to raise their two children with her husband.

Olena is seeking a loan in the amount of 3,000 UAH to expand her inventory. More specifically, she would like to purchase more winter clothing and to thereby generate an increase in sales.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional clothes

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is a married woman with one 12-year-old daughter. She sells various men's and women's clothing. By doing so, her gross monthly income is approximately 3,000 UAH.

Svetlana only recently (less than one year ago) started her business with the help of one of her friends. Svetlana's goal is to expand her business in order to make it a stable source of income for the benefit of her family.

Svetlana is now seeking a loan in the amount of 4,000 UAH over a term of 8 months. She plans on increasing her inventory of clothes to attract more clients and to thereby generate an increase in sales.

loans.use: To expand her business and to attract more customers by purchasing additional clothes

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice A. is a single parent with one child. She has been educated through junior high school.

Since 2003, Beatrice has been selling groceries such as biscuits and canned goods at Brofobabahu in Elmina. She does so because she is responsible for paying her child's school fees, rent, utility bills, and other daily living expenses.

She is now seeking a loan in order to buy more groceries because she has seen an increase in demand from her customers. With the loan proceeds, she expects to generate an increase in her business's profits, which would enable her to save towards a house for her family.

loans.use: To expand her business and to meet her customers' demands by purchasing additional groceries

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence M., who has sold groceries and footwear since 1998 in Elmina, is married to a fisherman and has four dependents.  Responsible for caring for her family's financial needs and the children's school fees, Florence is requesting a loan to meet increased customer demand for groceries and footwear. 

She hopes to put the increased profits from her business toward a house for her children.

loans.use: To increase her stock of groceries and footwear to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Mrs. Elvie P., married with 5 children, is 40 years of age and a resident of Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. They have a little fishing business from which they earn a meagre income. What challenges Elvie is living with a big family to feed. It's exhausting managing their business well, and she and her husband work in tandem to sell their catch at the nearest market. Sometimes, wholesale buyers from other towns and cities come to buy their fish. They want to save enough for their children's studies. They are assured of Paglaum’s help, should there be a need for working capital.

Full of hope, Elvie wants to expand her business. She wants to sustain it as this is their only means of income.

loans.use: Capital for fishing

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie S. is a 29-year-old married woman with 3 children. Both she and her husband were deprived of higher education (they only attended elementary school) and their humble abode is a nipa hut, consisting of bamboo and recycled materials.

She and her husband can only afford to operate a fishing business to generate income for the benefit of their family. Their daily sales provide just enough income to cover the family's living expenses, but they have had to make difficult decisions along the way. For instance, they have three children to raise and to feed, and the couple almost did not send their children to school due to their limited income. However, she and her husband are determined to see to it that their children live a better life and have more opportunities than they had.

As a result, Rosalie and her husband patiently and politely sought assistance in the form of a capital infusion for their fishing business. They are extremely thankful for Paglaum MPC, which helped to initially finance their business. They are now seeking a loan in the amount of Php 20,000 to purchase a fishing boat, a fish net, and other fishing accessories. At this time, they are satisfied to be able to maintain their current business and to have access to Paglaum, which allows poor people like Rosalie to better their lives.

loans.use: To expand and improve the business by purchasing fishing accessories (e.g., a fishing boat, a fish net, etc.)

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia E. is a married woman who has 6 dependants. She received schooling through junior high. Her husband is a trader.

Since 2000, Emilia has been in the business of selling pastries and groceries (e.g., biscuits and canned products) at Elmina. Emilia uses her business's income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills, and other basic expenses of their family.

Emilia is now seeking a loan in order to purchase a new oven with which to make her pastries (because her current oven has many problems) and also to purchase additional groceries for her store. With the expected increase in profits from her expanded business, Emilia plans to save towards a house that she wants to build for her children.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing a new oven (for making pastries) and additional groceries

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
For Liza J., being a helpful and loving wife is what life is all about. Residing in Usocan, the Municipality of Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, she and her husband operate a fish vending business, which generates income to meet the family's daily living expenses. Liza and her husband work very hard, and they want nothing more than to raise their child well and to provide the child with a good education.

On a daily basis, Liza’s husband goes to the port early in the morning to buy batches of fish from the big fishermen. Liza, meanwhile, will sell the fish by packaging the fish in foams, pails, and plastic basins, and by walking around with a scale to weigh the fish for her customers.

Even so, it is extremely difficult for Liza to sell fish on the move; further, she understands that there are more potential customers at a set location (i.e., a market) and thus another way to sell more fish than she is currently selling. As a result, Liza is in need of capital in the amount of PHP 7,000 to rent a space in the wet market where she can sell their fish. In turn, she expects to generate an increase in profits, which would be used by her husband to buy more than the usual batches of fish he is currently buying from the fish wholesalers.

loans.use: To improve her business by renting space at the fish market

loans.name: Aubrey

texts.en:
Aubrey V., a hardworking, single, 31-year-old mother of one child, resides in Migcanaway, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental with her mother. In 2004, with initial capital of PHP 50, Aubrey started a business of selling ice to schools and to her neighbors. However, Aubrey was hoping to operate a business that would generate more profits than her current business and that would not cause her to leave her only child at home.

As a result, on December 18, 2008, with some help from her mother, Aubrey opened up a sari-sari store despite the fact that her start-up capital was insufficient to purchase all of the goods needed for her store. Accordingly, Aubrey is seeking a loan in the amount of PHP 20,000 to buy all of the goods needed for her store and to be able to properly market her products. In addition, the loan proceeds will be used to sustain and/or expand her ice-making business. Aubrey firmly believes that, by operating businesses such as these, she will be able to raise her child well and to ensure that the child receives a good education.

loans.use: To develop her new business (a sari-sari store) by purchasing materials and marketing her products while sustaining her original business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn Q., 41 years of age, resides at Bernad Subdivision, Aguada, Ozamis City. She is married to a utility worker working for one of the leading telecommunication companies and she has 2 children studying at Ozamis City School of Arts, 2nd year and 3rd year student respectively. 


Hypo retailing is her business, she deal it to her neighbors, office workers, and housewives. Hypo is used for bleaching purposes. She engage also in retailing kerosene, vegetables, fruits. But she is more likely having a cup of tea of Hypo retail business. 


In connection with this, Jocelyn needed an amount PHP 10,000.00, to expand her Hypo retail business. As it is in demand, and if ever she would gain more income from it, she could finance her other side of business which is vegetables, kerosene, fruits retailing. 


Does, it would be a great help to her if she has such business like these. She wish also to send her children to the best school to insure the future life of it.

loans.use: additional capital for hypo bleach retail

loans.name: Florifes

texts.en:
Florifes T. is a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, living at P5-San Apolinario St, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. Florifes is the breadwinner of the family, and a mother of 3 children: a second year student, sixth grader and an infant.

Florifes has an existing business, which is a Sari-Sari store. The capital that she had for putting up the Sari-Sari store was from the funds she got by selling 2 pigs that she raised. As the breadwinner of the family, she must strive to sustain the needs of her family and her children. Florifes needs PHP 5,000.00 and she will be using the funds to buy enough goods to sell from her store, like canned goods, junk foods, school supplies, and others.

Florifes is grateful to those who want to help her in the business.

loans.use: Additional capital for the Sari-Sari store

location.town: P5-San Apolinario, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen D. sells food supplies at the Elmina new market. Doreen has received junior high education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a sawmill operator. Doreen has been selling food supplies since 2000. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more food supplies to meet the increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards a house she wants to put up for the children.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more food supplies to meet the increase in demand by her customers.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian L. is blessed with a child and is a resident of Recto St., 50th District, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. As a single parent, she is determined to raise her only daughter, who is kindergarten school, appropriately. 


She has a "sari-sari" store, and the capital that she put up from the start was only PHP 1,000 that she got from her aunt. Her sari-sari store is located near a school at Ozamiz City. She cannot meet the demand of her customers because the goods and supplies that she has are not enough. 


She needs PHP 5,000 additional capital to purchase goods and supplies needed in her sari-sari store. And someday if she gets lucky in business she will purchase a photocopy machine for added income.

loans.use: additional capital for her sari-sari store

location.town: Recto St.- 50th District, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina D. is married and has 4 dependants. She has received no formal education. Faustina sells shoes and fabric, as well as fish which she buys from the fishermen, brings home for processing and preservation, and then sends to the market for sale at the Elmina new market, which she has done since 2000.

Faustina uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Faustina will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Faustina plans to add to her husband's savings to acquire a piece of land to build their family house.

loans.use: Faustina will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret M. is a divorced woman who has two children. Thus, she is solely responsible for paying her children’s school fees, rent, utility bills, and other living expenses of the family. She notes that she has received education through junior high.

To support her children, Margaret sells food supplies at Santiwadzi in Elmina, which she has been doing since 1996. She is now seeking a loan to buy more food supplies and groceries in order to meet the increase in demand by her customers. In turn, she hopes to generate an increase in profits so that she can further invest in her children's education.

loans.use: To expand her business and to meet customer demand by purchasing additional food supplies and groceries

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence M. is a married woman with three children. She has received schooling through senior high, and her husband is a secretary.

Since 1998, Florence has been in the business of selling soft drinks at Santiwadzi in Elmina. Florence uses her business's income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills, and other basic living expenses of their family. Florence is now requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks because she has seen an increase in demand by her customers. As a result, she expects to generate an increase in profits from her expanded business, which Florence would use to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: To expand her business and to meet customer demand by purchasing additional soft drinks

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua B. is a married woman with two children. Sadly, she notes that she has received no formal education. Her husband is a fisherman.

Efua and her husband are in the fish-selling industry. Specifically, her husband buys fish from other fishermen and brings the fish home for processing and preservation purposes, and then Efua sells the fish at the market at Tatermu in Elmina. Efua explains that she has been in this line of business since 1998 and that she uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills, and other basic living expenses of their family.

Efua is now seking a loan in order to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and re-sale. With the expected increase in profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to reinvest in her business so as to continue to meet the financial needs of her ever-expanding family.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing fish in larger quantities

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena P. is married and has one child. She has received schooling through junior high. Her husband is a trader.

Since 2002, Philomena has been in the fish-selling industry. More specifically, her husband purchases fish from other fishermen and brings the fish home for processing and preservation, and then she sells such fish at the market at Tatermu in Elmina. Philomena explains that she uses her business's income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills, and other basic living expenses of their family.

Philomena is now requesting a loan to purchase more food supplies and fresh fish in order to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the expected increase in profits from her expanded business, Philomena plans to invest in her child's education.

loans.use: To expand her business and to meet customer demand by purchasing additional food supplies and fresh fish

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort M. is a married woman with two children. She has received schooling through junior high. Her husband is a fisherman.

Since 2002, Comfort has been in the business of selling groceries (e.g., biscuits and canned products) and fish. With respect to her fish-selling operation, her husband buys the fish from other fishermen, brings the fish home for processing and preservation, and then Comfort sells the fish at the market at Tatermu in Elmina. By doing so, Comfort is able to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills, and other basic living expenses of their family.

She is now seeking a loan in order to buy more fresh fish, firewood, and groceries. With the expected increase in profits from her expanded business, she would like to both reinvest in her business and to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional fresh fish, firewood, and groceries

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina T. sells clothing and fish which she buys from the fishermen, bringing them home for processing and preservation, and then sending them to the market for sale at Tatermu in Elmina. Justina has received no formal education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a military man.

Justina has been selling clothing and fish since 1998. She is responsible for helping her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more clothing and fresh fish to meet the increase in the demand for her goods. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into the business and save toward a house she wants to build with her husband for the family.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more clothing and fresh fish for re-sale

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis T. is married and has 4 dependents. She has received no formal education. Mavis cooks rice for sale at Bantama in Elmina, which she has done since 2005. Her husband is a businessman. Mavis uses her income to help her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family.

Mavis will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to buy more rice and other ingredients to meet the demand of her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mavis plans to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more rice and other ingredients for cooking dishes for sale

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina N. is married and has 3 children. She has received schooling through senior high. Faustina sells electrical items at Bantama, which she has done for a while now. Her husband works with a credit union.

Faustina uses her income to help her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Faustina will use the loan to purchase more electrical parts for her store. With the new profits from her expanded business, Faustina plans to reinvest back into the business to increase her profit margin so as to meet the financial needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more electrical parts for the store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. sells a local porridge popularly called ‘cooco’; millet is used in the preparation of this kind of porridge. Her customers are mostly those who leave home early for work without having their breakfast. Her business is located at Bantama. Elizabeth has received junior high education. She is divorced and has 2 children.

Elizabeth has been selling this local porridge popularly called 'cooco' since 2006. She is responsible for paying the children’s school fees, and also rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more millet and other ingredients for the preparation of the porridge. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more millet and other ingredients for the preparation of the porridge

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose K. is married and has 5 dependents. She has received no formal education. Rose sells food supplies at Bantama, which she has done for a while now. Her husband is a fisherman. Rose uses her income to help her husband in paying rent, utility bills, and other basic expenses of the family.

Rose will use the loan to purchase more food supplies and groceries to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose plans to reinvest back into the business to increase her profit margin so as to meet the financial needs of her large family size.

loans.use: to purchase more food supplies and groceries for re-sale

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa K. is married and has 1 child. She has attended school through primary level. Theresa sells groceries such as biscuits, andcanned products. She also buys fish from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at Bantama, which she has done for a while now. Her husband is a teacher. Theresa helps support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. She  will use the loan to purchase more groceries to meet the increase in demand from her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Theresa plans to reinvest back into the business to increase her profit margin so as to meet the financial needs of her large family.

loans.use: To purchase more food supplies and groceries to meet the increase in demand from her costumers.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua A. is married and has 3 children. She has received no formal education. Efua sells pomade, baby oil and other cosmetics. She also trades in food supplies at Bantama, which she has done for a while now. Her husband is a fisherman. Efua uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Efua will use the loan to purchase more cosmetics and food supplies for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to reinvest back into the business to increase her profit margin so as to meet the financial needs of her large family.

loans.use: Efua will use the loan to purchase more cosmetics and food supplies for resale.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa O. has enjoyed her more than 8 years of association with Paglaum Munlti Purpose Cooperative, a partner through thick and thin for her business.  Its a daily challenge for her to meet her loan payments on time but this has now become a habit.  Jesusa at 59 years old, a widow and has 12 children. She tells us with pride that she is able to nurture all her children well.  Finishing a degree was far out of sight for her and she only reached 3rd year high school. But, with the skills of dressmaking, she was able to feed her children and provide them with good education.  

She hs applied with Paglaum MPC, for a loan of Php 15,000.  With this loan she will purchase additional sewing materials. She wants to expand her business, employ 1 dressmaker, and have all her children finished their studies.

loans.use: To purchase sewing  materials

loans.name: Elaine

texts.en:
Mrs. Elaine P., 41 years of age, is happily married with 4 children. They live comfortably at Barra Puntod, Lopez Jaena. Fishing and fish vending are their means of survival. Raising their children has been quite a challenge, with their day-to-day experiences at sea and retailing in the neighborhood. The ups and downs of their business, health and education of their children are a continuing everyday undertaking.

According to Elaine, fishing is the life of her family and she will maintain it until she grows old. Her humble aspiration is simply to have a daily income to support their needs and basic necessities. She also would like to own 3 pumpboats and additional capital for fishing. In this way, she would be able to uplift their way of living.

loans.use: To aquire a fishing boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn Q., 41 years of age, resides at Bernad Subdivision, Aguada, Ozamis City. She is married to a utility worker, working for one of the leading telecommunication companies and she has 2 children studying at Ozamis City School of Arts, 2nd year and 3rd year students respectively.

Hypo-retailing is her business; she sells to her neighbors, to office workers, and to housewives. Hypo is used for bleaching purposes. She is also engaged in retailing kerosene, vegetables, and fruits. But she is more likely earning her living with the Hypo retail business.

In connection with this, Jocelyn needs the amount of PHP 10,000, to expand her Hypo retail business, as it is in demand, and if ever she would gain more income from it, she could finance the other side of her business which is vegetables, kerosene, and fruit retailing.

She wishes also to send her children to the best schools to insure their future lives.

loans.use: additional capital for expanding her Hypo bleach retail business

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
A mother of 2 children and a loving wife to her husband Rodolfo F., that is Judith F., 51 years old and residing at P3, Barangay III, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. Judith and her husband started a business raising pigs in their piggery. At first, they had a capital of PHP 2,000 and 2 piglets. They fed them until they became sows in November 2007. Presently they have 25 piglets and 4 sows.

Rodolfo F., Judith’s husband is a carpenter but currently taking charge of raising their pigs and helping Judith as well in the business. But still, they needed extra capital to meet their demands and all the things needed in their piggery (i.e. feed, vitamins etc.)

Judith and her husband are looking forward to their business expanding. They need the amount of PHP 15,000 to insure that their business will go on the right track. As they grow their pigs, they also want to raise their 2 children well and to give them a better education so they will have a better future.

loans.use: additional capital for piggery business

location.town: P3-Barangay III, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Mrs. Riza P. lives in Purok 4 Barra, Puntod, Lopez Jaena, one of the coastal areas in the Municipality of Lopez Jaena. She is married as young as 22 years old and is blessed with 1 child. Her husband supports his family with their fishing business as they own one fishing boat. 

In April 2008, she officially registered as a member of Paglaum MPC and has availed herself of the various programs and services of the cooperative. Their main source of income is derived from the selling of fresh fish. Being a member in good standing, she always pays attention to her loans. She now wants financial assistance amounting to PHP 10,000 for the purchase of a fishing boat. Through this project, she dreams of obtaining additional income in order to educate their son and uplift their quality of living.

loans.use: To acquire a fishing boat

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is 25 years old and has one child. She sells women's skirts and slacks at one of the city markets. Her income is about 3,000 UAH per month.

Natalya has been in this business for 3 years. Good location and a positive attitude towards customers have helped Natalia to develop her business. This business is the only source of income in the family.

Natalya is asking for a loan of 5,000 UAH to increase the inventory. She hopes to increase her sales and make additional profit and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married and has one son. She owns a small business that sells jeans at the market. Svetlana has been in this business for 10 years. She was able to develop this business to have several locations. She always tries to have large assortment and good quality at affordable prices. Her business goal is to build a small store.

Svetlana is asking for a loan of 7,500 UAH to increase her assortment. She hopes to make additional profit and pay her son's university tuition.

loans.use: to increase her assortment

loans.name: Leydi De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña Leydi tiene 30 años de edad, habita en sabana grande en la ciudad de Managua, con dos hijos de 1 y 7 años de edad, su esposo se desempeña de mecánico en una empresa privada, ella es un joven que se dedica a cuidar a  su familia,  como en las ventas de cosméticos y ropa, que inicio desde hace cinco años para apoyar a los gastos, que comenzó con dinero que su esposo dio y con prestamos en Afodenic, que ha sido de muchos beneficios para desarrollarse en su negocio  así como poder tomar medio tiempo para ofertar a sus clientes sus productos ya que por las mañana le toca hacer el aseo de su casa. Con la solicitud de prestamos va invertir en la compra de ropa escolar ya que los alumnos están por ingresar a clase y se vende mucho espera obtener con estas ventas buenos ingresos, sus objetivos es poder crecer en inventario y ventas ya que sus metas a futuro es tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Leydi is 30 years old and lives in Sabana Grande of Managua city. She has two children ages 1 and 7. Her husband works as a mechanic in a private business, while she is a young woman who takes care of her family by selling cosmetics and clothing. She began her business 5 years ago to help with the expenses, beginning with money her husband gave her and loans from Afodenic, which have been a great help in growing her business so she is able to work part time offering her clients products and in the mornings take care of her household chores. With the loan she is going to invest in buying school clothing as the students are getting ready to begin class and she can sell a lot. With these sales she hopes to receive good income. Her objectives are to be able to grow her inventory and sales in order to have a store in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school clothing and supplies

loans.name: Luisa Veronica

texts.es: Luisa E. es una joven que a sus 25 años de edad, tiene su propio negocio de tortillas que comenzó desde chica ayudando a su mama ya que esa ha sido la fuente de ingresos para sacarlos adelante, es madre soltera con una niña de 7 años de edad, que esta cursando la primaria este negocio lo tiene independiente desde hace seis años, que con ahorro y solicitudes de prestamos que ha hecho en Afodenic ha logrado poder establecerse para vender sus tortillas, es un trabajo cansado y se agita mucho pero se vende bastante ya que a los Nicaragüenses se caracterizan por que gustan  mucho de su alimento de la tortilla de maíz, con la solicitud va a comprar materia prima como: maíz, cal, leña, en cantidad, para ofertar a comedores sus ricas tortillas, y poder captar clientes en diferentes comercios.
texts.en:
Luisa E. is a 25 year old young woman who has her own tortilla business that she began in as a young girl, helping her mother. This has been her source of income, as she is a single mother of a 7 year old daughter currently in elementary school. She has had this business for six years, with her savings and loans that she has made from Afodenic she has been able to establish herself as a tortilla vender. It is tiring work and she works hard but she sells a lot because Nicaraguans like their corn tortillas. With the loan she is going to buy ingredients like corn, calcium, quantity of firewood so she may be able to sell her delicious tortillas to restaurants and cafes and be able to gain new customers in different businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy large quantities of corn and firewood in order to make more tortillas

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Maritza reside en la fuente del colegio 3 cuadras al sur, tiene 43 años de edad, con tres hijos de 13, 22,24 años,  dos de ellos trabajan en zona franca, y uno sigue estudiando, su esposo es cadete de taxi. Ella hizo una solicitud del colegio para vender en un Kiosco y poder trabajar para fortalecer en los gastos de la familia, desde hace seis años administra el kiosco, del colegio que comenzó con ahorros y prestamos en Afodenic, que ha sido de mucho beneficios para lograr esta administración, esa es la tercera solicitud que hace la cual va invertir en comprar productos variados para sus ventas como: golosinas, galletas, gaseosa, frutas, y verduras y granos básicos para preparar sus ricos alimentos, y ofertarlos a los niños y adolescentes del colegio. A futuro espera crecer en inventario y poder tener una venta en su casa.
texts.en:
Maritza lives in the La Fuente neighbourhood of Managua, three blocks south of the school. She is 43 years old and has three children who are 13, 22 and 24 years old. Two of them work in the free trade zone, and the other is still in school. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Maritza made a request to the school to run a kiosk, so she could work to support her family's living expenses. She used savings and a loan from Afodenic to open the school kiosk, and she has now managed the kiosk for six years. This is her third loan from Afodenic, and she will use the money to buy various products including snack food, cookies, soft drink, fruit, vegetables and staple grains in order to prepare her delicious food for the children and teenagers in the school. In the future she hopes to increase her inventory and run a shop from her home.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase snack food, fruit, staple grains

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Esperanza, es una mujer trabajadora, con deseo de mejorar su  vivienda, y poder ver su casa bonita y con mas protección de la delincuencia, tiene 44 años de edad, reside en Memorial Sandino en la ciudad de Managua con un esposo y dos hijos de 13 y 14 años de edad, que estudian la secundaria, su esposo trabaja en servicio de seguridad, el negocio de doña Esperanza es el alquiler de cuartos, a demás de eso vende helados, alquila teléfono, inicio para apoyar a sus esposo con los gastos ya que su salario es bien bajo y no alcanzaba con los gastos de la casa, esta es la quinta solicitud que hace en Afodenic pues ha sido de mucho beneficios para su familia ya que ha podido hacer mejoras a su casa, con esta solicitud va a invertir en la construcción de un muro en la parte de enfrente de su casa ya que lo tiene con hojas de zinc e inseguro, esto permitirá darle una mejor presentación a su humilde casa a si como estar segura. Sus planes a futuro es poder tener un negocio q le permita obtener mejores ingreso a si como seguir invirtiendo en la infraestructura de su casa para dejar a sus hijas en buen patrimonio.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a very hard-worker, and hopes to improve her home so that it both looks nicer and has better protection against crime. She is 44 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino district of Managua with her husband and two children, who are 13 and 14 years old. Her children are in secondary school, and her husband works in the security business. Esperanza's business is housing rentals, and in addition to this she also sells icecream and rents telephones. She started her business in order to help her husband with the living expenses, as his salary is very low and didn't cover all of the household costs. This is the fifth loan she has received from Afodenic. The previous loans have been of great benefit to her family as they have financed improvements to their home. This loan will be used to build a wall in front of their home, as the current wall is made of sheets of zinc and is not secure. This wall will improve the appearance of their humble home and make it more secure. Esperanza's plans for the future are to have her own business bringing in increased profits. This will allow her continue to invest in improving her home, which she will be able to leave to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase building materials for a front wall

loans.name: Idalia Maria

texts.es: Doña Idalia tiene 37 años de edad, habita en Hialeah II etapa en la ciudad de Managua su negocio es una tienda de ropa y zapatos, también vende refrescos desde hace ocho años esta en la venta que inicio con ahorro, tiene un hijo de 16 años de edad, que estudia y por las tarde le ayuda en la venta. Para aumentar su inventario y ofertar productos variados a su clientela hizo solicitud de crédito en Afodenic lo cual se siente apoyada y beneficiada por sus préstamo con este es el octavo lo cual va ha invertir en la compra de útiles escolares ya que viene el ingreso a clase y se vende mucho. Sus objetivos es implementar nuevos segmentos de mercado en donde sastifaga las necesidades del cliente, sus planes es poder ayudar a su hijo a que cierre el ciclo de sus estudios para que sea un hombre profesional.
texts.en:
Doña Idalia is 37 and lives in the Hialeah II neighborhood of Managua. She has a clothing and shoe store, which also offers soft drinks. She started her business eight years ago with her own savings. She has a 16-year-old son who goes to school, and then helps out in the store in the afternoons. Idalia is requesting a loan from AFODENIC so she can increase her inventory and offer a variety of products to her customers. She feels that the loans support and benefit her. This will be her eighth loan, which she will invest in school supplies. They will sell well since classes start soon. She plans to enter new market segments where she can meet her customers' needs. Her son is finishing up his studies, and Idalia's goal is to help him become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Juana María es una mujer que vive sola ,  que ha demostrado que luchando 14 horas de trabajo diarias se puede salir adelante y lograr tener una vida mas cómoda, a la señora le acaban de entregar su casita 
Pero le están haciendo falta las protecciones , es por ello que ella esta solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana Maria is a woman who lives by herself. She has proven that 14-hour work days can make you a successful person and will give you a more comfortable life. She has just received her new home but needs some kind of protection.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Security for her house

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Mrs. Laxmi K. lives in Bhakepati Village. Bhakepati is located in Kathmandu district. Bhakepati is one of the developing villages of Kathmandu district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming.

Mrs. K. lives in a nuclear family with her husband, one son and one daughter. Both her son and daughter are studying in grade 10.

Both Mrs. K. and her husband Mr. Ram K. are engaged in the same grocery shop. They opened their grocery shop 5 years ago. They sell various types of grocery items such as rice, maize, pulses, biscuits, and noodles in their shop. Their children also help them in their work. Now Mrs. K. is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs 20,000 to buy grocery items to meet the demand.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Bina

texts.en:
Bina B. lives in a nuclear family with her husband, Mr. Ram Saran B., and a son. She lives in Balkhu, Kathmandu. Most of the people in this region are engaged in running small businesses like grocery stores. Her husband works in private office. Her son is in pre-primary school.

Mrs. B. opened her small tea room 2 years ago to strengthen the economic conditions of her family. She sells different varieties of food items in her shop. Especially, she prepares Nepali food such as DalBhat (rice) to sell in her shop. She also sells tea and coffee. Her tea room is small but very popular in her locality. So Mrs. B. is requesting a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy necessary food ingredients for her shop.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make food to sell

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Mrs. Laxmi D. lives in Balkhu, Kathmandu. She has four members including herself in her family. She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade 1 and her daughter is in nursery school.

Both Mrs. D. and Mr. D. are engaged in running their own same shoe shop. They opened their shoe shop five years ago in the town of Balkhu. Especially, they sell school and college leather shoes for both boys and girls. They also sell party shoes in their shop. Due to the increasing demand for shoes Mrs. D. is requesting Rs20,000 as a loan to buy different items of shoes for both boys and girls.

loans.use: To buy different types of shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Pratima

texts.en:
Miss Pratima R. lives in Thikhidewol, Lalitpur and is a tailor. She opened her tailoring shop one year ago. She took a six-month training course in tailoring from a tailor shop near her locality.

Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies' dresses such as the Kurta Sulwar which are very popular with Nepali women. She makes dresses according to orders she gets from her customers. Now she is requesting her first loan of Rs10,000 to buy raw materials for her tailoring work.

She lives with her father, mother, one brother and one sister. Her father is a laborer in house construction work. Both her brother and sister are now studying.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan L. is 42 years old with one child. She is married to a fisherman and they work together at fish selling. She and her husband manage their fishing business, which they started with just a small sailboat. Mrs. L. personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities. She became a member of Paglaum MPC, and she has been a member in good standing for almost 8 years.

Recently, a loan of Php 12,000 was requested for the purchase of new nets and to have additional working capital for their fishing business. They are tempted by the idea of expanding their fishing activities as they want to buy the fish catch of their neighbors and sell more fish at the nearby fish market. With numerous plans in her mind, Mrs. L. dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from their daily sales and of saving also for their old age.

loans.use: additional capital for fishing and buying additional fish nets

location.town: Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Manju

texts.en:
Mrs. Manju S. is a resident of Balkhu. She lives in a nuclear family with her husband, a daughter, and a son. Her husband, Mr. Bishnu S., works in a private office. The income of her family is so low their life is very miserable. They hardly can fulfill their needs. She can't provide good education for her children. 

Mrs. S. is a farmer. She has her own land. She grows various green vegetables. Most of the farmers in Nepal depend on seasonal farming due to the lack of modern technology. She sells her vegetables in the local market in the mornings and evenings. Now she is requesting Rs10,000 as a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Sarmila

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarmila L. is a resident of Bholdhoka. She lives in a nuclear family with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Raju L., works in private office. Her older son is studying in grade 4 and her younger son is studying in grade 2.

Mrs. L. is engaged running her own vegetable shop. She opened her vegetable shop 9 years ago. She opened her shop to upgrade the living standard of her family. She sells different kinds of green vegetables in her shop. Now she is requesting her first loan of Rs 10,000 to invest in her shop. She is going to buy vegetables, potatoes, and others to be able to sell more. She wants to generate income and change their lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for re-sale

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married with two children. She sells jeans at the city market. Her monthly gross income is 5,000 UAH; the profit is about 2,500 UAH per month.

Valentina started her business 11 years ago. Now she has got two kiosks and many repeat customers. Valentina loves to sell jeans and believes this is what she can do best. The profit from her business has helped this family to fix their old house and put a new heating system in.

Valentina would like to get 7,000 UAH as a loan to increase her inventory. She hopes to increase her sales and help her daughter to purchase home equipment.

loans.use: To Increase her inventory

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
A local vegetable producer for more than 10 years in the rural arE. of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, Sao E., 37, grows cabbages, Chinese kale and morning glories, currently earning about $8 a day. Sao is married to Mr. Ei Veth, 33, who works with her in growing the vegetables, and cares for her three children, all of whom are single and still live in the family home.

Sao E. is running her business well, but unfortunately insects have ravaged her vegetable crop. She is therefore applying for a loan of $100 to buy insecticide to protect her vegetables.

loans.use: To buy insecticide to protect her vegetables.

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Hem S., 41, has operated a grocery store for about 10 years, typically making around $3 each day. She lives in Bati District, Takeo Province, Cambodia, where her husband, S. Thy, 43, pictured with his wife here, is a soldier earning $2 a day. They have two school-aged children. 

Hem is asking for a loan of $1000 to increase her stock of groceries in order to meet client demand.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store.

loans.name: Saom

texts.en:
Saom T. is 52 years old and lives with his wife in the Bati district of Takeo province. He has a business selling banana ice-cream in the village and earns approximately US$2 a day. His wife is a farmer who grows rice. His wife, Nub Kan, 52, pictured here with her husband, has been growing rice since 1987. This couple, together, have three children and all of them are employed as workers.

Mr. Saom T. is asking for a loan to purchase a motorbike to transport ice-cream to sell in the village.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok S. is 28 years old and runs a grocery store to make a living. She is able to earn about US$2.5 a day of profit. Her husband is a construction worker who builds houses. On average, he makes US$2.5 a day. This couple, pictured here, live in Bati district, Takeo province and have one young child. Sok S. is asking a loan to expand her grocery store by adding more products to meet her client’s demand, especially during Chiness New Year.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery products.

loans.name: Leap

texts.en: Leap L., 24, pictured here with his wife, is married and lives with his wife in Bati district, Takeo province, Cambodia. He raises his standard of living by operating a moto-taxi in the village and is able to make US$5 a day. His wife, Om Rem, 22, is a good housewife who stays at home and helps support her family by raising pigs on a plot of land. On average, she makes US$4 a day. This couple together have two young children. Mr. Leap L. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to purchase a motorbike to operate a taxi service.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to operate a taxi service.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun T., 39, is married and lives with her husband in Bati district, Takeo province. She is able to make about US$8 in revenue everyday by working as a weaver from her home. Her husband, Pich Sarenthorn, 37, is a policeman, earning US$5 a day. This couple have four school-aged children. Mrs. Bun T. would like to take out a loan of US$800 to purchase more silk.

loans.use: To purchase more silk.

loans.name: Yim

texts.en: Yim M., 59, is married and lives with her husband and children in Bati district, Takeo province. She and her husband are grocery sellers and are able to make around US$20 everyday in revenue. This couple also has support from two of their five children who are office workers. The other three children are students. Mrs. Yim M. is asking a loan of US$500 to increase her grocery inventory.

loans.use: To increase her grocery inventory.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan M., 35, the married mother of three children, two of whom are students and one a preschooler, lives with her husband in Bati District, Takeo Province. Since 2001, she has been working as a professional tailor, earning about $2 each day, while her husband sells a variety of vegetables in a busy market, earning about $5 a day.

Chan is requesting a loan of $500 to increase the number of vegetables her husband sells in the market.

loans.use: To increase the number of vegetables her husband sells.

loans.name: Florecita

texts.en: Mrs. Florecita D. is 62 years old, a widow and a resident of Southwestern Poblacion, Calamba, Misamis Occidenta. She has been a member in good standing of the cooperative since August 2001. She raised her three children all by herself. Thankfully, all her children had stable jobs.  Since it is hard for her to survive without a stable job on her own, she decided to engage herself in piggery business, a business that she initially considered only a hobby.  She started her business with just one sow. To her surprise, she was able to manage it well and use it to finance her daily needs with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. She was able to avail herself of different types of loans, and paid them religiously. Now, she is applying for a loan of Php 25,000 to finance the construction of her pig cages and purchase 10 bags of animal feed. All she wants for now is to sustain her business and have a healthy life ahead.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and build pig cages

loans.name: Tim

texts.en:
Tim I., 53, pictured wI. her husband, lives in Takeo Province where she is able to make about $50 each day operating a small restaurant selling wines, beers, other alcoholic beverages and soft drinks. Her husband, Em Yun, 57, has a business renting musical instruments. The couple has four children, three employed and one a student.

Mrs. Tim I. would now like to take out a loan of $1200 to purchase a small truck to transport her husband's music equipment.

loans.use: To purchase a small truck.

loans.name: Almend

texts.en: Mrs. Almend C. is 35 years old, married and a resident of Guinabot, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental.  Her husband is a farmer and they are blessed with 1 child. The couple knew that it is hard for them to survive with farming as their only means of living.  Almend decided to engage herself in selling.  She started a sari-sari (mini- grocery) store with a capital of Php 3,000. Their promising customers are their neighbors. They are so much thankful that their business has been growing and is able to finance the daily needs of their family.  Paglaum Cooperative has been a constant partner in all their endeavors.Almend preserves her 3 years membership to PMPC and she was able to avail herself of five loans and paid them regularly without default. Now, she applies for a loan of Php 15,000 to finance the additional stocks to purchase for her sari-sari store. With high hopes, expanding her sari-sari into a Mini-mart someday is all what she wanted.

loans.use: buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Suth

texts.en: Suth N., 40, pictured with her husband, is a mother of three and lives in Bati District, Takeo Province, where she operates a grocery store and earns around $40 every day. Her husband, a construction worker building house, earns about $5 a day.  Suth would now like to take out a loan of $1200 to expand her grocery store in order to meet client demand.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store.

loans.name: Sing

texts.en:
Sing V. is 31 years old and lives with his wife in Bati District, Takeo Province, Cambodia, where he is a self-employed fruit seller earning around $5 each day; his wife is a professional tailor sewing mats, usually making a profit of about $1.50/day. 

In order to improve their standard of living, this couple is currently requesting a loan to purchase a motorbike to transport fruits.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport fruits.

loans.name: Seik

texts.en:
Mrs. Seik S. is a villager in Phnom Sruoch village in Kampong Cham province. She is a pig breeder. Since her pigs have grown bigger and bigger, she does not have enough money to buy pig feed for them. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Kang Misae, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice.

Mrs. Seik S. is a 23-year-old mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband and her children are presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy pig feed for her growing pigs.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Mrs. Luzminda J. is 53 years old, married and a resident of Usocan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  Her husband is a fisherman.  She sells the fish he catches at the public market or to their neighbors.  Life is hard for the family to survive with 7 children to feed.  But it's indeed a challenge for the couple to make effort in making a living especially in sending them to school.

Because they wanted to buy additional materials for fishing like fishing nets, they requested a loan from  Paglaum MPC in the amount of Php 20,000. They set aside an amount for the fishing accessories and at the same time to put up additional capital for their little sari-sari store.  A back-to-back business actually to make a daily income.  Luzminda has 2 productive years of membership to Paglaum. Aside from the financial assistance they received, they also enjoyed other benefits like insurance and savings.  She hopes that with Paglaum's help and patience and her own hard work, she will be a successful vendor someday.

loans.use: purchase of fishing materials and additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Mrs. Sann Chao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people, living in Tuol Khsach village in Kampong Cham province, comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Sann C., the 63-year-old village bank president, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Muon Vanny, helps her in her small farming business. They face an obstacle because they do not have enough money to buy fertilizer to support their field. To deal with this problem, Mrs. Sann C. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the fields, and she would use the rest of loan to purchase fuel to water the field to make her crops more productive. She is the mother of three children who are employed in a garment factory.

One member in this group has a loan that is end-of-term, and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support their field, and various other reasons.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim O. is 39 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Takeo province, Cambodia. Sim's husband is a recycler and earns about $5 per day. Sim O. makes and sells mats at the local market. This business activity generates an average of $2 per day for the family. Sim O. and her husband are the proud parents of four children. Their two oldest has just begun working, and the other two are students.

They plan to use this loan in order to purchase more recycling items so that Sim’s husband can expand his business. In the future, the couple hopes that they will be able to purchase a new trailer for the recycling business.

loans.use: Purchase more recycling items for resale

loans.name: Khean

texts.en:
Khean S. is 27 years old, married, and has one child, who is too young to attend the school. She makes her living by selling Khmer foods to garment factory workers in her village and typically makes a meager profit. To provide for the family's expenses, her husband is a construction worker who usually makes about $5 per day.

Khean S. is requesting a loan for $700 in order to purchase construction tools for her husband. With this loan, she hopes her family will have more income and so increase the family's savings. It is important to say that her family would like to own another business to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase construction tools to increase income

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Cheng A. works making incense in the Takeo province, and earns $2 per day. She is 40 years old; she and her husband (pictured) have four children. Her husband earns $5 per day working as a motor-taxi driver. Chen A. plans to use this loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband's taxi service.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike to operate a taxi service

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Being a hardworking mother best describes Brenda D., 45 years old, residing in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Brenda has 4 children and is married to a fisherman.  The catch that her husband gets isn’t enough to sustain their daily needs as they already have one  of their  children in school. So, Brenda started a business of fish vending in helping his husband's income. 

Brenda wants to expand fish vending business as she wants to gain more profit and have enough to sustain her family, especially for her children so they can enter college. In order for Brenda to make her wish possible, she needs PHP 7,000 additional capital and will use the money to buy more kilos of fish for her fish vending.  She hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her family and seal her membership to Paglaum MPC..

loans.use: purchase additional fish for sale

loans.name: Mrs. Leang Srou Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Thirty-one people, living in Tuol Khsach village in Kampong Cham province, comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Leang S., the 49-year-old village bank president, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a grocer who owns a small grocery store in the local village. She does not have enough money to purchase more grocery goods. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Mrs. Leang S. is a widow with five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, and three are attending the local school. The remaining is too young to work or study. Mr. Oark P. could not come to take a loan but his wife did, so she is presented in the picture. Mrs. Chea Tim, who is a group guaranteer, is also presented in the picture with the village bank members.

Twenty-seven members in this group have loans that are end-of-term, and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery goods for her inventory, and other various loan purposes.

loans.name: Rok

texts.en: Rok S., 33, is married and lives with her husband in Bati district, Takeo province, Cambodia. She is a professional tailor who is able to earn about $3 every day. Her husband (pictured), Nut Sarat, 35, is a motor-taxi driver. On average, he earns $5 a day. This couple has one little child. Mrs. Rok S. is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase a trailer to attach to her husband's motorbike so he can transport goods and people.

loans.use: Purchase trailer to attach to a motorbike to transport goods and people

loans.name: Praing

texts.en:
Mrs. Praing H. is a villager in Tang Roleang village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectar of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces a big obstacle, because her field is far from an irrigation system, which is of course bad for her crops. Thus, she decided to request for a loan to buy a pump machine to water the field.

Her husband, Mr. Souy Kin, is a fisherman. Mrs. Praing H. is 35 years old and the mother of four children. Three are attending the local school, and the youngest is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine in order to irrigate the field.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim T. is 50 years old and sells fruit in the Bati district, Takeo province, Cambodia. She has had her business for about 5 years and she makes $4 every day. Selling fruit has been a difficult business, as there is high inflation and weather conditions that have not been conducive to a good growing season. Her husband is a rice farmer and typically earns less than $1 each day.

Sim T. is asking for a loan of $500 to invest in her own fruit business by increasing her stock of fruit to sell. She sees this investment as the opportunity that enable her to increase her daily income.

loans.use: Purchase more fruit to sell to increase business

loans.name: Kheang

texts.en:
Mrs. Kheang T. was born in 1958 and she now lives in Sduk Thom village in Kampong Cham province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Tho Thok, is a farmer who owns a plot to cultivate rice. In this plantation, he faces some problems because his field is infertile and she does not have enough money to buy fuel for a pump to irrigate the field.

To deal with these problems, Mrs. Kheang T. decided to ask for a loan. She hopes to increase income and improve the family's living conditions. She is the mother of seven children, one of whom helps her husband with his plantation. The other two are employed in a garment factory. Three of are enrolled in the local school and the remaining is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fuel for a pump to irrigate the field.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan P. is 40 years old and resides in Bati district, Takeo province, Cambodia, with her husband and three of her children. She works as a rice farmer to raises her standard of living, and earns around $1 every day. Her husband, Ny Sarith, 41, is a construction worker and typically makes $3 a day. This couple also gets support from their daughter, who is employed as a garment factory worker. Their other two children are students.

Mrs. Chan P. is asking for a loan of $900 to purchase cows to help plow the farmland.

loans.use: Purchase cows to help plow the farmland

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun S., 23, is married and lives with her husband in Bati district, Takeo province, Cambodia. She and her husband work making and selling incense and together earn around $3 every day. This couple has one young child. Mrs. Bun S. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike to transport the incense to sell at the market.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike to transport incense to the market to sell

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
