V. is a rice farmer and grows green beans to sell. She is 61 years old and has two children, both of whom are single (one is employed as a garment worker and one works growing rice with the family). The family is supported by one daughter whose income is around $60 per month for working as a garment worker.

V.'s husband is 68 years old and works with V.. After the rice farming season, she grows green beans to sell for another source of income and now the crop is growing but she faces difficulty getting water to supply her crop. With her green bean growing business, to improve efficiency, V. would like to ask for a loan to purchase a pump to irrigate her green bean crop and for farming rice. She expects the loan will improve their income by using the pump. V.'s husband is shown in the photo because she was not available for photographing.

loans.use: to purchase a pump

loans.name: Varn

texts.en: Varn Y., 35, is married and lives with her husband in Bati district, Takeo province, Cambodia. She grows rice and earns very little to support her household. Her husband, Tep Phat (pictured), is self-employed as a motor-taxi driver and he generally earns $7 every day. This couple has four children; three are students, and one is too young to attend the school. Mrs. Varn Y. is requesting a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate as a taxi.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike to operate as a motor-taxi

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Choeun C. is a villager in Sras Pring village in Kampong Cham province. She is a 55-year-old widow with four children, two of whom are employed in the local garment factory, while the others own a small grocery store in the local market. She is a rice middleman.

Mrs. Choeun C. is requesting a loan to buy more rice and grocery goods for her children's business. She hopes to increase their incomes and improve the family's living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more rice and grocery goods for her children's business, to help the whole family's income.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay K. works making and selling rice noodles in a local market in Takeo province, Cambodia. She earns $2.50 every day. She is 56 years old and has five children with her husband (pictured here), who earns $3 a day. This couple also receives support from two of their children, who work making incense and are employed in a garment factory.

Lay K. plans to use this loan to purchase a motorbike and trailer. The trailer will transport goods and people in the village.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike and trailer to operate a taxi

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en: Mrs. Lorn E. is a villager in Kvet village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a chicken breeder. Her husband, Mr. Bay Sok Ban, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. However, his field is infertile and so Mrs. Lorn E. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to purchase two more chickens for breeding. She is 29 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and two chickens.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan S. E., 58, is a mother of two children and lives in Bati district, Takeo province, Cambodia. She has been operating a grocery store for about 10 years, selling a variety of goods. She earns about $7 per day. Her husband, Chan Sokum, 51, is a local teacher and makes $2.50 a day. This couple has two school-aged children.

Mrs. Phan S. E. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike to transport goods from the market to her store. Now she has to hire public transportation and costs her a lot.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike to transport goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Mr. Sopheap C. is a villager in Chey Neang village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Because he does not have enough money to pay for growing rice, he has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow his field. His wife, Mrs. Keang Khim, is a pig breeder. Mr. Sopheap C. is a 37-year-old father of two children who are enrolled in the local school. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire a farm laborer.

loans.name: Srey Pau

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Pau N. is a villager in Chey Neang village in Kampong Cham province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Han Horn, is a farmer who owns a piece of land where he cultivates rice. In this plantation, he faces a problem because his field is infertile which  has a bad effect on his crop. Thus, Mrs. Srey Pau N. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to amend the field to make the crop more productive. She is 28 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to make the crop more productive

loans.name: On

texts.en: Mrs. On Y. is a villager in Phnum Touch village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Chea Bo, is a fisherman who can catch few fish because he does not have enough fishing equipment. In order to catch more fish, Mrs. On Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets for her husband's business. She is 48 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fishnets.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom C. is a villager in Trao Phni village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a farmer who owns one hectare of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her field, however, is infertile and so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and thereby increase production.  Her husband, Mr. Soeung Seth, helps her in the plantation. Mrs. Mom C. is 23 years old and the mother of a five-year-old child. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Hoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Hoeurn C. is a villager in Sras Pring village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Because her field is infertile, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and thereby increase her yield. Additionally, she would use the rest of the loan to dig a well for her family's use. Mrs. Hoeurn C. is 51 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is a tractor driver, three are employed in a garment factory, and the youngest is a cook. Her husband is presented on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and dig a well.

loans.name: Mi

texts.en: Mrs. Mi M. is a villager in Sdok Thom village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband, Mr. Bin Maing, are farmers. They now have problems because their field is infertile, so Mrs. Mi M. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel to support the field to make her crop more productive. She has seven children; one is a driver, two are laborers, three help on their parents’ farm, and the youngest attends the local school. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel.

loans.name: Mohammad Zabit

texts.en:
Mohammad Zabit K. is an uneducated man, but he has over ten years of experience in retail. He has a retail shop in Kabul. He has tried many times over the years to enlarge his shop, but has been unable to. When he found AFSG in Kabul, he was very happy and decided to apply for a loan.

Zabit has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for a term of 12 months to enlarge his shop, By improving his business, he hopes to make a better monthly income for his family.

Zabit wants to thank lenders around the world as well as Kiva and AFSG for this fantastic loan program. He can hardly believe such good program exists in Afghanistan, where people are faced with lots of difficulty. He hopes the program enjoys great success in the future.

loans.use: Expand his retail shop

loans.name: Sree

texts.en: Mrs. Sree H. is a villager in Taing Roleang village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband, Mr. Rong Pheak, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Their field is infertile soil so Mrs. Sree H. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her field more productive. Mrs. Sree H. is 33 years old and the mother of a 5-year-old child. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and fuel.

loans.name: Abulljalel

texts.en:
Abdulljalil is 46 years old. He is married and the father of three children. He lives with whole family in Khewa Nangrahar province. He studied hard in ten classes, and now he has an electrician's shop in Jalalabad city. He is a hard worker.

To expand his shop and increase his income, Abbulljalil has invested 180000AF of his own capital in his shop. He is requesting an individual loan of 30000AF for a period of 27 months to buy electrician's tools for his shop. He thanks the lenders of Kiva.

loans.use: Buy tools for his electrician's shop

loans.name: Mohammad Wazir

texts.en:
Muhammad Wazir is 28 years old and lives in Kama of Nangarhar province. He is an educated a man with a great deal of experience in his business. He has been involved in agriculture for more than ten years, and he is a hard worker.

To expand his business and make a good income for his family, Wazir has applied for an individual loan of 50000(AF) for a term of 27 months. With the money, he will buy some seed and other necessary things for his land.

He is very happy with the loan process in Afghanistan, and hopes that all the workers who take out loans can make good businesses for themselves. He says it is a good opportunity for everyone. He would like to thank the lenders, as well as Kiva and AFSG in Afghanistan.

loans.use: Buy seeds and other necessary things for his land

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim T. has been running her business for a long time. She was born in 1964 and is married. She sells groceries out of her house for income, and she can make around US$ 5 per day. She has three children; two of them are married and live away from home, and the other one is single and is employed as a garment worker. She is married to Nou Korng, age 46, and makes a living raising animals at their home.

T. is operating her business well because she is skilled in communication with her village. Because the grocery store is T.'s important source to earn income to help meet her family's needs, she is asking for a loan to buy more grocery inventory for sale. She lives in Kandal Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy more grocery inventory for sale

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Mr. Sor S. is 29 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province, where he has his own workshop next to his house for repairing electronics. He repairs items like televisions, radios, etc, and has been investing in his business for more than four years.

He is married to Kem Tat, 28 years old, who earns a living as a hairdresser. His wife's business is going very well now that a lot of customers recognize the good service she provides, and she is earning an average of $2.50 per day. The couple has two children; both of them are single and attend school.

S. is applying for a loan as capital to buy more electronic materials for his repairs and to buy some hairdressing materials for his wife to help meet a little more of her customers' requirements.

loans.use: To buy more electronic materials

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes A. is a 29-year-old entrepreneur who sells second-hand clothes at Nyamasaria market, Kisumu, Kenya. She began this business with her late husband in 1999. She gets her products from Kibuye Market, Kisumu, Kenya from wholesalers on a fortnightly basis. She deals  mostly in women's dresses since they sell faster and thus she is able to make around Kshs 2,000-3,000 in profit a week. Her business is able to generate enough profit to help her meet her household expenses and pay school fees for her three children. She has applied for a loan in the amount of US $ 275 to purchase more merchandise for sale.

loans.use: Purchase additional stocks of used clothing

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian A. is a 28-year-old married mother of 2 school-going children. She lives in Nyamasaria, Kisumu, Kenya. She is the proprietor of a tailoring and dressmaking business which she initiated in the year 2000. She also helps her husband run a retail shop.

Lillian specializes in making both women’s dresses and men’s shirts. Due to her hard work, years of experience, well-established client base and financial assistance from KMET, she has seen her business grow. She plans to use a half of her loan of US $275 to purchase new patterns and materials so as to cope with changing fashions in the market and also meet the growing demand for her clothing.

loans.use: Purchase patterns and other new dressmaking materials

loans.name: Run

texts.en: Mrs. Run T. is a villager in Thmey Tom Lab village, Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Sam Yath, sells firewood. Even though they work hard, they do not earn enough income to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Run T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase their income and thereby improve their living conditions. She has five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Sakin

texts.en: Mrs. Sakin E. is 50 years old, single, and now lives in Preak Svay village, Kandal province, Cambodia. She sells desserts in addition to cultivating rice on her small piece of land. She does not have enough money to buy fertilizer and hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan for these purposes.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire a laborer with two oxen.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Алиева Зухро живет городе Яван. Возраст 44 года , замужем и имеет шестерых детей.Уже около четырех лет , как она занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли. Торгует тканями и детской одеждой. Ее бизнес является основным источником дохода ее семьи. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев. Это поможет ей развивать свою деятельность и привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en:
Zuhro A. lives in Yavan town. She is 44 years old and is married with 6 children. For the past four years she has been selling fabric and children's clothing. This business is her primary source of income. She would like to get a loan in order to increase cash flow, attract new customers, and expand her business. She would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Mrs. Makara Shum Village Bank Group

texts.en: Eight people living in Ta Reab DoU. Sar village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan group. Mrs. Makara S., the 31- year-old village bank president, is a farmer who cultivates vegetables. She now faces a problem because she does not have enough money to rent a pond in which to grow lotus. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose and for buying lotus seed. Her husband, Mr. U. Vuth, is a fisherman. Mrs. Makara S. is 31 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom attend the local school while the other is too young to work or study.  The other members of the group will use their portions of the loan for other purposes.

loans.use: To buy lotus seed and rent a pond to grow lotus.

loans.name: Khaitgul

texts.en:
Khaitgul is a 39-year-old married mother of two children. Her husband is an entrepreneur and Khaitgul started her business in 2002 in order to help support her family. All year she sells fruit and vegetables that she buys from local farmers. Twice a week, Khaitgul travels over 60 km to sell her produce at attractive prices at a busy market. With the loan of 3000 Somoni from Kiva, she plans to increase the range of her goods, and to buy apples, pomegranates, oranges, tomatoes, and cucumbers.

Khaitgul strives to give her children a better life than they have, including seeing them through a high level of education. With her business, she has been able to supply the community with fresh vegetables and also provide for her family. Khaitgul is a well-spoken, friendly businesswoman who is worthy of the support of Kiva lenders.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing the range of  fruit and vegetables she sells

loans.name: Wassa (La Jouissance) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Wassa de l’association Sabaly  du village de kimparana  est un regroupement  de quatre femmes dont 3 mariées dans de familles traditionnelles et une célibataire. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et ont chacune au moins 3 enfants
Vendeuses de  condiments alimentaires, de fruits et légumes, ces femmes, depuis plus d’une année ont trouvé des moyens pour réaliser leur ambition de développer leurs entreprises, grâce au partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso. Elles  sont à leur troisième prêt  après s’être acquitter correctement deux précédents. 
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter  des sacs, d’oignons, de piments, de patate et d’igname, et divers condiments alimentaires à Sikasso et kimparana.
Elles achètent les marchandises au marché de kimparana en gros et les revendent en détail au marché de kimparana, à la maison et devant la  porte de leur maison.
Le groupe Wassa se propose d’avoir un bénéfice de 80 000 FCFA chacune avec ce prêt.
Le bénéfice obtenu sera utilisé pour rembourser l’intérêt du prêt   et faire face aux  dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Wassa group of the association Sabaly from the village of Kimparana is a grouping of four women, three of whom are married in traditional families and one is single. On average they are 35 years old and have at least three children.

They are sellers of condiments, fruits, and vegetables. For over a year, these women have found ways to achieve their dream of developing their business thanks to their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso. This is their third loan, after having fully reimbursed the previous two.

The current loan will be used to buy bags of onions, hot peppers, potatoes, yams, and various condiments in Sikasso and Kimparana.

They buy their goods wholesale at the Kimparana market and resale them retail at the Kimparana market, at home or in front of their house.

With this loan, the Wassa group intends to make a profit of 80 000 FCFA each. The profit will be used to reimburse the loan and to cope with the family' s daily expenses.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various goods

loans.name: Abdugaffor

texts.en:
Abdugaffor A. is 27 years old. He is married and has three kids. Abdugaffor is a very diligent and hard-working man. With his car he provides taxi services inside the city of Dushanbe. For the last 2 years, the current business had provided their main income, allowing Abdugaffor to improve living conditions for his large family. Besides his wife and children, he is also supporting his parents.

As any business generating income, the business of Abdugaffor also requires some investment from time to time. Thus, now his car needs some fixing and also Abdugaffor wants to buy winter tires. For this purpose Abdugaffor is requesting 2500 Somoni for a term of 12 months. Abdugaffor promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all supporting him.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Thorough fixing of his vehicle used for providing taxi services

loans.name: Yeredon (Le Savoir Vivre) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Yeredon est un regroupement de 7 femmes de  kimparana qui cohabitent ensemble depuis très longtemps. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans, mariées et mères d’au moins 4  enfants vivant toutes dans de grandes familles traditionnelles.
 L’activité dominante de ces clientes est  la vente d’habillement et de produits cosmétiques
 Pour agrandir leurs entreprises, les membres du groupe Yeredon ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son premier prêt  qui sera utilisé pour acheter des habits en grande quantité à  un prix abordable.
Elles se procurent  de ces marchandises à Bamako (la capitale malienne) et à koury pour les revendre au village. 
N’ayant pas assez de  place pour les activités, elles sont des vendeuses  ambulantes. Elles prétendent avoir un bénéfice de 40 000FCFA pendant  ce cycle.
En dehors du remboursement des prêts, les femmes du groupe Yeredon utilisent une partie du revenu pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Yeredon is composed of seven women of Kimparana who have been living together for a long time. They average 44 years of age, are married, and have at least four children. They all live in large traditional families. The dominant work of these group members involves selling clothing and cosmetics.

To grow their enterprises, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, with which they are on their first loan. The current loan will be used to buy clothing in large quantities at affordable prices.

They get their merchandise in Bamako (capital of Mali) and in Koury for resale in the village. Lacking enough space for their businesses, they sell door-to-door. They aspire to having a profit of 40,000 francs CFA during this business cycle. Besides repaying the loan, the women of the group will use part of the revenues to address typical family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Chinigul

texts.en:
Problems and money shortages have never defeated Chinigul, who has always looked for a way to get past obstacles and continue to improve her situation. Chinigul is an extremely hard-working and energetic woman. She is 47 years old. She is married and the loving mother of two children.

Chinigul started her own business because her husband’s salary was not enough for their family expenses. For more than 10 years, she has operated a store where she sells women’s clothing and men’s shirts. Her store is well known, and people love to visit because it's clean, tidy, and run by someone who is very kind and thoughtful.

Chinigul hopes that her store will keep growing so that she can maintain a comfortable life for her family especially for her two children. To make that possible, she has applied for a new loan that she will use to buy more clothing to sell. With this purpose in mind, Chinigul is requesting 2500 Somoni for a term of 9 months. She promises to repay the loan on time and thanks everyone supporting her.

loans.use: Purchasing underclothes for girls and women in order to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.en:
Abdusalom K. is married and lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He works as a taxi driver. He loves being self-employed and managing his own time. Abdusalom has a nice car and offers taxi services around his region. He is a workaholic and is always ready to work non-stop, even on the weekend.

Abdusalom has been in this business for 3 years. Today he is planning to replace his old tires with new ones and also wants to do some repairs on his car. For this reason he is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni with a term of 12 months. This will generate additional profit as he finds more customers. This business is a crucial segment of his life since it is Abdusalom's opportunity to support his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: repair work on his taxi

loans.name: Assitan

texts.fr:
Madame Assitan Diakité est une femme mariée de 34 ans et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants dans une famille monogame le quartier Hérémakono centre de Bougouni(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Assitan Diakité fait de la restauration depuis 10 ans qu’elle a appris  auprès de sa soeur.
Avant d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso,elle avait certaines difficultés pour mener à bien son activité à cause de la faiblesse de son fonds de roulement. Ayant fait la connaissance de Soro Yiriwaso à travers une association de son quartier dont elle était la présidente. Après 10 prêts en solidaire(prêt de groupe) elle est passée au prêt individuel où elle est  à son 7ème prêt. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle veut acheter  divers condiments alimentaires, du riz, des boissons  et des chaises.
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako(capitale du Mali) et à Bougouni auprès des grossistes.
Elle compte  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé à ameliorer son restaurant, et ambitionne acheter un lot à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mrs. Assitan Diakité is 34 years old, married and has 4 children. She lives with her husband and children as a monogamous family in the district of Bougouni ( the third administrative region in the Republic of Mali). Mrs. D.has learned the restaurant business from her sister and has been active in this business for 10 years. Before she became associated with the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, she was having some difficulties maintaining her business, as she lacked sufficient operating capital. She became aware of the Soro Yiriwaso program through a neighborhood group, of which she later became president. After 10 group loans, she started to make individual loans and is on her seventh loan. All her previous loans have been duly repaid. With this new loan, she would like to buy condiments, rice drinks and some chairs. She buys her supplies in Bamako (capital of Mali) and in Bougouni from wholesalers. She expects to earn a monthly profit of 70,000 FCFA which will be used to improve the restaurant and her ambition is to buy a house, in the future.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various basic condiments for her restaurant

loans.name: Abdukadir

texts.en:
Abdukadir M. is 41 years old. He is married with four children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells various kinds of foodstuffs such as: cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, detergents and many others in his grocery store which he built 10 years ago. Currently Abdukadir has about US$ 1000 in inventory. His monthly net profit is about US$ 300.

Today Abdukadir is requesting a loan of 3200 Somoni for the term of 12 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children might progress by means of their studies, for which he is doing his very best. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs to increase the range of goods he sells

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sorn S. has one child, and lives in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She raises pigs from her home and normally makes around $3 per day. Her husband works as a farmer growing rice and typically contributes his daily income to the family savings.

Sorn S. is requesting a loan of $875 to purchase a grinding mill. She thinks she can earn additional income with the grinding mill. In the future, Sorn S. would like to save enough money to invest in a grocery business rather than raising pigs.

loans.use: Purchase grinding mill

loans.name: Kadia

texts.fr:
Madame Kadia Touré est une femme mariée de 33 ans et mère de 4 enfants qui vit avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier Hérémakono centre de la ville de Bougouni(troisième région administrative de la république du Mal).
Avec 8 années d’experiences, Madame Kadia Touré maîtrise bien son activité de restauration apprise auprès de sa mère jadis grande restauratrice.
Pour améliorer son restaurant Madame Kadia Touré décida de prendre un prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à sa premièe expérience.
Elle compte acheter  divers condiments, de riz, de pintades, de poissons. Elle s’approvisionne à Bougouni et à Bamako (capitale de la republique du Mali). La vente se fait dans son restaurant situé à la  gare routière de Bougouni. Sa clientelle est composée de population locale, mais aussi de routiers.
Avec ce prêt, Madame Kadia Touré envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000 FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice elle compte agrandir son restaurant pour avoir plus de clients, payer les intérêts du prêt et acheter un congélateur.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kadia Touré is a 33-year old married mother of four children living with her husband and his children in the Hérémakono neighborhood at the center of Bougouni town (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). With eight years of experience, Mrs. Kadia Touré knows the restaurant business well, having learned it from her mother who used to be an important restaurant owner. To improve her restaurant Mrs. Kadia Touré has decided to borrow her first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. She plans to buy various seasonings, rice, guinea fowl, and fish. She supplies her stock from Bougouni and Bamako (the capital of Mali). Sales take place in her restaurant located near Bougouni's bus station. Her customers include local residents as well as travelers. With this loan, Mrs. Kadia Touré plans to make a monthly profit of 35,000 Francs CFA. She would like to use this income to expand her restaurant to gain customers, pay the loan interest, and to buy a freezer.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice and seasonings

loans.name: Orifjon

texts.en:
Orifjon M. is 25 years old. He is married and has 3 kids. Orifjon's goals are to grow in his personal life and in his business. His wish is to offer better service to his customers. His dream is that God will continue to provide him with a longer life to get ahead and to fulfill his goals. He is a taxi driver and travels through the streets of Dushanbe, Tajikistan in search of customers. He has owned his business for 4 years.

Currently Orifjon’s car needs some repairing and he wants to borrow 2500 Somoni for the term of 12 months. The financing will go towards repairs of his vehicle and also, together with the parts, he will purchase winter tires. Orifjon thanks Kiva and all the lenders that make this help possible.

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for thorough repair of his taxi

loans.name: Sabohathon

texts.ru: Бободжонова Сабохатхон проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 39 лет, разведена и имеет троих детей. Живет в трудных условиях , так как приходиться много работать , чтобы обеспечить своих детей. Работает на рынке. Занимается торговлей одежды уже три года. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот и завезти сезонный товар. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sabohathon B. lives in Yavan town. She is 39 years old, divorced, and has 3 children. She lives in difficult conditions and has to work hard in order to support her children. For the past three years she has been selling clothing at the local market. She would like to get a loan in order to increase cash flow and purchase more goods for sale. She would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Nodira

texts.en:
Eleven years ago, Nodira started her clothing business. Experienced and talented in the business, Nodira has expanded her business into a successful trade, supporting her family. Throughout the last four years, IMON International has provided ongoing assistance to Nodira’s business through microfinance loans. Committed to growth and successful entrepreneurship, Nodira has used each loan wisely and has repaid each with a perfect credit history. Currently, she is seeking a loan of 4000 Somoni to purchase more clothing for selling. With the rotation of supplies in her business, she plans to repay the loan within 6 months. The well being of Nodira’s family and her business are in your hands. Nodira and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the new clothing for increasing the range of goods.

loans.name: Heung

texts.en: Heung L., 50, is married and lives with her husband and two school-aged children in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She and her husband have a business recharging batteries and are able to earn $6 every day. People who live in the province usually depend on batteries to power their lighting. Heung L. plans to use this loan to purchase batteries and resell them in the village.

loans.use: Purchase batteries to resell

loans.name: Neth

texts.en:
Neth N. is 46 years old and lives with her husband in the Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She earns a living buying rice for re-sale after taking off the husk. On average, she makes US$6 a day. Her husband, Ty Saruon, 49, pictured here, is a moto-taxi driver. He has been operating his business since 2004 and is able to make US$7 per day. Neth N. and her husband have six children, one of whom is employed, and two are students. 
Mrs. Neth N. presently needs a loan of US$1,000 to purchase rice in bulk for re-sale.

loans.use: Purchase of rice in bulk for sale.

loans.name: Nhanch

texts.en: Nhanch L., 32, pictured with her husband and her son, is a mother of three school-aged children, and lives in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She and her husband earn income grinding rice crops for the farmers of the village. They are able to make about US$10 in profit each day. Mrs. Nhanch L. currently needs a loan of US$1,000 to be able to purchase a stock of gas for the rice grinding machine.

loans.use: Purchase of a stock of gas for a rice grinding machine

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
N. Nasiba is 38 years old. She is married with four children. Nasiba is selling women’s clothing at the local market. She started her business 6 and a half years ago. At that time her husband-entrepreneur supported Nasiba, providing the funds for start-up. Gradually Nasiba's business expanded. Being hard-working and polite by nature, she managed to obtain a clientele that is happy with her goods and the services. The business generates a stable income for the family. Nasiba loves her children very much and she wants all of them to be well educated. Today she is requesting $1200 USD for the term of 8 months. She is planning to spend the loan to purchase additional fashionable clothes for women. You could become an important part in Nasiba family's life. She deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase of the clothing for increasing the range of goods

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Suon C., 25, is married, has two young children, and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Since 1999, she has been running a grocery store selling various goods. With her business, she is able to make US$20 in revenue each day. Suon C.'s husband, Keng Vicheth, 26, operates a motor-taxi and earns about US$2 per day. Suon C. is currently asking for a loan of US$500 to increase the grocery inventory at her store.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries for a store

loans.name: Mahanberdi

texts.ru: Кулаев Моханберды житель Явана.Возраст 50 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. У себя в кишлаке , который находится очень далеко от центра города имеет магазин. Торгует продуктами питания. Этот бизнес является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы купить стройматериалы , которые нужны для ремонта магазина. Это поможет ему улучшить условия обслуживания и таким образом привлечь новых клиентов. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mahanberdi Q. resides in the town of Yavan. He is 50 years old, married and has four children. In his home on the outskirts of town, he has a store where he sells food products. This business is his family's sole source of income. He plans to take out a loan to purchase building materials needed to make repairs to the store, improvements which will attract new customers. He will be able to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Store repairs

loans.name: Djonoro

texts.en:
Djonoro S. is 39 years old. She is a widow and has four children. Djonoro is running a catering business where she is providing meals consisting of the national cuisine. She’s renting her catering room which is located in the central local market which allows Djonoro to have many customers, the majority of whom are those making purchases in the market.

Every day she purchases the freshest foodstuff and cooks delicious dishes. Her daughters help her with the business. Now she is asking for a loan of 3200 Somoni with a term of 12 months in order to expand her business so as to earn enough to be able to send her children to the university next year. She will use the loan for buying flour, oil and other foodstuffs. She thanks all supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to make her dreams become reality!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing flour, oil, and other foodstuffs

loans.name: Rohatoy

texts.en:
Rohatoy S. is 36 years old. She is married with five children. For 10 years already, Rohatoy is running a catering business where she is providing meals consisting of the national cuisine. Her catering room is located near her house and she has many customers, considering that there are many offices located there. Every day she purchases the freshest foodstuffs and cooks delicious dishes.

Over time she has expanded her business, and now Rohatoy has two assistants who help her with the business. Now she is asking for a loan in the amount of 3200 Somoni with a term of 12 months in order to expand her business further so as to earn enough in order in future to send her children to the university. She will use the loan for purchasing foodstuffs for her canteen. She thanks all supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs for her canteen

loans.name: Kea

texts.en: Kea K. H. is 26 years old and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She owns a grocery store and typically makes about US$20 in revenue every day. Her husband is a soldier and earns US$2.5 per day. Recently, Kea K. H. decided that she needs to expand her grocery stand by adding additional products to meet her clients' demand. She is grateful for the loan from Credit MFI and Kiva.

loans.use: Expansion of a grocery stand

loans.name: Murcha

texts.ru: Шарипов Мурча житель города Яван. Имеет троих детей. Работает преподавателем в средней школе. Кроме этого занимается животноводством. Откармливает бычков до 50 дней , а затем продает на рынке . Планируемый кредит хочет использовать для приобрктения молодого бычка. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Murcha S. resides in the town of Yavan. He has three children. He teaches at the secondary school, and raises cattle as a sideline. He feeds cattle for 50 days, then sells them in the market. He plans to use this loan to obtain a young bull. He will repay the loan within ten months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a young bull

loans.name: Faizullo

texts.en:
Faizullo A. applied first to MicroInvest in 2006 when his brother was able to improve his existing business thanks to a MicroInvest loan. Faizullo lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan and he is married. Since his early years, Faizullo saw how his father took care of animals and helped him do this work. Faizullo attended higher education and worked as an economist in a car park. Four years ago, he decided to purchase a milk cow for his wife and since that moment he started the livestock business.

Today he has one milk cow and five sheep. The livestock business brings in general family income for Faizullo. His wife makes and sells milk products. Faizullo is asking KIVA for a business development loan of 3200 STJ for 10 months to buy a pedigreed bull that will permit him to increase the number of his livestock and thus the family income. He thanks KIVA for its support and invites all to come and see his farm.

loans.use: for purchasing a pedigreed bull

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom K. sees herself as a calm, hard-working, and responsible person. She began her business due to the need for another income as her husband didn’t earn enough and now he is working in Russia. They have a child who is growing each day, as well as their general needs. She began some time ago selling various products and even had a home-made food shop which she had to close because of the increase in the shop’s rent, and because the owners were asking for the shop. So, one of her friends convinced her to sell clothes and offered to take her to places where she could buy clothes at good prices. She followed her friend’s advice and began to sell clothes 2 years ago. Her sales went very well after she got started. She now has a fair number of customers.

Dilorom is asking for 4000 Somoni which she will repay in 10 months, to purchase seasonal garments. She wants to take advantage of the dates and have a more diverse variety of garments for her customers, which will allow her to increase her sales.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing clothing for children for re-sale

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Cheng L., 40, is married and lives with his wife in Battambang province, Cambodia. Since 2000, he has been operating a motor-taxi to earn a living and is able to make a daily profit of about US$4. His wife, Chorn Mom, 30, pictured here, has a business selling sugar cane juice in a busy market nearby their house. The couple has two young children. Mrs. Chorn Mom would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike that she could attach to the sugar cane cart.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike

loans.name: Iqbal Begum Munir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Iqbal Begum baji is a 36-year-old married lady and has resided in a city called Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. She is an uneducated lady; she couldn’t get an education due to her family’s meager financial resources. Her husband's name is M. A. and he is a delivery man and has been doing this work for the past 5 years. He used his own vehicle called “Shahzore” for delivering various items (wheat, fruit, & vegetables) from one place to another. Iqbal baji has no children. She spends her time making of embroidered clothes. She earns an income doing this work. She used her income to renovate her house. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s vehicle so that he will be able to continue his work.

She is joined in her loan by several more women from her locality. Rehana baji and Sakina baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Khursheed baji wants a loan to pay the installments on her auto-rickshaw. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle used for transport

loans.name: Teng

texts.en: Teng P., 65, is married and lives in the Battambang province. Working on a farm together with his wife Vith Sambath, Teng P. typically makes US$1.50 per day. His family is also supported by one of their three children who works for an organization. Teng P. currently needs a loan of US$500 to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds for the farm, a purchase that he believes can increase his daily income.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and rice seeds

loans.name: Khasanboy

texts.en:
Khasanboy B. lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 4 children. Khasanboy, from his early years, has been engaged in livestock raising; he helped his father to take care of their animals. Today Khasanboy has a livestock business where his wife and children help him. He has a milk cow and 4 sheep.

Khasanboy has special skills; he knows animals' specialities and the way of taking care of them. Khasanboy is asking KIVA for financial help: a business development loan of 4000 STJ for 10 months for purchasing pedigreed sheep. He wants to start up a serious business raising sheep to increase his business turnover and to have a big livestock farm in future.

loans.use: purchasing pedigreed sheep

loans.name: El

texts.en: El S. is 27 years old and lives with her husband and child in Battambang province, Cambodia. She is a wedding chef and can make about US$7 per day. Her husband (pictured here) is a police official and makes about US$3 per day. The couple hopes to use this loan to repair the leaking roof of their house.

loans.use: Repair of a leaking roof

loans.name: Mohammad Parwiz

texts.en:
M. Parwiz is the son of M. M.. He lives in a big family that has eight members. He is completely responsible for his family and has to pay all the expenses. He has a general store and works hard there.

He wants to take out an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for a term of 10 months to purchase additional materials to expand his business. He is confident that with the loan, he can work in a good way and earn more money.

loans.use: To expand his general store

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor K. operates a small business selling baby clothes and supplies in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. She has an attractively arranged store at Dushanbe market where she carries all sorts of necessary items for new mothers, including children's toys. Gulbahor has been in this business for about 8 years and has developed a stable, profitable enterprise based on products that are always in demand. Her business has become the main source of income for her and her family. Gulbahor’s business is growing. She has requested a loan of 3253 Somoni to increase her working capital and help boost the further development of her business. With your help this will be possible.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en: Nuon K., 24, is a professional tailor who lives in Battambang province. She typically makes US$3 per day. She is single and lives with her parents and two siblings. Nuon K. would like to request a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her family's transportation needs.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike

loans.name: Mijgona

texts.en:
Mijgona R. is 25 years old; she lives with her spouse and works every day, starting very early in the morning, so that she can get ahead and achieve her goal of having her 3 children successfully enter and finish school. Her business is located in the central market of Dushanbe city and she sells clothes for women. Thanks to the support of her spouse and her own effort she was able to expand her business, which began with little inventory and in a small space and now has a bigger space and a large clientele. With the loan of 3253 Somoni, which she will repay in 9 months, she will buy a greater variety of clothing styles, for a variety of occasions, and a few specific requests of her customers. Support this woman of much strength and courage to keep working.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for women for re-sale

loans.name: Rukhsana Sajjad Hussain Group

texts.en:
"My name is Rukhsana and I’m 39 years old and a married lady. I have been a citizen of a city called Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 5 years. I got an education up to 8th standard but my parents couldn't afford to let me study further. I married a man whose name is S. H. and he is a farmer. He grows various flowers and when they become fully grown he sells them to flower shops and earns income. I help my husband in his flower-growing business. I have successfully repaid my two loans which I took from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now I’m applying for a loan again to buy fertilizer and other necessary thing to expand my husband’s plant-growing business."

Rukhsana is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Rukhsana baji and Kanizan baji and Farzana baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Tahira yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to re-sell. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer to grow flowers

loans.name: Eung

texts.en: Eung C. is 25 years old and lives with her parents (her mother pictured here) and brother in Battambang province, Cambodia. She earns income operating a small soup shop. On average, she is able to make US$8 per day. Eung C. would like to take out a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her brother, so that he can start a motor-taxi business.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike

loans.name: Zabiullah

texts.en:
Zabiullah is the son of S.. He lives in district 4 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has three children. He works in government and the whole family benefits from the income he generates.

However, Zabiullah's salary cannot fulfill all the needs of his family members. Therefore, he is applying for an individual loan of 30000 Afghani for a term of 12 months to start a general store. He hopes that having a small business will enable him to supply the basic needs of his family. He would like to say that, from his point of view, the loan process is the best one because it supports all the ways of life.

loans.use: To open a new shop

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam B., 41, pictured here, is married and lives with his wife in Battambang province, Cambodia. He purchases and sells rice to earn a living and is able to make around US$10 in revenue every day. His wife, Huy Maly, 24, is a housewife and stays at home to cook food for the family and look after the children. Mr. Sam B. would like to take out a loan to purchase rice in bulk for re-sale.

loans.use: Purchase of rice in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Абдурахмонов Алишер житель района Рудаки. Живет  вместе со своей матерью. Занимается бизнесом на рынке "Сомон". Торгует уже около 10 лет фруктами. Кредит планирует получить для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.Вложение дополнительных средств поможет ему увеличить бизнес.
texts.en:
Alisher A. resides in the district of Rudaki. He lives with his mother and has a business at the Somon market, where for the past ten years he has sold fruit. He would like to take out a loan to increase his turnover, and will be able to repay the loan within 12 months. The investment of these additional funds will help him to increase business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Mavluda K. has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2002. She is a reliable client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure and has continued working together with MicroInvest for a long time. She started her business practically from scratch but thanks to the previous loans she was able to open a specialized outlet selling women's and children's wear. She brings her assortment from Istaravshan and Uzbekistan twice per month. She has a good assortment and repeat customers.

Mavluda has 10 years experience in this business so she has the special skills and market knowledge necessary to do well in it. Mavluda is bringing up 2 children by herself; she is not married. Mavluda is asking KIVA to support her exisitng business with a business support loan of 3500 STJ for 6 months for importing seasonal wear. She thanks KIVA for its support and wishes all her supporters all the best.

loans.use: importing seasonal wear

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn S. is 25 years old and lives with her husband in Battambang province, Cambodia. She earns income raising pigs and is able to make US$2 a day. Her husband, Nov Rith, 29, has been operating a motor-taxi since 2002 and is able to make a daily profit of US$3. Sorn S. and her husband have two children.
Mrs. Sorn S. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate as a taxi, while the rest of the loan will be used to purchase feed for the pigs.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike and feed for pigs

loans.name: Thoang

texts.en: Thoang S., 21, is married and lives with her husband in Battambang province, Cambodia. Since 2006, she has been raising ducks to earn a living and is able to make US$1.5 a day, while her husband works as a construction worker. On average, he makes US$3.5 per day. This couple has two young children. Mrs. Thoang S. would now like to take out a loan to buy more ducks for breeding.

loans.use: Purchase of ducks for breeding

loans.name: Sadia Rana Yameen Group

texts.en:
"My name is Sadia and I married to a man whose name is R. Y., a salesman by profession. He deals with wholesalers and buys different items, specifically bakery items, and sells them to different shops. He has 15 years of experience in this business. I am the mother of 2 sons who are not of school-going age. I keep myself busy preparing embroidered dresses. I take orders from my neighbors and charge them $3 per dress. I have successfully repaid my first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now I’m applying again for a loan to buy bakery items (bread, butter) for my husband so that he will be able to sell them and earn a good income."

Sadia is the leader for another lady in her group. Khalida baji wants a loan to repair her working vehicle called “Shahzore”.  

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy bakery items to re-sell

loans.name: Tit

texts.en: Tit K., 54, is widowed, has two children, and lives in Kampong Cham province. She owns a small restaurant where she sells a variety of wines, beers and meat. From this activity, she is able to make US$5 per day. Tit K. would now like to take out a loan of US$500 to re-invest in her business and to purchase a sugar cane cart for producing sugar cane juice.

loans.use: Investment in a restaurant business and purchase of a sugar cane cart

loans.name: Michelle

texts.fr: Michelle  agée de 44 ans estune femme mariée  et mere de 4 enfants.Elle vit avec son marie et ses enfants .Pour gagner sa vie elle coud des vetements . Son atelier composé d'une seule machine à coudre est intallé dans la maison.Sa clientelle est essentiellement constituée par les voisins.
texts.en:
Michelle is 44 years old, married and the mother of four children. She lives with her husband and children, and makes her living as a seamstress. Her workshop consists of one sewing machine in her home. Her clientele for the most part are her neighbors.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Mohammadullah

texts.en:
Mohammadullah is the son of G. M.. He lives in district 16 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is a carpet weaver, and his business enables him to earn enough money to provide the essential requirements of his family members.

Mohammadullah wants to take out an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for a term of 10 months for the purpose of increasing his business and adding to his monthly income.

loans.use: To expand his carpet-weaving business

loans.name: Zafarali

texts.ru: Мирзоев Зафарали проживает в районе Рудаки. Работает строителем , а так же торговлей овощами и фруктами. Рано утром скупает товар у оптовых реализатором и там же продает розничным торговцам. Занимается этим бизнесом уже три года. Кредит хочет использовать для закупки саженцев для дальнейшей перепродажи. Зафар женат и имеет пятерых детей. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zafarali M. resides in Rudaki district. He works in construction, and in addition sells fruit and vegetables. For the past three years he has purchased his wares from wholesalers early in the morning and resold them to retailers. He wants to use the loan to purchase seedlings for further resale. Zafarali is married and has five children. He will be able to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: Marufjon

texts.en:
Marufjon K. lives in Kystakuz. He is married and has 3 children. Marufjon has been a client of our micro-finance programme only since 2008, but he has shown himself already as a serious man. He is a taxi driver by trade and for the last five years, he has been working with his own car. Besides that, Marufjon is engaged in the family business of raising livestock. He and his wife take care of animals and then they sell them. It is a good business since it brings in general family income.

Marufjon is asking KIVA to support the livestock business that he had started 2 years ago. He is asking for 2300 STJ for 8 months to start building a cow stable for summer time. He thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: to start building the cow stable for summer time

loans.name: Farzana M. Ramzan Group

texts.en:
'My name is Farzana and I’m 29 years old. I was born in a mid-size city called Arifwala, Pakistan. I am married to a man whose name is M. R., and he is a mason by trade. He knows that he can only get income from this business when someone calls him to help construct a building. So he does another job which is driving a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) to help his family survive. I am the mother of two girls who are not yet of school-going age. I prepare embroidered dresses on order and use the earnings to invest in a 'committee'. I’m planning to use the collective amount, when it is my turn to receive it, to pay all the education expenses of my daughters. I am applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for my husband so that he will be able to earn more income and get the real reward of his struggle.' Farzana is the group leader for several more women from her locality. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy biscuits and chips to re-sell. Ruqaiya baji wants a loan to buy wood for her furniture-making business. Kosar baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Mirzoali

texts.ru: Мирзоев Мирзоали проживает в районе Рудаки. Район находится рядом с городом Душанбе. Мирзоали женат и имеет пятерых детей. Сейчас ждет пополнение. Поэтому , имея такую большую семью ему необходимо много работать. Занимается торговлей фруктами. Кроме того имеет грузовую машину. Кредит запрвшивает для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот и пополнить запас товара. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mirzoali M. lives in Rudaki region in the vicinity of Dushanbe. Mirzoali is married and has five children. His wife is expecting another child. To support his large family, Mirzoali has to work hard. He is involved in fruit trade. He also has a truck. Mirzoali would like to get a loan for increasing cash flow and the assortment of goods. He would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Khoudia

texts.fr: Khoudia D. habite la banlieu de Mbour ,elle a 44 ans ,elle est mariée et mere de 5 enfants.Pour entretenir sa famille elle vend de la nourriture .le matin elle vend le petit dejeuner cafe et autre et le soir elle vend le diner dans un coin de la rue du quartier.Ce travail elle le fait depuis plusieurs années et les revenus tirés du travail lui permettent de participer aux charges de la maison  au meme titre que son mari.Les repas servis le soir sont a base de céréale  avec le pret  qu 'elle sollicite elle veut constituer des stocks pour pallier à la hausse des prix des céréales
texts.en:
Khoudia D. lives in the suburbs of Mbour. She is 44 years old, married and the mother of five children. In order to support her family she sells food. In the morning she sells breakfast, coffee and other items, while in the evening she sells dinner on a street corner in her neighborhood. She has done this work for several years and the income permits her to help her husband with household expenses. The meals she serves in the evening are grain-based, and with the loan she has requested she would like to stock up on grain to offset the rising cost.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Tièssiri (Courage) Group

texts.fr:
Les six (06) membres du groupe Tièssiri vivent majoritairement dans des grandes familles polygamiques avec en moyenne 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le quartier Bagadadji de Ségou(quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers l’association traditionnelle des femmes du quartier qui fait de la tontine et  fabrique du savon. Elles ont connu Soro Yiriwaso à travers le chef de village .C’est ainsi que ces femmes se sont organisées pour intégrer le programme de crédit solidaire. Après avoir bien remboursé  les deux premiers prêts, le groupe est à son 3ème.qui sera utilisé pour acheter 3sacs d’arachide, 2sacs d’haricot, 500kg d’oignon et 300kg de piment. En plus de la vente de ces produits deux d’entre elles vendent de la friperie (communément appelée yougou yougou au Mali). Elles se ravitaillent toutes hebdomadairement (chaque lundi) à la foire de Ségou au grand marché. Les produits sont vendus au petit marché de Bagadadji, au bord du goudron l’an 2000 et en ambulant pour la friperie dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
 Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 14 700FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour la prise en charge des frais de condiments et en partie de la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Most of the six members of the group Tièssiri live in large polygamist families. They are on average 38 years old with four children. They all live in the neighborhood Bagadadji in Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali).

They met each other through the traditional woman's neighborhood association that practices tontine [informal revolving credit system] and manufactures soap. They learned of Soro Yiriwaso through the village chief. Thus they organized themselves to enter the program of group loans. Following the full reimbursement of two previous loans, the group is requesting a third loan that will be used to buy 3 bags of peanuts, 2 bags of beans, 500 kg of onions, and 300 kg of hot peppers. In addition to the sale of these products, two of them sell used clothing (Commonly called yougou yougou in Mali). They all stock up weekly (every Monday) at the Segou fair in the large market. The products are sold at the small market of Bagadadji, on the edge of the road "L'an 2000", and the used clothing are sold door to door in the neighborhoods. Their customers is made up of men and women.

They hope to make a profit of 14 700 FCFA per month that they will use to pay for the condiments and for part of their children' s school fees.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of condiments, cereals and used clothing.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.ru: Саидова Шарифа жительница района Рудаки. ивет со своей большой семьей. Около 1.5 года занимается шитьем , а так же вышивкой национальных платьев. Вышивки делаются из биссера , а так же из золотых и серебрянных нитей. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы закупить материал. Это поможет развитию ее дела. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sharifa S. and her large family live in Rudaki region. For the past 18 months she has been making a living by sewing and embroidering national costumes. For her embroidery, she uses beads and golden and silver threads. Sharifa would like to get a loan for buying more materials and expanding her business. She would be able to pay off her loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: building an oven and buying sacks of wheat flour, sugar, and firewood

loans.name: Idoyatullo

texts.en:
Idoyatullo is 34 years old. He is a married man with four children. Idoyatullo’s main source of income is in the transportation sector. He has a vehicle with which he travels through Dushanbe city. With this activity, Idoyatullo supports his four children and his wife. The loan he is requesting will be used to repair the engine of his car and buy new tires. This will allow him to better provide for his family. He deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Repairing the engine of his car (taxi) and purchasing new tires

loans.name: Shamigul

texts.en:
Shamigul I. is 39 years old. She is married and the mother of 5 children. All her children are in school. Shamigul's husband is a taxi driver and his income is not enough to cover the family's expenses. That is why Shamigul decided to start her own business so that she could help her husband cover their living expenses. She is selling teenagers' clothing at the local market of Dushanbe city. She is trying to have a wide range of goods so as to be able to meet the requirements of her customers and to satisfy the needs of clients with different levels of income.

Today Shamigul is requesting 1200 USD with the purpose of purchasing additional merchandise to increase the range of her goods. She promises to repay the loan within 7 months. Be an important part of the growth of Shamigul’s business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: Purchasing clothing to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Makhsutali

texts.en:
Makhsutali is a 50-year-old man, married with four children, who dedicates his time to driving a taxi and a micro-bus. He currently relies on the micro-bus for his public transport business, which he drives personally. Makhsutali has about 15 years of experience in the public transportation field, and the competition is rather high in this business since there are so many people who need it. His current loan request is so that he can maintain his vehicle, since this is the tool of his trade. So now Makhsutali is counting on your help and requesting a loan of 800 USD for a term of 11 months. With the loan he’ll purchase spare parts for his micro-bus. With your support, Makhsutali will continue to progress.

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts in order to repair his micro-bus

loans.name: Sherali

texts.en:
S. Sherali is 37 years old. He is married with five children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuffs such as: sweets, meat products, preserved foods, soft drinks, juices and other items in his grocery store. Sherali is not alone in this business. His whole family actively helps him with sales.

Sherali admits he has benefited a lot in the past 3 years from his relationship with IMON International. Financial assistance he has received has helped him grow and expand his business. Currently Sherali is requesting a loan of 3253 Somoni for a term of 9 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once and a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.
