loans.use: Purchasing of the foodstuffs to  increase the range of goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: expand her inventory

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en:
Sharofat Y. is 46 years old. She is married with three children of school age. Sharofat is running a café where she is providing meals of the national and European cuisine. The café is located in the central local market which allows Sharofat to have many customers, the majority of whom are those making purchases in the market. The business has been generating a stable income during the last 12 years. Now Sharofat is planning to purchase foodstuffs like wheat, potatoes, carrots, onions, and oil wholesale. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting 800 US Dollars for a term of 11 months. Sharofat has already been provided with two loans by IMON International and has proved herself a reliable client. Today she thanks all supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: Purchasing of the foodstuffs like wheat, oil, potatoes, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Amtul Aziz M. Hafiz Group

texts.en:
My name is Amtul aziz and I’m 23 years old. I have lived in a mid-size city named Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 5 years. My husband's name is M. H., and he runs a grocery shop in the community. People are used to coming to him to buy groceries. He has a good reputation for dealing well with people. I have three sons, and all of them are enrolled in a school located near our house. As we all know, inflation is increasing day by day, and to survive I help my husband by making embroidered clothes. I charge $3 per dress. I use the amount I make to pay the school fees for my children. I have successfully repaid my first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I’m applying for a loan to buy groceries to expand my husband’s grocery shop. 

I’m a group leader of some more women. Sugran baji and Shahnaz baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Saba baji wants a loan to buy a donkey for her donkey cart. Iram baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a dryer, hair extensions, and cosmetics

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.en:
Abdurahmon is a hard working person and he makes an effort to give his 4 beloved children the best. He decided to stay in his home land so that he could develop it, and now he carries out his everyday chores with a lot of love and affection as he cultivates the land and feeds his animals. With experience gained over 3 years in the purchase and sale of cattle, he has been able to bring stability to his family. He would now like to purchase cattle to create more income for his large family. For this reason, he is requesting a loan. Abdurahmon thanks you very much for your support.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Gulchira

texts.en:
Gulchira M. is 46 years old. She is married with children of school age. Gulchira sells fabric for sewing traditional dresses. She has been in this business for almost 20 years. She has very good taste and she is ready to advise her clients which fabric to choose for this or that occasion. That is why she has constant customers. Moreover, Gulchira’s prices for fabrics are attractive for the various levels of population as she has a wide range of goods for any taste and any wallet.

The income that she derives allows her to educate her children. She hopes that she can continue to provide for them so they will be able to receive an adequate education. Now, Gulchira needs a loan to purchase new fabrics in order to increase the range of goods for sale. She promises to pay the loan back on time without any violation, and expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her. Your generosity can change their lives.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics in order to increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To acquire a new washing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To rent a store and to stock it

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina M. is fifty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to eight children, three of whom are females and five males. The last born is currently in the junior high school. The grown-ups have completed school and some are learning trades, while others are working. Georgina’s husband is a farmer who cultivates both cash crops and food crops such as cocoa, plantain, cassava, banana, etc. Georgina lives with her husband and some of her children in a rented apartment in Offinso. Ofinso is a farming as well as a commercial community in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

She is industrious, and sells maize to support her husband in taking care of the family. Georgina buys bags of maize from farmers who come from the surrounding villages to sell at affordable prices. She later sells it at the local market, especially to the food vendors in her community. Georgina has been in business for three years. She wants a loan to buy maize in large quantities so she can distribute to more customers.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize.

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima S. is a thirty year old married woman with four children - two boys and two girls. Three of her children are in the basic school at the moment. The last child is still breast-feeding and she hopes to wean her soon. Alima’s husband farms in the community where they live. He cultivates all kinds of food crops – cassava, plantain, maize, as well as vegetables. She lives with the family at Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Offinso are involved in farming activities. 

Alima trades in textiles fabrics and second hand clothes. She buys textile fabrics and all kinds of second hand clothes, especially skirts, from Kumasi, a nearby city, and sells them in the market square in her community. She says she has a small shed in which she sells. Alima has been in business for three years and wants a loan to increase her working capital to be able to procure bales of textiles.

loans.use: To buy bales of textiles and fabrics.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes O. is twenty-eight years old. She is a married woman and has one child, a boy who is currently at elementary school. Agnes’ husband is a welder by profession, and farms as well. Agnes and the family live in a family house at Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Offinso either farm or trade in farm products. Very few people run different types of business. 

Agnes trades in second hand textiles. She buys textile fabrics and all kinds of second hand clothes, including bed spreads, ladies’ wear and men’s wear, etc., from Kumasi, a nearby city. She then sells them at the market square in her community. She says she also travels to nearby markets to sell there as well. Agnes has been in this business for barely a year now and wants a loan to increase her working capital so that she can buy textiles in bales.

loans.use: To buy bales of second hand textiles.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa G. sells hardware items at a central market in Melitopol,Ukraine. Her gross income is 6,000 UAH per months. Larisa has been in this business for 12 years. Larisa's mother started a hardware business and Larisa decided to start her own business with similar inventories. It's a family business so they sell similar hardware items in different locations. Larisa is married with two children. 

Larisa would like to get a loan of 7,000 UAH ($900) to increase her inventory. There are some items such as spare parts for gas heaters customers can only buy from Larisa or other members of the family business giving them an advantage over their competitors.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of hardware

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma K. trades produce to support her husband and take care of the family. She trades tomatoes and other vegetables on a table top at the local market. She buys boxes of tomatoes, peppers etc from farmers who come from surrounding villages to sell at affordable prices. She sells mostly to food vendors in her community. Emma has been in business for three years. 

She is thirty-three years old and is married with four children; three boys and one girl. The first born is currently in junior high school and the others are in basic school. Emma’s husband is a farmer who cultivates food crops, such as plantains, cassava, and maize. Emma lives with her family in Offinso, a farming and commercial community in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Emma requests a loan  of $475 to buy vegetables in larger quantities so she can increase her profit margin to save more money to support the household and her kids education.

loans.use: To procure vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Adisa

texts.en:
Adisa I. sells fresh yams in the local market square. She buys tubers of yams in Kintampo in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana and sometimes from surrounding villages. Adisa has been in business for over ten years. She also distributes the yams to food vendors in her community. 

She is sixty–two years old, married with seven children: four girls and three boys. Her last born is in junior high school. The rest have completed school. Some of her children are working and living independently. She lives with her family in Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Adisa works hard to support her husband and take care of the family. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates food crops.

With the loan, she wants to purchase tubers of yams on a larger scale so she can cut down on cost, such as less trips to procure yams. Adisa hopes to improve her income and give more support to her child in school.

loans.use: To procure tubers of yams.

loans.name: Bernabé

texts.es: Bernabé tiene 34 años, se ha divorciado hace un año, por ahora se fue a vivir a la casa de su madre donde tiene un taller de reparación de motos lineales, sus 3 hijos se quedaron viviendo con su ex esposa. Hace 5 años que viene trabajando en su taller y todo este tiempo le ha sido muy rentable, está muy contento con la carrera que estudió, de la cual ahora disfruta los frutos. Por cada reparación cobra entre 60 y 80 soles, en especial en la época de cosecha de café donde utilizan más las motos para el transporte del producto, y por lo tanto requieren más de sus servicios. Debido a que este trabajo le da buenos beneficios quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio tiempo y dinero para que poco a poco su taller crezca, y no solo sea para reparaciones, sino también una tienda de venta de repuestos. Bernabé es el presidente de su banco comunal en MFP, es muy responsable y se esmera para todos los integrantes también lo sean y cumplan con sus pagos en las fechas fijadas. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra repuestos para motos, para ser también un proveedor de estas piezas.
texts.en:
Bernabé is 34 years old, has been divorced for one year, and for now lives at his mother’s house where he has a motorcycle repair shop. His three children remain with his ex-wife. He has had his workshop for five years, during which time it has proven itself to be very profitable. He is very content with the career he studied, and now enjoys the fruits of his labors. He charges 60.00 to 80.00 Peruvian soles per repair, particularly during the coffee harvest season when motorcycles are used frequently to transport the product and therefore require more of his services. Given that his work earns him a good income, he would like to continue investing in his business so he can slowly expand it. He would like to undertake not only repairs, but also open a store that sells replacement parts. Bernabé is president of his cooperative bank in MFP; he is very responsible and cares a great deal that all the members also fulfill their loan obligations on time. The funds requested would be invested into the purchase of motorcycle repair parts, so he can also be a provider of these types of items.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase repair parts for motocycles.

loans.name: Herdolfo

texts.es: Herdolfo tiene 62 años de edad, es casado hace 32 años, de los cuales tiene 6 hijos, actualmente vive con 3 de ellos en su casa propia. Durante toda su vida ha sido comerciante, ha realizado varios negocios, siempre cambiando de acuerdo a las temporadas y novedades, hace 4 años alquiló un local para instalar una tienda de juguetes donde se pueden encontrar de los más variados artículos, y aproximadamente hace 4 meses comenzó a vender también colchones, edredones y sabanas. Desde las 6am el negocio de Herdolfo esta listo para atender al público, al día saca gana cerca de 80 soles. Y como el paso de los años ha mellado en este hombre trabajador, ha empezado a sentir dolencias en los pies y no puede movilizarse con rapidez y mucho menos cargar peso; debido a ello sus hijos están a cargo del negocio bajo su supervisión. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, generalmente no puede asistir a las reuniones del grupo, pero es muy puntual en sus pagos, y está muy agradecido por la facilidad que le brinda la institución. Con el dinero solicitado comprará 6 colchones de buena marca para que le sirvan de capital y los exhiba en su local para atraer la atención.
texts.en:
Herdolfo is 62 years old, has been married for 32 years and has six children. Currently, three of them live with him in his own house. His whole life, he has been a merchant having undertaken several businesses, changing in step with the season. Four years ago, he rented a site to open a toy store where one can find a variety of items. Approximately four months ago, he also started selling mattresses, comforters and sheets. Herdolfo’s business is ready to serve customers starting at 6 am and, each day, he earns about 80.00 Peruvian soles. The passage of time has chipped away at this hard-working man, and he is starting to suffer from pain in his feet causing him to be unable to move quickly or carry heavy loads. Due to this, his children tend to the business under his supervision. This is his second loan with MFP and, generally, he cannot attend the group’s meetings but he is very punctual with his loan payments. He is very thankful for the support provided to him by the institution. With the funds requested, he will purchase 6 brand name mattresses which he will exhibit at his location to attract attention.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase some brand-name mattresses.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es: Eusebio tiene 47 años de edad, viene conviviendo con su pareja cerca de 12 años, con la que tiene 2 hijos que están estudiando en el colegio de su pueblo, viven en su casa propia. Desde muy niño se dedica a las labores agrícolas, asimismo siempre ha criado muchos animales como vacas y toros para el arado de sus tierras y de ese modo sembrar en grandes cantidades. En esta oportunidad ha sembrado 3 bolsas de semilla de alverja, Eusebio prefiere sembrar de la semilla llamada “súper mejorada” que es más resistente a comparación de las otras semillas, y en tiempo de cosecha bota por cada tallo de 4 a 5 vainitas lo que es muy favorable, claro, previo abonado que todo cultivo requiere. Asimismo ha sembrado 60 sacos de semilla de papa, pero esta papa no es para consumo, más bien, es destinada para ser la semilla, para Eusebio es más rentable que vender papa para consumo. También comenta que es muy rentable invertir en la compra de animales grandes, con su primer préstamo de MFP compró una vaca y que ahora ya tiene su cría. Eusebio viene recibiendo un préstamo con MFP por la cuarta vez, y todo este tiempo ha no ha tenido dificultad de pagar en las fechas señaladas, y en este nuevo préstamo se compromete a seguir pagando de forma puntual. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de 3 bolsas de semilla de alverja, cada bolsa cuesta la suma de 600 soles, y el resto del dinero en insecticidas para el fumigado correspondiente.
texts.en:
Eusebio is 47 years old, and has lived with his partner for nearly 12 years with whom he has two children that are studying at the local school. He owns his own home. Since he was a child, he has dedicated himself to farming. In addition, he has always raised livestock such as cows and bulls to help him plow his fields so he can plant in large quantities. Currently, he has planted three sacks of pea seeds. Eusebio prefers to plant a seed called “Super-Improved” which is more resistant than other varieties of seed. During planting season he yields 4 or 5 stalks per hill which is very favorable, having fertilized well first, of course. Likewise, he has planted 60 sacks of potato seed. These potatoes are not for consumption, and are instead destined to become seed which is more profitable for Eusebio. He also tells us that it is profitable to invest in the purchase of large livestock. With his first loan from MFP, he bought a cow and he now has its offspring. Eusebio has received a loan with MFP four times, and the entire time he has not had a problem paying his installments on the designated date. He promises to continue paying this loan on time as well. The funds he requests are for the purchase of three bags of pea seeds, each bag costing 600.00 Peruvian soles. The remainder of the funds will be invested into insecticides to fumigate his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds and insecticides.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina tiene 28 años de edad, por mucho estuvo viviendo con su pareja, pero hace 6 años se casaron, viven en una casa alquilada. Desde que se casó es la encargada de preparar los almuerzos para los que laboran en la chacra, se levanta eso de las 6.00am para preparar el desayuno, luego alimenta a los animales que cría, tanto cuyes, como conejos, y ahora último acaba de comprar tres cerditos de los que tiene que estar muy al pendiente de su alimentación. A eso de las 8.00am preparar el menú para llevar el almuerzo para su esposo que esta preparando la chacra para la siembra de arvejas, una vez que les sirvió regresa recogiendo pasto para sus cuyes y conejos. Pero cuando es la temporada de cosecha si permanece en la chacra para coger las arvejas y a la vez supervisar a los peones. Mientras que su esposo se dedica a los trabajos más duros y pesados como cargar los sacos una vez que ya están cosechadas. Delfina viene trabajando 4 préstamos consecutivos con MFP y siempre pagó todas sus cuotas en las fechas fijadas. La cantidad solicitada es para la compra de 2 sacos de semilla de arvejas, lo que calcula costará 820 soles y con el resto del dinero comprará abonos para la chacra de papa que sembraron hace un mes.
texts.en:
Delfina is 28 years old, and has lived with her partner for many years. They married six years ago, and live in a rented house. Since they married, she is in charge of preparing meals for those who work on the farm. She gets up at 6.00am to make breakfast, then feeds the animals that she raises, including guinea pigs and rabbits. She has recently bought three little pigs, and has to be very attentive to their feeding. At 8.00am she makes the lunch meal to take out to her husband, who is preparing the fields for sowing peas. Once she has delivered the meal she returns home with grass for the guinea pigs and rabbits. During the harvest season she stays out in the fields to pick the peas and supervise the labourers. Her husband undertakes the hard and heavy work such as filling the sacks with the harvest. Delfina has worked with MFP on four consecutive loans and has always made her repayments on the designated dates. This loan will be used to buy two bags of pea seeds which will cost 820 soles, and with the rest of the money she will buy fertilizer for the potato field that was sown one month ago.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam tiene 20 años de edad, hace un año empezó a vivir con su pareja con la que tiene un bebe de 8 meses, vienen viviendo en la casa de su suegra. Desde que vive en casa de su suegra se dedica a pastar las vacas de ella, pero hay días en que trabaja en la chacra con su esposo, entonces, en esos días tiene que levantarse temprano para cocinar el almuerzo y llevarlo a la chacra, de paso va llevando los animales para sujetarlos en un lugar donde haya mucho pasto para que puedan comer. Miriam y su esposo en esta oportunidad han sembrado arvejas en chacras alquiladas que les cobran por cada cultivo realizado, lo bueno es que son terreno con acceso a la movilidad y cuando va caminando de su casa a la chacra lo hace en solo media hora. Ella está contenta con su trabajo, ya sea trabajar en la chacra o pastar a los animales, la única dificultad que tienen es cuando llueve en exceso, como lleva su bebé en la espalda debe cubrirlo muy bien, ya que una vez se mojó y se resfrió, debido a ello cuando llueve muy fuerte lo sujeta y regresa a su casa. Este es el 4to préstamo que tiene Miriam con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha asistido a todas las reuniones que realiza el asesor de crédito, y sobre todo los pagos, los efectúa en los días señalados sin caer en morosidad. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de 3 sacos de semillas de arvejas que sembrará en esta temporada con la esperanza de tener una buena cosecha en el mes de mayo.
texts.en:
Miriam is 20 years old, and as of a year ago she began to live with her partner which whom she has an 8 month year old baby. They are currently living in her mother-in-law’s house. Since she began living at her mother-in-law’s home she dedicates herself to taking her cows to pasture, but there are also days that she works on the small farm with her husband, on those days she wakes up early to cook lunch and takes it into the fields. On her way she also takes the animals and ties them to places where there is a lot of pasture for them to eat. Miriam and her husband have taken this opportunity to plant peas on rented small plots of land that charge them for each cultivated crop. The good thing is that they are plots of land with good road access, and when she walks from her home to the fields she can do it in only half an hour. She is happy with her work, be it working on the small farm or putting the animals to pasture, the only difficulty is that it when it rains a great deal because she carries her baby on her back she has to cover him very well, given that once he got wet and caught a cold. As such when it rains hard she gets a hold of him and returns home. This is the 4th loan that Miriam has with the MFP bank, and in all this time she has attended all the meetings that the loan adviser carries out. Especially when it comes to payments, she always makes them on the assigned days and has never had a delinquent payment. Miriam will invest the loan requested in the purchase of 3 sacks of pea seeds, which she will plant this season with the hope of having a good crop yield in the month of May.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pea seeds.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Haydee cuenta con 29 años de edad, estuvo conviviendo por 9 años, pero hace 6 meses se ha casado, por el momento esta viviendo en la casa de sus suegra. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la agricultura, sembrando arvejas y papas, pero lo que más le agrada es cultivar flores de gladiolo, aunque tienen un largo proceso; una vez listas las pepitas de semilla se procede a abrir los surcos, en seguida se colocan las semillas y se entierra, se espera a que germine, una ves que haya brotado la planta se procede con el fumigado hasta que maduren las flores. Lo más gratificante para ella es el precio en que los llega a vender en el mes de mayo y octubre por las festividades del día de la madre y de los muertos respectivamente, llegan a pagarle por el paqueta hasta 80 soles, pasada esta temporada baja hasta mitad el precio, pero igual no pierde, ya que lo que aun esta en la tierra, lo deja madurar para realizar el proceso de la semilla. En semilla cuesta mucho más, la vende a 150 soles el saco, por todo este beneficio es lo que le agrada sembrar gladiolos. Haydee es nueva en MFP, ella y otras amistades han formado un nuevo banco comunal con el compromiso de pagar todas las cuotas en el día indicado y seguir las instrucciones de su asesor de crédito. El dinero que solicita es para comprar 10 sacos de abono para su chacra de flores que va sembrar en estos días, tiene referencia que cada saco le costará 95 soles y con lo que le pueda sobrar comprará veneno contra las moscas.
texts.en:
Haydee is 29 years old and has been living with the man who is her husband for nine years, and they have been married for six. At the moment she is living with her mother-in-law. Ever since she was very young, she has been committed to agriculture, growing peas and potatoes. But what gives her the most pleasure is growing gladiolas, although the process for doing so is much more involved. When the seeds are ready to be planted, the rows must be tilled, then the seeds must be planted and buried. Then you must wait until they germintate, then once the plants get buds, you fumigate them until the flowers are mature. The most gratifying part for her is the price she is able to sell them for in the months of May and October, when the holidays of Mother's Day and the Day of the Dead occur, respectively, when a bouquet can be sold for 80 soles. When these seasons have passed, the price goes down to half of that, but the loss does not matter as long as she can be in the land--she could take or leave the mature flowers for the process of just growing the seeds. The seeds cost a lot and are sold for about 150 soles for a sack, but the benefit is being able to grwo gladiolas. Haydee is new to the lender, MFP, and she and others have formed a new comunnal bank with the commitment of paying all of the payments back by the time indicated and according to the instructions of the loan consultant. The money that she asks for will buy 10 sacks of fertilizer for her flower farm, with the point of reference that a sack will cost 95 soles and with which she will have more than enough to also prevent flies.

Translated from Spanish by Misty McNally, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 34 años de edad, es casada cerca de 12 años, es madre de dos hijos, viven en su casa propia. Pese a tener el pie lisiado Rosa trabaja con mucho esmero, aunque no puede movilizarse con la rapidez que ella quisiera, pero eso no la desanima, su esposo se dedica a las labores agrícolas y sus hermanos le apoyan. La modalidad de trabajo de esta familia se denomina, en su léxico, “fajete” que consiste en trabajar primero en la chacra de Rosa, después en la chacra de su madre, y luego en la de los hermanos, de ese modo todos realizan una faena en cada una de sus chacras sin sufrir demasiado sacrificio. Rosa en horas de la mañana va a casa de su madre para preparar el almuerzo para todos los faeneros, y eso de las 11.00am carga en su burro llegando a la chacra a las 12 y procede a servir a todos los que laboran en ella.  En esta oportunidad, al igual que todos los días, su familia está en la chacra sembrando papa y Rosa está preparando los insecticidas que llevará en el momento de transportar el almuerzo, trabajar de este modo es relajado y entretenido, porque lo realizan en armonía. Para llevar los productos al mercado, también lo hacen en unidad, y cada quien contabilidad la cantidad de sacos que transporta. Rosa y su familia se sienten satisfechos y agradecidos a la agricultura y a Dios por mantener la unidad de su familia, asimismo por los buenos frutos que cosechan cada vez que siembran. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, en el ciclo anterior ocupaba el cargo de tesorera y demostró mucha responsabilidad en los cobros que realizaba, y en sus cuotas particulares tampoco ha caído en mora. El dinero que ha solicitado lo usará en la compra de insecticidas y fertilizantes para sus chacras de papa, para cosechar en la cantidad y calidad que tienen propuesto.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 34-year-old woman who has been married for almost 12 years and has 2 children. She and her family live in their own house. Despite having a crippled foot, Rosa works painstakingly. Even though she cannot move as quickly as she would like to, she does not get discouraged. Her husband works in agriculture and her brothers help him. The name of the work that they do is called “fajete” in their vernacular. It consists of working first in Rosa’s farm, then in their mother’s farm, then in her brothers’ farms, that way they all work each others' farms without exerting themselves too much. In the morning, Rosa goes to her mother’s house to prepare lunch for all the farm workers, and around 11:00 am, she takes her donkey and arrives at the farm at 12:00. She then proceeds to serve lunch to all the workers there. At that time, her family is growing potatoes on the farm while Rosa is preparing the pesticides that she carried along with the lunches. Working this way is more relaxing and entertaining because the work is done in harmony. They take their crops to market together, and each person accounts for the amount of sacks they transport. Rosa and her family are satisfied with and grateful to agriculture and to God for keeping the family united. They are also grateful for the crops that they harvest every time they plant them. This is her third loan with MFP. During the previous loan cycle, she was the treasurer, demonstrating responsibility when collecting payments. She has not been late with her own payments either. The money that she is requesting will be used to purchase pesticides and fertilizer for her potato fields so that she can plant greater quantities and improve the quality of her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 25 años de edad, vive hace 4 años con su pareja, tienen 2 preciosos hijos, actualmente está viviendo en la casa de su madre.Desde pequeña se han dedicado a labrar la tierra, cultiva papa y en menor cantidad arveja. En todo este tiempo ha ido aprendiendo los gajes de una buena agricultora, su especialidad es la siembra de papa, para ello se levanta a las 4.00am a preparar los alimentos y a eso de las 8.00am carga la comida y camina 1 hora y media para llegar a sus chacras, y mientras que su esposo labora en la chacra desde las 6.00am, para que avancen y no les gane el tiempo. La dificultad que les acecha y no pueden controlar  es cuando cae hielo a la papa, pierden sin reparo alguno, debido a este factor siembran en las chacras de regadío, pero no tienen propias, por lo que alquilan si encuentran algunas libres; así no pierden mucho y a la vez no es de mucha inversión, y la otra parte siembran la chacra temporal donde tienen sus terrenos, pero es más costosa la inversión y corre peligro de la helada. Elizabeth es una cliente muy antigua de MFP, viene trabajando 7 préstamos consecutivos, en todo este tiempo ha crecido en su actividad sembrando cada vez en mayor cantidad, por ello le tiene mucha gratitud a esta institución, y sigue comprometida a realizar los pagos en las fechas exactas. El dinero solicitado es para la compra del insecticida llamado Temex que cuesta aproximadamente 1000 soles, y con el resto comprará sacos de fertilizantes, cada bolsa cuesta 95 soles.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 25-year-old woman who has been living with her husband for 4 years. They have 2 precious children and are currently living in her mother’s home. Ever since she was young, she has worked the land. She grows potatoes and, on a smaller scale, peas. During this whole time, she has been learning the responsibilities of a good farmer. Her specialty is growing potatoes, for which she gets up at 4:00 am to prepare meals. At around 8:00am, she takes the food and walks for an hour and a half to get to her farms. Meanwhile, her husband starts working the fields at 6:00am in order to get a head start. The problem, which is out of their control, that threatens them is when frost affects the potatoes, they lose their investment. Because of this aspect, they grow crops in irrigated lands, but they do not have their own land, which means they must rent land that is available. Hence, they do not lose much and at the same time, they do not invest much. They plant the other half on their seasonal farm, but the investment is more costly and they run the risk of frost. Elizabeth is a senior member of MFP. She has requested 7 consecutive loans, during which time her business has expanded and her crops have increased. For this reason, she is very grateful to this institute. She is still committed to making her payments punctually. The money being requested will be used to purchase a pesticide called Temex, which costs approximately 1,000.00 PEN, and fertilizer at 95.00 PEN a sack.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia A. B., 45 years old, married to Herminio A. B. 	
and they have four children. Two of the childrne have already completed their studies while the others are still in school. They live at Sicayab, Dipolog City.			
       Her sari-sari ( small grocery)  store business plays an important role in their lives especially in sending her children to school.  She started her business with a capital of PhP200.  With the help of God ,  her capital has grown to PhP1000 and has added other goods and commodities to her small sari-sari store.
     Because of her desire to expand her sari-sari store,  she decided joining Paglaum MPC to avail loan of PhP14,000 to buy additional merchandise such as basic commodities for sale.  She thinks that this would help her business to grow.			
       Through this, she wants to see all her children to finish their studies.  She also plans 
to make her sari-sari store a mini-grocery in the near future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail store

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 21 años de edad, muy pronto será madre, actualmente está viviendo en la casa de su madre con sus 6 hermanos y sus padres. Maritza trabaja en la chacra de sus padres conjuntamente con sus hermanos, siembran papa, a ella le agrada sembrar este tubérculo porque es muy rentable, se vende el saco a 60 ó 65 soles, pero tienen que pagar el transporte que es 3 soles por saco, por ello Maritza prefiere esperar a que los compradores pasan por su chacra y así ahorrar el transporte, porque el que compra se lleva el producto. Luego de la cosecha de la papa hecha los granos de arvejas para aprovechar el abono que tiene la chacra y está rica en sustancias que fertilizan la tierra, por ello es que procede a sembrar los granos de arvejas rápidamente, entonces para el proceso de maduración de este producto ya no requerirá mucha inversión, solo estar pendiente de las plagas. Maritza tiene casi 3 años en MFP, este es su 6to préstamo, y está comprometida a seguir con la misma dinámica de trabajo y de pagos puntuales. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de fertilizantes, asimismo bolsa de semilla de arvejas para sembrar en la chacra donde va cosechar la papa, con la finalidad de ir incrementando su producción.
texts.en:
Maritza is 21 years old. She will become a mother very soon. At present she is living at her mother's house with her 6 brothers and sisters. Maritza works at her parent's small farm along with her brothers. They sow potatoes and she likes it because it is very profitable. The sack of potatoes sells for 60 to 65 soles ($18-20), but they have to pay 3 soles ($1) per sack for transportation; for this reason Maritza prefers to wait for the buyers to come to her small farm and this way to save on transportation, because the buyer takes the product. After they harvest the potatoes, they sow pea grains because the land is quite rich in substances that fertilize the ground, therefore they don't need a big investment. They only need to look after it to prevent plagues. Maritza has been a member of MFP (Kiva's partner) for almost 3 years. This is her 6th loan, and she is committed to continue with the same dynamics of work and of punctual payments. The requested money will be use to buy fertilizers, also a bag of pea seeds to sow at the small farm where they will harvest potatoes, in order to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa tiene 56 años de edad, conviviente por 30 años, es madre de 8 hijos, en la actualidad vive solo con sus dos hijos menores, y está muy triste porque hace menos de dos semanas que falleció su esposo. En vida, su esposo trabajaba con sus hijos en la chacra y Elsa se a criar cerdos, carneros y vacas, porque su esposo decía que la chacra era trabajo para varones, pero ahora tendrá que hacerse cargo de los cultivos de su esposo por lo que está preocupada porque no podrá cuidar de sus animales. Elsa no cuenta que mayormente siembran papa y que las ganancias de todos estos años de trabajo les ha permitido comprar su casa, adquirir sus propios terrenos de cultivos y sobre todo, educar a sus hijos. Mientras que los gastos de alimentación los cubría con la venta de carne de cerdo, y cuando les faltaba vendía sus vacas a 800 ó 1000 soles, dependiendo de la raza. Y cuando la vaca proveía leche hacía quesos y los vendía. Ahora con la muerte de su esposo, la única esperanza y lo que le motiva a sobreponerse de su pena son sus menores hijos. Elsa es muy activa en su banco comunal, el ciclo pasado tenía el cargo de vocal, se encargaba de pasar los comunicados del asesor de crédito a los integrantes, este es su 7mo préstamo, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad. El dinero que solicita es par la compra de fertilizantes e insecticidas para contrarrestar al gusano que ataca la papa. Cabe mencionar que ella está muy agradecida con aquellos que hacen posible este crédito para que pueda trabajar.
texts.en:
Elsa is 56 years old, she had her partner for 30 years. She is a mother of 8 children. At present she lives alone with her two younger children, and she is very sad because less than two weeks ago her husband died. In life, her husband used to work with her children at the small farm and Elsa worked raising pigs, rams and cows, because her husband used to say that the work at the small farm was only for men. Now she will have to take charge of her husband's farm, but she is worried because she will not be able to take care of her animals. Elsa tell us they mainly sow potatoes and that with the profits of all these years of work they were able to buy their house, acquire their own farming lots and especially educate their children. Whereas the food expenses were covered by the sales of pork, and when they didn't have enough they would sell the cows for 800 or 1000 soles( $250-315), depending on the race. And when the cow produced milk she would make and sell cheese. Now after the death of her husband, it's only hope and her young children what motivates her to get over her sorrow. Elsa is quite active in her communal bank, the past cycle she was a member of the council. She was in charge of giving the announcements from the loan adviser to the members. This her 7th loan, and in all this time she has demonstrated to pay her quotas with great responsibility. The requested money will be use to buy fertilizers and insecticides to protect the potatoes from the worms. It's worth mentioning that she is very grateful to those who make this loan possible so she can work.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Mrs. Susan A., 58 years old, married and lives at Olingan, Dipolog City. She has 4 children. Her husband is a fisherman. In order to help her husband, she decided to join Paglaum MPC to avail loan to finance her snack vending  -- kamote (sweet potatoes)  and banana cue. It was a good start for Mrs. A., that she earned income from her micro-business. Due to demand of some of her neighbors, she also try to sell viands. Now, she applies PhP7,000 to Paglaum Cooperative to buy banana, "kamote" (sweet potato) for snacks, meat and fish  for viand-vending. In the future, she wants to own a mini restaurant & snack -inn. She would be happy to see her children lives in a comfortable life with their chosen careers.

loans.use: to buy banana, sweet potatoes, meat, fish for her viand & snack vending

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 43 años de edad, es casada hace 27 años, de esa relación conyugal tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales uno de ellos murió, hace poco se casó su segunda hija, desde entonces viven ella y su esposo con una de sus hijas en su casa propia. Esta pareja se dedica a la agricultura, siembran papa, luego de la siembra su esposo se queda al pendiente de los cultivos mientras que ella vende comida en la plaza principal de su localidad llamada Huasahuasi, el plato que vende se denomina “sopa verde” preparada a base de papas picadas, la hierba llamada muña que hierve junto con la papa y se acompaña con un huevo sancochado. Yolanda permanece en la plaza de 9 a 10 de la mañana, después compra lo necesario para el día siguiente. Una vez que haya almorzado y enviado el almuerzo a su esposo se dedica hilar lana de carnero para mandar a tejer mantas, las cuales vende cada una a 40 soles, esta actividad la realiza desde que tenía 18 años porque su padre era artesano y se dedicaba a la producción de mantas y frazadas de lana de carnero, mientras que su madre y ella hilaban. Esta actividad es la que más la entretiene. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP y con el dinero que está solicitando comprará fertilizantes para sus chacras de papa.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 43 years old. She married 27 years ago and she has 3 children from this relationship, one of whom died and not long ago her second daughter married. Since then she lives with her husband and one of her daughters at their own house. This partner works in agriculture, she sows potatoes, and after sowing her husband stays to look after the farm while she sells food at the main square of her town Huasahuasi. The dish she sells is called “green soup” prepared with diced potatoes and a herb called "muña" which she boils together with the potatoes and serves with a parboiled egg. Yolanda stays at the square from 9 to 10 in the morning, later she buys what she needs for the following day. Once she has had lunch and sent lunch to her husband, she spins wool of ram so she can weave blankets, which she sells each for 40 soles ($12). She has done this activity since she was 18 years old because her father was a craftsman and he produced blankets and ram woolen blankets, while her mother and she were spinning. This is the activity that really keeps her busy. This is her 7th loan with MFP (Kiva's partner) and with the requested money she will buy fertilizers for her potato small farm.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertlizers

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia tiene 42 años, vive hace 25 años con el padre de sus 4 hijos, después de haber vivido por muchos años en la casa de su suegra ya disfrutan de vivir en su casa propia. Ambos son agricultores, cultivan papa y arveja, pero cada jueves de cada 15 días Celia recolecta los quesos que elaboran sus vecinas y amistades luego en 20 se transporta al pueblo, de allí se embarca para la provincia, y finalmente compra un boleto de viaje para la capital, amaneciendo en Lima el sábado, llega a la casa de su hermana y comienza con el negocio, repartiendo de uno en uno los quesos, que ha llevado, el domingo realiza las cobranzas y por la noche toma el bus para regresar a su casa a seguir con la labores de casa y agrícolas a lado de su esposo e hijos. Este es el 7mo préstamo que tiene con MFP, el ciclo anterior tenía el cargo de tesorera, cumpliendo su cargo con mucha responsabilidad, y sus pagos los realiza en las fechas exactas. El dinero solicitado le servirá para la compra de quesos, y el resto del dinero los va utilizar en la compra de fertilizantes para abonar su chacra de papas que esta próxima a remover la tierra para que la semilla germina con facilidad.
texts.en:
Celia is a 42-year-old woman who has been living with the father of her 4 children for 25 years. After having lived in her mother-in-law’s house for many years, she and her husband now enjoy the comfort of living in their own home. They are both farmers who grow potatoes and peas. However, every other Thursday Celia collects cheese that her friends and neighbors make, and then she goes to town. There, she heads off to the province, where she finally purchases a ticket to the capital. Waking up in Lima on Saturday, she arrives at her sister’s house and starts her business distributing the cheese one by one. On Sunday, she collects payments and in the evening, she takes a bus home so that she can continue with the household and agricultural duties alongside her husband and children. This is her 7th loan with MFP. In the previous loan cycle, she was the treasurer of the group, fulfilling her post with great responsibility. She makes her payments punctually. The money she is requesting will help her purchase cheese, and the rest of the money will be used to purchase fertilizer for her potato farm, which will soon be ready to be tilled so that the seeds can germinate easily.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase greater quantity of cheese

loans.name: Enriquieta

texts.en: Mrs. Enriquieta A., 47 years old, married and lives at Olingan, Dipolog City. Her husband is a fisherman. She has 5 children and 4 of them are in school. She has much desire to help her husband. She decided to raise pigs in order to have additional income. Mrs. A. has been a MIGS (member in good standing) of Paglaum Cooperative since September 2006.  She had availed loan for several times already. The cooperative really helps them especially when it comes to financial matters. At present she applies Php7,000 to buy feeds and injectable medicines for her pigs. She is looking forward to own a piggery someday.  She wants to uphold the good records she has shown to the cooperative and for Paglaum MPC also to reach out to those are needing the help.

loans.use: to buy feeds and injectables for her pigs

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate I. sells yams. She is 46 years old, married with 2 children. Her husband is a civil servant. Kate plans to increase her profit margin so she can take care of her children in school. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN ($675) to purchase more yams to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Mrs. Carmelita E., 57 years old, married & a resident of Olingan, Dipolog City. Their source of income is sari-sari store. Her husband is a carpenter. Fortunately, Mrs. E. has managed the business so well that it has expanded with just a  start-up capital of Php 10,000. Mrs. E. heard of Paglaum Cooperative and became interested on the benefits given to its members, like savings, insurances, dividends and the like. She decided to join the cooperative last August 2007, and already availed loan for 2 times already. Now, she is applying for a loan of  PhP7,000 to buy additional soft drinks and canned goods for sale. In the future, she wants to see her child finish his school.

loans.use: to buy softdrinks & canned goods for sale

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 47 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos que cursan estudios técnicos, vive junto a su esposo. Se dedica a la venta de plátanos y verduras regionales desde hace 3 años en un espacio que acondicionó para su negocio en su vivienda. Le gusta tener un trato directo con sus clientes y en varios casos mantiene amenas conversaciones con ellos. Lo que beneficia a su negocio es que su casa está ubicada en una buena zona donde es la única que vende estos productos. Sonia está muy contenta porque con esta actividad está logrando mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia aportando a la remuneración de su esposo, ingresos para sustentar satisfactoriamente los gastos de su familia. Este es su 3er crédito con MFP, y con el dinero solicitado mandará a construir un techo a base de ramas, muy común en su región, a esta estructura le llaman “ramada” y lo hacen para acondicionar los puestos de venta al aire libre bajo sombra, debido al calor de la zona.
texts.en:
Sonia is a 47-year-old mother with three children who are pursuing technical degrees. She lives with her husband and has been selling plantains and local produce for 3 years in a section in her home where she set up her business. She likes to deal with her customers directly and on many occasions, she has pleasant chats with them. What benefits her business the most is that her house is located in an optimal area in which she is the only one to sell that produce. Sonia is very happy because this business has helped to improve her and her family’s quality of life, adding to her husband’s wages so that they can cover the family expenses suitably. This is her 3rd loan with MFP. With this loan, she will have a thatch roof made, which is very common in her region. The structure is called a “ramada” and is used for shade for open air stands because of all the heat in the region.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a roof for her business space

loans.name: Emma

texts.es: Emma tiene 37 años, es madre de 4 hijos en edad escolara, vive con su esposo, quien la ayuda en lo posible. La casa donde viven es alquilada. Desde temprana edad Emma manifestó habilidades en el arte textil, luego tuvo la posibilidad de estudiar este oficio y perfeccionar sus ideas y conocimientos que aprendió inicialmente de manera empírica. La experiencia (5 años) y la práctica hacen de esta mujer una máquina de trabajo, por lo que casi cada uno de sus clientes ha recomendado a otras personas que también han venido en busca del buen trabajo de Emma. Su pequeño taller está acondicionado en su propia casa, y su deseo para el futuro es lograr tener un gran taller textil. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero solicitado quiere mandar a construir un local adecuado para su taller textil y así dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Emma is a 37-year-old mother of 4 children. She lives with her husband, who helps her when possible. They live in a rented home. Emma learned the art of textiles at a very young age. Later she was able to study this trade and improve her earlier empirical ideas and practices. Her experience (of 5 years) and practice illustrate this woman's dedication, which has caused her clients to recommend her services to others. Her small workshop is located in her home. Her wish for the future is to establish a larger textile workshop. This is her third loan with MFP, and with this loan she intends to build an adequate space for her workshop and thus provide better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her textile workshop space

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
El Emprendedor Concepción R. B. tiene la edad de 47 años, su estado civil es acompañado, Don Concepción tiene 2 hijos con las siguientes edades un varón de 10 años y cursa el 4 grado de primaria y su hijo mayor de 17 años que cursa el 4 año de secundaria, su compañera de vida no labora, los propósitos de Don Concepción son de mejorar cada día en la calidad de su negocio y proporcionarle al cliente la mejor atención para que quede satisfecho con el servicio sus deseos son que uno de sus hijos sea docente a como lo es Don Concepción para que esta tradición se mantenga en familia  por lo que Don Concepción tiene 2 trabajos imparte clases de primaria y el destace de cerdo que es una ayuda para sacar adelante a sus hijos sus sueños son seguir luchando en la vida para darle a su familia todo lo necesario para que no pasen por necesidades y también el contribuir a darle a sus hijos y a su esposa un lugar digno para vivir y así enseñarles a sus hijos a luchar por sus deseos y sueños propuestos.


La actividad económica a la que Don Concepción se dedica es el destace de cerdo, la ubicación de su negocio es en malpaisillo en el barrio larreynaga, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 15 años, Don Concepción inicio este negocio por necesidades de cubrir los gastos de su familia ya que el imparte clases de primaria y al ver que el salario no le ajustaba por lo que se ve obligado a trabajar en un oficio como es el destace de cerdo al comienzo le fue difícil porque no tenia la practica pero con la ayuda del tiempo fue que la adquirió y fue así como empezó y sus clientes le realizaban los pedidos de carne y así logro su fama con sus vecinos y sus amigos su esposa lo apoya y le ayuda en este oficio que le beneficia a toda la familia, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdo en pie ya que tiene que recorrer las diferentes comarcas en busca del mejor cerdo para sacar una buena producción de este.
texts.en:
Concepción R. B. is a 47-year-old entrepreneur who has a live-in partner and 2 children—a 10-year-old son who is in the fourth grade and a 17-year-old son who is a senior in high school. His live-in partner does not work. Mr. R.’ goals are to improve the quality of his business and provide better customer service so that the customer can be satisfied. He hopes that one of his sons will be a teacher like he is, so that the family tradition can stay alive. Mr. Concepción is both an elementary school teacher and a pork butcher, and these two jobs help him move his sons forward in life. He wants to keep struggling in life in order to give his family everything they need, and he wants to give them a decent dwelling, thus showing his children how to struggle to reach their dreams, wishes, and goals.

Mr. Concepción has a pork business located on Malpaisillo, in the Larreynaga neighborhood. He has been in business for 15 years, a business which he started out of the necessity to cover his family’s expenses because his teaching salary was insufficient. At first, being a pork butcher was difficult for him due to his lack of experience, but as time passed by, he started gaining more experience and consequently more customers. He gained popularity through his friends and neighbors, who started ordering pork. His wife supports him and helps him with the business, which benefits the whole family. The loan will be used as business capital to purchase pork because he has to frequent the different regions in search of the best pork.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy O. sells provisions, drinks, yams and garri. She plans to increase her stock to increase her profits to enable her to take good care of her children and pay their school fees. She is 43 years old, married with 6 children. She is requesting a loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more yams, garri, provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, provisions, yams and garri to sell

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 32 años, es madre de 2 hijos, vive con su esposo en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a vender productos de belleza por catálogo de una línea cosmética muy reconocida a nivel nacional, estos productos los lleva a vender por diferentes lugares de Pucallpa de puerta en puerta y a sus amistades y vecinos, dejándolos al contado y al crédito. María trabaja solo por las tardes y le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que por medio del mismo conoce mucha gente y se relaciona más, además es rentable porque cuenta con sus clientes que le comprar desde que se inició. Pero su negocio también tiene un riesgo, que es cuando las personas incumplen con su pago, pero María ya tomado experiencia para manejar estas situaciones. Ella se considera una mujer decidida y luchadora, pues lo que se propone lo cumple y esto está poniendo en práctica en su negocio y con su record de ventas. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, con el dinero solicitado va a comprar más productos y una vitrina para exhibición y seguridad de estos.
texts.en:
Maria is 32 years old, is the mother of two children and lives with her husband in their own home. For three years she has dedicated herself to selling a nationally recognized line of beauty products by catalog. She sells these products - cash or credit - door-to-door in various places in Pucallpa and to her friends and neighbors. Maria only works in the evenings and she enjoys her work very much as it allows her to meet a lot of people. Her business is also profitable since she relies on clients that have been with her since she started her business. Her business also has some risk which is when people do not pay what they owe but Maria has experience in dealing with these situations. Maria considers herself a dedicated and hardworking woman since she accomplishes what she sets out to do. She practices this in her business and this shows in her sales. This is Maria's second loan with MFP. She will use this loan to purchase more products and a display cabinet to display and protect her products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and a display case.

loans.name: Paquita

texts.es: Paquita tiene 59 años, es madre de 6 hijos que ya son independientes y de familia. En la actualidad vive con su esposo quien la apoya en todo. La casa donde viven es propia. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a brindar servicios de lavandería en su casa. Gracias a este trabajo solventó los gastos de estudio de sus hijos, quienes se sienten muy orgullosos de tener una madre tan trabajadora y luchadora. Paquita no solo lava ropa para el público en general sino también para algunos hospedajes que confían en su buena labor. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que está solicitando va a comprarse una lavadora automática, ya que siempre lo hizo a mano, pero debido a al paso de los años ya no tiene las mismas fuerzas y rapidez.
texts.en:
Paquita is 59 years old and is the mother of six children who are now independent and have their own families. She currently lives with her husband who supports her in everything. They own the home they live in. For 20 years, Paquita has provided laundry services from her home. Thanks to this work she was able to pay for the school expenses of her children who are very proud to have such a hardworking mother. Paquita not only washes clothing for the general public but also for some boarders who trust in her good work. This is Paquita's second loan with MFP. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase a washing machine. She has always washed by hand but with the passing of time she does not have the same strength and speed.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a washing machine.

loans.name: Luzdina

texts.es: Luzdina tiene 38 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos que están en edad escolar. La casa donde habitan es propia. Se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco y salado en un puesto del mercado. Se levanta muy temprano, a las 2.00am, para comprar en el puerto el pescado que traen los pescadores, luego de esto lo vende en el mercado hasta las 10:00am. Luzdina cuenta con una gama de clientes que consumen sus pescados y constantemente visitan su puesto, está satisfecha con su trabajo porque cada día termina de vender todo el pescado que lleva, recuperando su inversión y obteniendo buenas ganancias. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a construir un kiosco para vender más tranquila y protegerse de la lluvia.
texts.en:
Luzdina is 38 years old. She lives with her husband and their four children who are of school age. The house where they live is their own. She works selling fresh and salted fish in a stall at the market. She gets up very early, at 2 am, to buy in the fish store where the fishermen bring the fish. Later she sells this in the market until 10 am. Luzdina has a number of clients who eat her fish and continually visit her stall. She is happy with her work because each day she finishes selling all the fish she brings, recovering her investment and getting a good profit. This is her first loan with MFP, and with the money that she is asking for she wants to order the construction of a kiosk to sell more peacefully and to protect her from the rain.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a kiosk for Luzdina's fish sales

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 42 años, es madre de 3 hijas que están estudiando, vive con su esposo quien junto a sus hijas le brindan el apoyo necesario en su negocio, su casa es propia. Se dedica a la confección, es especial de carteras y manteles, ella y sus hijas trabajan juntas desde hace 5 años exhibiendo sus productos en las afueras de su casa. Victoria vende durante todo el día, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que aprende cada día más sobre las novedades y diseños para sus confecciones. Lo difícil es no contar con un local adecuado, ya que sus artículos están expuestos a cualquier robo y no puede dar comodidad a sus clientes. Pero por otro lado, le es muy rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona muy transitada y vende todo el día. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que ha solicitado hará realidad o que tanto desea, que es mandar a construir un local para su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria is 42 years old. She is the mother of 3 daughters who are studying. She lives with her husband who, along with her daughters, give her the help she needs in her business. Her house is her own. She works as a seamstress. Her specialties are bags and alter cloths. She and her daughters have worked for the past 5 years showing her products in outside her house. Victoria sells during the entire day. What she likes about the work is that each day she learns more about the novelties and designs for what she makes. The hard part is she doesn’t have a suitable place for it, such that the articles are exposed for any robber and she is not able to provide comfort for her clients. But, on the other hand, it makes a good income because she has found she is located in a good area with many passers by and she sells all day. This is her first loan with MFP, and with the money that she is asking for she would make her dream a reality, which is to order the construction of a kiosk for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a stall for her textile business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth O. is 27 years old and married with 2 children. She sells snacks, drinks and poultry. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N100,000 to purchase more drinks and snacks as well as more birds for her poultry business to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more snacks, drinks and poultry birds

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana O. is 52 years old and married with 6 children, she sells foodstuffs like palm oil, salt and rice etc. Her husband is a painter.  Presently, she plans to increase her sales so that she can earn more profit to take care of her children’s school fees and other expenses. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 to purchase more food products to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food products to sell

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah E. is 35 years old, married with 4 children. Deborah sells ice blocks, and she has a deep freezer designed for making ice blocks. As her customers increase, she plans to purchase an additional freezer. She needs the loan to purchase an additional freezer. She says thanks to Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase an additional freezer

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas O. is 42 years old, married with 4 children. She sells foodstuffs such as yams, eggs, tomatoes and peppers, etc. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She needs the loan to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs tosell

loans.name: Chidinma

texts.en: Chidinma O. is 27 years old, married with 3 children. She has a laundry shop where she does laundry service for people. She plans to purchase some laundry equipment such as an electric iron and a fairly-used laundry machine. She needs the loan to purchase this laundry equipment. She says thanks to Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase laundry equipment

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice I. is 40 years old, married with 8 children; she sells foodstuffs, provisions and drinks. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Presently she is requesting a loan in the amount of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs, provisions, and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a market entrepreneur from Mukachevo. She runs a small venture selling footwear in the local market next to a bus station. Eva’s merchandise is always in demand as her footwear comes in good varieties, is affordable, and a decent quality. She has been in business for 5 years. Currently, her turnover capital amounts to 50,000 Grivnas.

Eva believes determination and integrity are the main principles in business and in relations with customers. Her customers have never been upset with the quality of her merchandise. Many come back for another pair of shoes or boots. Eva is seeking a loan of 6,000 Grivnas to increase assorted merchandise. She is hoping to repay the current loan in 8 months.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is married with two kids. They live in Mukachevo. Mariya sells cosmetics and souvenirs out of a store called “Era” in downtown Mukachvo. She has been in the business for many years. Her good quality merchandise has always been in demand. Mariya’s business has been growing with remarkable stability and consistency. However, Mariya believes her business is ready for further expansion and is willing to invest effort into the growth of her venture.

Currently, Mariya has 70,000 Grivnas in turnover capital. However, she realizes that’s not the limit. That is why she is now requesting a loan of 6,000 Grivnas to help her with expansion of her trade. Mariya tries to keep her customers in mind with everything she plans and does. By thinking this way she has managed to get better products, customer support, and a larger market share. We are hoping her focus on the customer and commitment to business will help Mariya in her endeavors and lead her to success in entrepreneurship.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Bogdan

texts.en:
Bogdan offers transportation services in Ivano-Frankivsk where he is originally from. He started his business about 8 years ago, after he quit working as a public van driver. This enterprise has been an effective source of income for his family of four – his wife Lidiya and two daughters, 12 and 9 year old. Currently, his monthly income is about 8,000 Grivnas. 

Bogdan works 16 hours a day to provide a decent living for his family. Right now he’s faced with a need to do some repair work on his vehicle. He is requesting a 7,500 Grivna loan to paint his car and give it a fresher, nicer look. Bogdan has many challenges in his work. However, he doesn’t want to go back to being a hired employee, preferring to work for himself.

loans.use: to paint his car used for work

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora D. is forty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children; five girls and two boys. She says some of her children have completed school while others are still in junior high school. She lives with her family in Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Dora works hard to help her husband provide for the family. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates food crops and all kinds of vegetables. Dora sells foodstuffs. She sells plantains, cassava, yams, etc on a table top by the roadside. Dora buys her goods from Kintampo in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana and sometimes from the farmers in the surrounding villages. She has been in business for four years. She also distributes cassava and plantains to local ‘chop bar’ (restaurant) operators. She wants a loan to buy the foodstuffs in bulk so that she can cut down on costs, as in frequent trips to procure the goods, and also to maximize profit.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua A. is forty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to six children – all boys. Almost all her children are out of school. The last born has yet to complete junior high school. She lives together with some of her children and her husband in Offinso, a business and farming community in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Akua’s husband is a farmer as well as a sewing machine repairer in their community. Akua works to help her husband provide for the family. She is a fish monger and also sells vegetables on a small table top. She sells in a shed in the local market square. She procures her goods from big-time fish mongers in Kumasi who sell at wholesale prices.

Akua has been in business for two years. According to Akua, most of her customers are food vendors and households in her community. With the loan,she wants to purchase tilapia and other fish in bulk on a visit to the big towns to reduce frequent travel. This, she also believes, would enable her to save more money to pay for the education of her last born.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish and tilapia

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia A. G. es soltera, ella trabaja como empleada domestica en una casa habitación en el cual ya tiene un poco más de 6 años trabajando y le proporciona buenos ingresos, los cuales son de utilidad para solventar los gastos de su casa.
La señora Antonia A. tiene un negocio de venta de artículos usados que es manejado por ella y también le proporciona buenos ingresos.
La señora Antonia A. está solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercancías para su negocio y para arreglar una barda, para que de esta manera su negocio esté más surtido y se puedan incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Antonia Armendariz G. is single and she works as a housekeeper in a private home. She has been working there for more than 6 years and it provides her with good earnings, which are very helpful in keeping up with the household expenses.

Antonia Armendariz managesa business selling used articles and it also provides her with good earnings.

Antonia Armendariz is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise for her business, as well as to fix a wall, so that her business will have better selection and increase her sales.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and repair a wall.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To acquire two hair dryers

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia K. is fifty-five years old. She is married and gave birth to seven children. Unfortunately, almost all Afia’s children are no more. She is left with one girl who has completed junior high school. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates cocoa and foodstuffs such as cassava and also vegetables.

Afia sells fried fish to make some income. She says she buys fresh fish and fries it herself. She supplies the fried fish mostly to food vendors in her community. According to her, the food vendors find it more convenient and affordable buying fried fish rather than frying it themselves.

Afia owns a fridge in which she stores the fresh fish she procures. She buys from big cold storage places in the nearby cities like Kumasi. She has been in business for four years. Afia wants a loan to procure fresh fish in bulk so she can distribute to more customers. She hopes to make enough savings to pay the costs for her daughter to climb the academic ladder.

loans.use: To procure fresh fish in bulk

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua K. is forty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to nine children – six boys and three girls. She says three of her children have completed junior high school and have yet to pursue senior high school. Two are temporarily working, but the rest are still in the basic school. The three daughters, however, are learning a trade.

Akua’s husband is a maize farmer. She lives with her family in Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Offinso is a farming and commercial town. The majority of the inhabitants are either farmers or sell in farm produce. Akua is an entrepreneur. She sells mainly maize. She buys bags of maize from the farmers in her community and nearby villages. She says city dwellers come to buy it with big cargo trucks and go to retail to food vendors in the big cities. She also sells in the local market.

Akua has been in business for six years. With the loan, she wants to purchase maize in bulk so she can supply to an increasing number of customers and increase her profit margin. She yearns to help some of her children to climb the academic ladder to enjoy better life opportunities.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize for re-sale

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda A. is forty-three years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, three girls and three boys. She says two of her children have completed junior high school. The rest are still in the basic school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Offinso is a farming as well as a commercial community.

Belinda works hard to help her husband take care of the family. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates food crops such as cassava in the community they live in. She sells fresh yams in the local market square. Belinda buys tubers of yam all the way from Techiman in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana and sometimes from the surrounding villages. She has been in business for about six years. She also distributes the yams to food vendors in her community. She wants a loan to buy tubers of yam on large scale so that she can cut down on costs, as in frequent trips to procure the goods, and so maximize her profit margin. She hopes to help her husband see their children through school.

loans.use: To procure tubers of yam for re-sale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence A. is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to six children – three boys and three girls. She says that, currently, some of her children have completed junior high school and have yet to continue. The rest are still in the basic school.

Florence’s husband is a cocoa farmer. She lives with her family in an old family house at Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Offinso is a farming and commercial town. The majority of the inhabitants are either farmers or buy and sell farm produce. Few dwellers of the town are in official professions.

Florence is a trader. She trades in maize. She buys bags of maize from the farmers in her community and nearby villages. She says food vendors come from the cities to buy it. She also sells in the local market. Florence has been in business for over eight years. She wants to buy maize on a large scale so that she can supply to the increasing number of customers and increase her profit margin. She desires to help her children climb the academic ladder to higher levels.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize for re-sale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose O. is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to five children. She says two of her children have completed senior high school; the rest are still in the basic school and high school. She lives with her family in a family house in Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.  Offinso is a farming as well as a commercial community.

Rose works hard to help her husband take care of the family. Her husband works with a farmer. He cultivates maize, plantain and other foodstuffs in the community where they live. She sells fresh yams in the local market square. She procures the tubers of yam from the farmers in the surrounding villages. She has been in business for over twenty years now and is full of experience. She also distributes the yams to some food vendors in her community. 

Rose wants a loan to buy tubers of yam on a large scale so that she can distribute to more customers and so increase her profit margin. She aspires to help her husband improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To procure tubers of yam

loans.name: Rubén Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Rubén Cesar H. y P. es soltero, el tiene un negocio propio de servicio de lavado de tractocamiones llamado “Servicio H.” el cual lleva 19 años de estar en operación, es atendido por él y un empleado, este negocio representa la principal fuente de ingresos de el señor Rubén Cesar.
