El señor Rubén Cesar está solicitando un préstamo para comprar una maquina de presión para el lavado de tractocamiones, para que de esta manera el señor Rubén les pueda ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor servicio y que sus ingresos se puedan incrementar.
texts.en:
Ruben Cesar H. y P. is single and he has his own car wash business called "Servicio H." (H. Services). He has been running this business for the past 19 years. He has one employee and this business represents the primary source of income for Ruben Cesar.

Ruben Cesar is requesting a loan to purchase a high pressure washer to use in his car wash business. This way Ruben will be able to offer his clients a better service and his earnings will be able to increase.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a high pressure washer for his car wash business.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is forty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, four girls and two boys. She says two of her children have completed the senior high school; one is learning a trade (hair dressing) while the rest are still in basic school and high school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.  Offinso is a farming as well as a commercial community.<>

Comfort works hard to help her husband take care of the family. Her husband works as a lottery agent with a lottery company in the community where they live. She sells fresh yams in the local market square to some special customers. She procures the tubers of yam from the farmers in the surrounding villages. She has been in business for over twenty years now and is full of experience. She also distributes the yams to some food vendors in her community. With the loan, Comfort wants to purchase more tubers of yam on a large scale so that she can distribute to more customers and so increase her profit margin. She believes education is the best legacy she can leave her children with. She is hopeful to save more income to pay for her children's schooling.

loans.use: To procure tubers of yam for re-sale

loans.name: Adizatu

texts.en:
Adizatu A. is sixty years old. Though widowed, Adizatu still has some children and grand-children to take care of. She says some of her children are grown and living independently. However, her last born is currently pursuing a degree programme at the university. She lives with some of her children and grand-children in a family house in Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Offinso is a farming as well as a commercial community.

Adizatu works very hard to take care of the family. She sells fresh yams. Adizatu does not sell in the market as other sellers do. What she does is to procure the tubers of yam from the farmers in the surrounding villages and supply to a number of senior high schools in and around her community. She has been in this business for six years now.

Adizatu wants a loan to buy tubers of yam on a very large scale so that she can distribute to more schools and so increase her profit margin so that she can help her grand-children also to have access to formal education.

loans.use: To procure tubers of yam for re-sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of plastic bowl and kitchen utensils for resale

loans.name: Barikisu

texts.en:
Barikisu B. is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to six children – five boys and one girl. She says that, currently, some of her children have completed junior high school. The rest are still in the basic school. One is in the tertiary level. She lives with her family in an old family house at Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Offinso is a farming and commercial town. Most of the people are either farmers or buy and sell farm produce. Few of the inhabitants are in official professions.

Barikisu runs a maize business. She buys bags of maize from the farmers in her community and nearby villages. She says food vendors come from the cities to buy it. She also sells in the local market. Barikisu has been in business for over ten years. She wants to buy maize on a large scale so that she can supply it to an increasing number of customers and increase her profit margin. She desires to help her children climb the academic ladder to higher levels.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize for re-sale

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa I. is twenty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to four children. She lives together with her children and husband in Offinso, a business and farming community in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Hawa’s husband is a commercial driver in their community. She works to help her husband to provide for the family. She is a fish-monger.

Hawa procures smoked fish from Yeji and hawks it house-to-house in her community. She also sells on a table top in the local market square. Hawa procures the fish at wholesale prices. Hawa has been in business for two years. According to her, when she gets a bigger working capital, she can procure fish in bulk and increase her profit margin to help her children through school.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
El señor Domingo R. R. es casado, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, ellos tienen 8 años de vivir en su hogar, el señor Domingo R. trabaja como chofer transfer desde hace 3 años, siendo este trabajo su principal fuente de ingresos los cuales son de utilidad para mantener a su familia.   
El señor Domingo R. está solicitando un préstamo para poner vitropiso en su casa, para que de esta manera su hogar esté en buenas condiciones para que él y su familia puedan vivir cómodamente.
texts.en:
Domingo R. R. is married and he lives with his wife and two children. They have been living in their current home for the past 8 years. Domingo R. has been working as a transport driver for the past 3 years, this being the primary source of income to support his family.

Domingo R. is requesting a loan to install a tile floor in his home, so that in this way they will be able to have a home that is in good condition and that they may live comfortably.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install tile flooring.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary O. is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to five children. Four of her children are girls and one is a boy. One of Mary’s children has completed junior high school. The rest are still in the basic school. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates palm nuts. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in their community. They live at Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Mary sells fashion accessories such as ladies’ footwear, headgear, etc. She buys her goods from Kumasi and sells them in the local market. She also hawks from house-to-house and at times treks to nearby towns to market her goods. She has been in business for six years. Mary wants a loan to increase her working capital to be able to procure more goods and if possible include new ones.

loans.use: To buy fashion accessories for re-sale

loans.name: Majaria

texts.en:
Majaria A. is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to six children – four boys and two girls. She says that, currently, two of her children have completed senior high school and have yet to continue. Some are also in the high school while the rest are still in the basic school. Majaria’s husband is a watch repairman. She lives with her family in an old family house at Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Offinso is a farming and commercial town. The majority of the inhabitants are either farmers or buy and sell farm produce. Few dwellers of the town are in official occupations.

Majaria trades in maize. She buys bags of maize from the farmers in her community and nearby villages. She says food vendors come from the cities to buy it in the local market where she sells. She has been in business for over ten years. She wants a loan to buy maize on a large scale so that she can supply to the increasing number of customers and increase her profit margin. She desires to help her children climb the academic ladder to higher levels.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize for re-sale

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal “Sacuyo”, proviene del sector Asunción, en la comunidad de Sacuyo, distrito de Acora, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos, posee estudios de primaria completa.
Trabaja desde hace un año con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, posee un negocio de elaboración y acopio de quesos para venta en los mercado locales de Puno; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que destino para comprar algunos materiales (moldes, cuajo, prensas) y acopiar mas quesos para comercializarlos.
Actualmente ella desea un capital adicional para mejorar su producción de quesos, y viene solicitando un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, asimismo ella solicita capacitaciones para poder elaborar quesos de diferentes tipos y que aguanten mas en los mercados, las ganancias las invertirá en adquirir mas ganado vacuno e instalar pastos cultivados para producir mas leche ello, agradece a Manuela Ramos por su apoyo, ya que le permitió mejorar la calidad de vida en su hogar y una ayuda a la educación de sus hijos, finalmente se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en tres cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Señora Yolanda is a member of the community bank “Sacuyo”. She is from Asunción, in the community of Sacuyo in the Acora District, Province of Puno, Department of Puno. She is 25 years old, has a common-law spouse and two children. She studied through primary school. For the past year she has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement. She has a business of making and curing of cheese for sale in the local markets in Puno. Her first loan was of S/.500.00 Nuevos Soles. She used it to buy various materials (molds, rennant, presses) and to cure more cheeses to sell them. Currently she would like some additional capital in order to improve her cheese production, and so she is asking for a new loan of S/.1000.00 Nuevos Soles. With this loan she is asking for, she will gain capacity to make different types of cheese and to take more to the markets. The income would be invested to acquire more cattle and to plant a pasture in order to produce more milk, she thanks Manuela Ramos for the help that has already permitted her to improve the quality of life in her home and to help with the education of her children. Finally, she promises to pay punctually her loan in three monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To get more livestock and grow pasture to produce more milk

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet A. is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, two girls and four boys. According to her, some of her children are in senior high and junior high schools while others are still in the basic school.

Janet and her family live in Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. She says her husband is doing his best to provide for the family but because of the economic crisis, she also needs to work to help her husband. Janet sells eggs by the crate. She buys them from poultry farmers in the surrounding villages. She distributes to food vendors and retailers in her community. She has been in business for four years. Janet wants a loan to procure eggs in bulk so that she can supply to more customers to increase her profit margin. It is her desire to help her husband see their children through to the tertiary level of education.

loans.use: To buy crates of eggs for re-sale by the crate

loans.name: Maria Irma

texts.es:
La señora Maria es socia del Banco Comunal “Sacuyo”, en el sector Asunción, comunidad de Sacuyo, distrito de Acora, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; de  34 años de edad, tiene cuatro  hijos, es conviviente y posee estudios de primaria completa.
Trabaja hace un año medio con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos e inicio su negocio de artesanía tejido a apunto, con S/. 500.00 nuevos soles y se siente contenta porque le permitió comprar materiales como lana de distintos colores.
Ahora desea adquirir S/. 1000 nuevos soles para poder ampliar su negocio, invirtiendo en  la compra de lana por mayor, (lana de alpaca, lana sintética, y entre otros.), de esta manera contribuirá a mejorar la calidad educativa de sus hijos; asimismo se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en tres cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank "Sacuyo" located in the Asuncion sector in the community of Sacuyo, district of Acora, Puno Province, Puno Department. She is 34 years old and has four children. She lives with her partner and she completed grammar school. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for a year and a half and was able to start her business of handcrafted knitting with a loan of $150. She is happy because this allowed her to purchase materials such as wool in different colors. Maria now hopes to receive a loan in the amount of $325 to expand her business. She will invest in the wholesale purchase of wool (alpaca wool and synthetic wool among others). She hopes this will allow her to contribute to her children's quality of education. She commits to punctually paying her loan in three monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of wool (alpaca wool and synthetic wool among others) so that she can expand her business.

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis A. is twenty-eight years old. She is single. She lives with her father and two younger siblings in their family house in Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Mavis says she is working to save some money so she can acquire certain basic needs in life before she enters into marriage. She sells body creams, pomades, and other cosmetic products.

Mavis buys her products from big cosmetic shops in Kumasi. She hawks them door-to-door. At times, she gives them to her customers on credit, just to stay in business, and takes her money at a given time period. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so that she can buy cosmetic goods in bulk. Mavis desires to trek to nearby towns to do business. She says she helps her father to take care of her younger siblings who are still in school.

loans.use: To procure body creams and pomades in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Álvaro

texts.es:
El señor Álvaro S. T. es casado, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, ellos ya tienen 5 años de vivir en su hogar. El señor Álvaro trabaja como mesero en un restaurante desde hace 4 años y percibe buenos ingresos, los cuales son necesarios para mantener a su familia.
El señor Álvaro S. está solicitando un préstamo para construir una galería en la parte de en frente de su hogar para resguardar un poco el calor que se siente en la entrada de su casa. (En la fotografía no aparece el señor Álvaro S., sino aparece su esposa).
Esta mejora ayudará a que el señor Álvaro y su familia puedan vivir cómodamente.
texts.en:
Mr. Alvaro S. T. is married and lives with his wife and two children. They have lived together for the last five years. Mr. Alvaro has been working as a waiter in a restaurant for the last 4 years and receives a good salary, which is necessary to take care of his family.

Mr. Alvaro S. is requesting a loan to build a porch in the front of his house for shade against the heat so that they can sit outside about the entrance of their home (note: In the picture, Mr. Alvaro does not appear, but his wife does).

This improvement would be a great help to Mr. Alvaro and his family to be able to live comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a front porch for his home.

loans.name: Leti Doris

texts.es:
La señora Doris es socia del Banco Comunal “Sacuyo”, en el sector Ventilla,  comunidad de Sacuyo, distrito de Acora, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 26 años de edad, es conviviente y esta al cuidado de un hijo, asimismo posee estudios de secundaria incompleta (cuarto de secundaría).
Trabaja desde hace un año con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, posee un negocio es la Artesanías (tejido a punto); su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, para acopiar quesos y comercializarlos en los mercados de Puno.
En la actualidad ella piensa mejorar su otro negocio de quesos, y quiere llevar este producto a otros mercados (Cusco y Arequipa), por ello viene solicitando  S/. 800.00 nuevos soles para poder comprar moldes de quesos, galoneras, bidones y prensas; así como también piensa invertir en asistencia técnica para poder elaborar sus quesos con mayor calidad; de esta manera piensa obtener mas ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar así como la educación de sus hijos; ella menciona que se debe promocionar la asistencia técnica a las mujeres para poder obtener productos de mejor calidad, finalmente se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en tres cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of the communal bank "Sacuyo" in the sector of Ventilla, in the Sacuyo community, Acora district, Puno Province, Puno Department (state). She is 26 years old and in the care of a child; she completed the fourth year of secondary school. She has worked for a year with the Manuela Ramos organization. She has a handicraft business. Her first loan was for 500 Nuevo Soles, to used for cheeses that she sold in the markets of Puno. Currently, she is thinking of improving her other cheese business, and would like to take this product to other markets (Cusco and Arequipa), which is why she is requesting 800 Nuevos Soles to be able to purchase cheese molds, galoneras, barrels and presses; she also is thinking of investing in technical assistance to be able to make her cheeses of a higher quality. This way she will be able to obtain a higher income and improve the quality of life in her household as well as the education of her children. She says that the technical assistance must be promoted to the women in the area to obtain products of a higher quality. She is committed to repaying her loan on time in three monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cheese molds, as well as technical assistance to improve the quality of her cheeses

loans.name: 3 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
Miriams Ildilcia C. O.: la actividad de ella es el comercio, tiene 25 años de tener una pulperia la cul opera bajo el nombre de Pulperia "Los Gemelos"ubicada en el Barrio San Jose de esta comunidad, a la vez vende ropa y calzado, con los ingresos que genera la pulperia brinda los estudios a sus hijos.
Petrona del Carmen L.: se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de rosquillas, actividad que realiza desde hace 25 años, una de las hijas que vive con ella junto a otras empleadas la ayudan a elaborar el producto, con los ingresos que le genera cubre un 100% los gastos personales y compromisos financieros, el sueño de ella es tener una fabrica con mas produccion y generar empleos en mi comunidad.
Alba danelia A.: se dedica a la venta de golosinas y enseres del hogar, actividad que realiza hace 3 años, los clientes potenciales son los de la comunidad donde ella vive, su negocio les genera  ingresos con los que han podido brindar la educacion a sus hijos y cubrir los gastos familiares.
Reina Maritza V.: se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos y la elaboracion y venta de ropa de cama y ropa americana, actividad que realiza desde hace 1 año junto con su esposo han proceado 4 hijos de los cuales 2 cursan la secundaria y una la universidad, con los ingresos que genera el negocio contribuye con los gastos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Miriams Ildilcia C. O.: her activity is a merchant; she has had a grocery store for 25 years, operating under the name of "Los Gemelos", located in the San Jose neighborhood in this community. At the same time, she sells clothing and shoes; with the income that she earns she is able to provide for the education of her children. Petrona del Carmen L.: She works making and selling doughnuts, an activity that she has done for 25 years. One of her daughters, that lives with her, along with other employees, help her make the product; with the earnings that she generates she is able to cover all of her expenses and financial commitments. Her dream is to have a factory with a larger production and the ability to create jobs in the community. Alba danelia A.: She works selling sweets and household items, an activity that she had performed for more than 3 years. The best clients are those in the community in which she lives. Her business generates income with which she has been able to provide for the education of her children and cover the household expenses. Reina Maritza V.: She works selling cosmetics as well as making and selling bed linens and American clothing, an activity that she has done for more than a year along with her husband. They have 4 children, of which 2 are in secondary school and one in university. The income that the business earns is used for her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La señora Maruja es socia del Banco Comunal “Sacuyo”, en la comunidad de Sacuyo, distrito de Acora, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente y esta al cuidado de dos hijos, posee estudios de primaria completa.
Trabaja desde hace poco con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, posee un negocio de engorde de ganado y su venta en las ferias ganaderas; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la alimentación de su ganado para engordarlo y comercializarlo.
Ella desea obtener un mayor capital para poder invertir en la compra de semillas de alfalfa y alimento (cebada, afrecho, etc.) para engorde ganado (vacunos y ovinos); por ello viene solicitando un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1600.00 nuevos soles, asimismo ella refiere que juntamente con la ayuda económica del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, se debe brindar Capacitaciones y asistencia técnica  para poder invertir mejor el dinero prestado y producir ganado de mayor peso y mejor calidad, ello le permitirá obtener mejores precios en la feria ganadera a donde lleva su ganado, sin embargo agradece a Manuela Ramos por su apoyo, ya que le permitió mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar y ayudar a la educación de sus hijos que es lo más importante para ella, finalmente se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en tres cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Maruja is a member of the communal bank "Sacuyo", in the community of Sacuyo, Acora district, Puno District, Puno Department. She is 30 years old, married and has two children and has completed primary school. She has worked recently with the Manuela Ramos organization. She has a business of fattening cattle and selling them in the animal markets. Her first loan of 500 Nuevos Soles was used to invest in animal feed to fatten and sell them. She would like to have more capital to be able to purchase alfalfa seeds and feed (barley, bran, etc.) to fatten livestock (cattle and sheep). For this she is requesting a new loan of 1,600 Nuevos Soles; in addition to the economic help of the Manuela Ramos organization she would also like training and technical assistance to be able to better invest the money she is loaned and produce livestock of a better weight and quality; this will allow her to obtain better prices in the livestock market where she takes her animals. Nevertheless, she is thankful to Manuela Ramos for its support, since it has allowed her to improve her quality of life and help with the education of her children, which is the most important to her. Finally, she is committed to repaying her loan on time in three monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of alfalfa seed and feed (barley, bran, etc.) to feed her livestock (cattle and sheep)

loans.name: Sofia Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Sofía es socia del Banco Comunal “Sacuyo”, sector Nueva Alianza, de la comunidad de Sacuyo, distrito de Acora, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 43 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos y posee estudios de primaria completa.
Trabaja desde hace poco tiempo con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la venta de animales menores (porcinos y cuyes) y comercialización de golosinas, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, que los invirtió en la compra animales menores (porcinos) para engordarlos y venderlos en las ferias ganaderas.
Ella actualmente requiere un nuevo préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles; para invertir en la compra de mercadería para su negocio de golosinas (dulces, galletas, gaseosas, etc.) que los vendará en la feria Sabatina y Dominical de Acora; con la ganancias podrá hacer estudiar a sus hijos; asimismo ella refiere que pagará su préstamo en 3 cuotas mensuales y agradece a Manuela Ramos por su apoyo y confianza.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sofia is a member of the Banco Comunal “Sacuyo”, Sector Nueva Alianza, of the Sacuyo community in the Acora district of the Puno Province, which is a part of the Department of Puno. She is 43-years old and lives with her two children who have completed primary school.

For a short while now she has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement; she has been selling small animals (pigs and guinea pigs) and also candy. Her first loan was for S/.500.00 nuevos soles, that was invested for the purchase of small pigs to fatten and sell as livestock at the fairs.

She will now need another loan for S./300.00 nuevos soles to put towards the purchase of a store that will house her refreshments business (candy, cookies, soda and etc.) at the Sabatina y Dominical de Acora fair. With the profits she will be able to provide for her children’s education. Additionally, she intends to repay her loan in 3 monthly installments and she thanks Manuela Ramos for their help and support.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a store front to sell refreshments at the Sabatina y Dominical de Acora Fair.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es:
El señor Salvador V. M. es casado, el vive con su esposa y con 1 de sus hijos, ellos tienen viviendo 8 años en su hogar. El señor Salvador trabaja como albañil por su propia cuenta, actividad a la que se  dedica desde hace 7 años, este trabajo representa la principal fuente de ingresos para el con los cuales mantiene a su familia y también con los que ha sacado adelante a sus otros 2 hijos que ya están casados.
El señor Salvador está solicitando un préstamo para construir enjarres interiores y exteriores en un cuarto para que de esta manera el señor Salvador y su familia tengan un hogar más amplio en donde vivir.
texts.en:
Salvador V. M. is married and he lives with his wife and one of his children. They have been living in their home for the past 8 years. Salvador has been self-employed as a mason for the last 7 years. This job gives him his main source of income which he uses to support his family. He was able to raise his other 2 children who are now married and living on their own. Salvador is requesting a loan so that he can build the exterior and interior framing of an addition to his home. With this addition Mr. Salvador and his family will have a larger home for them to live in. Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construct exterior and interior framing

loans.name: 140-008265-01-6 Group

texts.es:
Hola nosotros somos el grupo Brillante Amanecer, nuestro grupo esta formado de la siguiente forma:
Sayra R.: la Sra. R. tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la venta de cosmeticos y productos plasticos y 4 años de dedicarse a la elaboracion de pasteles, vive en union libre y su compañero de hogar se dedica a la ganaderia, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales dependen de ellos, su esposo se encarga de cubrir todos los gastos familiares y en lo poco que ella puede le colabora a el.
Andres H.: el Sr. H. se dedica al comercio desde hace 20 años, su negocio principal es la pulperia, rubro que mas resalta en nuestra sociedad, el es soltero pero el le brinda el estudio y todos los gastos personales a dos hermanos y cubre al 100% la alimentacion en el hogar de su madre, ya que el padre fallecio y su madre quedo desprotegida, haciendose el, cargo de los gastos de alimentacion para su familia.
Gloria de Jesus C.: ella se dedica al comercio, tiene una pulperia, actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace 5 años, vive en union libre y es madre de 3 hijos que toda via dependen de ella al 100%, su compañero de hogar se dedica a la agricultura y es el quien cubre todos los gastos del hogar, con los ingresos que el negocio le genera ella cubre sus gastos personales y tambien le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, pero lo que ella se dedica a comprar en el hogar son los utensilios de cocina y los electrodomesticos, cosas importantes dentro del hogar, todos estos articulos los ha adquirido con las ganancias que le deja su negocio.
Yeni P.: ella se dedico a muchos años a vender cosmeticos, pero como ella es madre soltera con un hijo el cual depende de ella en un 100%, este negocio que tenia no la daba suficientes ingresos para el sustento de su familia, ella logro hacer una pequeña pulperia la cual le ayuda mucho a cubrir con los gastos de su hogar, ahora ella tiene dos negocios y cuando ella sale a vender sus cosmeticos su hijo le ayuda a atender la pulperia.
texts.en:
Hello! Our group is called Brillante Amenecer and the following people are members: Sra. Sayra R. has for 20 years earned her living by selling cosmetics and plastic products and also for four years making baked goods. She lives in Union Libre with her husband who raises cattle. She has four dependent children. Her husband is responsible for the family expenses, and she contributes what small amount she can. Sr. Andres H. has been a businessman for 20 years. His main business is a small convenience store, a common line of work in our society. He is single but is responsible for the education and daily expenses of his two siblings, plus the cost of food for his mother since his father has passed away. His mother was left without support, so Andres had to take over all the family’s food expenses. Sra. Gloria de Jesus Cáliz is a businesswoman and has been operating a small convenience store for five years now. She lives in Union Libre and has three children who are still dependent on her. Her husband is a farmer and pays for household expenses. With the money that she earns from her store, Gloria covers her own personal expenses and as well helps her husband with household expenses. She also works hard to buy kitchen utensils and household electrical appliances, important things for the home--she has bought these out of the profits from the business. Sra. Yeni P. worked selling cosmetics for many years, but as she is a single mother with a son who is completely dependent on her, the business did not supply enough income to provide for her family. She managed to obtain a small convenience store which greatly helps her to cover household expenses, so she now has two businesses. When she is out selling cosmetics, her son helps her with the store.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
La señora Tomasa G. R. es casada, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, ellos tienen viviendo 3 años en su hogar. La señora Tomasa trabaja en el puesto de cocina, actividad a la que se dedica desde hace 7 años y su esposo trabaja en el puesto de maestro carpintero desde hace 4 años, entre los ingresos de los 2 mantienen a sus 2 hijos y cubren los gastos de su hogar.
La señora Tomasa está solicitando un préstamo para enjarrar su casa. Esta mejora servirá para cubrir la humedad de su hogar cuando llueve y de esa manera ella y su familia puedan vivir cómodos en su casa.
texts.en:
Señora Tomasa G. R. is married and lives with her husband and their two children. They have lived in their house for three years. Señora Tomasa has had a stall selling cooked food for the last seven years, and her husband has worked as a carpenter for four years. With the income that they both bring in, they provide for their two children and cover household expenses. Señora Tomasa is asking for a loan to plaster the walls of the house. This will help to improve the dampness inside the house when it rains, and the family will be able to live much more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plaster the inside walls to prevent dampness when it rains

loans.name: Raul Alberto

texts.es: su nombre es Raul G. se actividad principal es el comercio, cuenta con una distribuidora de electrodomesticos los que distribuye de manera ambulante en los diferentes lugares aledaños de nuestra ciudad, es casado, tiene 2 hijos lo que estan cursando la educacion primaria en una escuela publica, el inició como vendedor en una compañia pero luego paso el tiempo decidio comprar algunos productos y venderlos por su propia cuenta y fue asi como fundo su empresa y poco a poco va creciendo, razon por la cual solicita un credito porque necesita capital pra poder surtir mas su negocio y satisfacer la demanda existente.
texts.en:
Raul G. has a business selling small electrical appliances in the streets of the various towns around our city. He is married and has two children in primary school. He used to work as a company salesman, but after some time he decided to buy various products and sell them himself, and in this way he started his own business which has gradually expanded. Now he would like a loan so that he can better stock the business and satisfy current demand for his products.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase small electrical appliances and other supplies for the home

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor de Nombre José Antonio González tiene la edad de 40 años, su estado civil es casado, Don José tiene 2 hijos sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 16 años cursa el 3 año de secundaria y su otro hijo de 11 años cursa el 5 grado de primaria, su compañera de vida labora no vive con el actualmente ya que trabaja fuera del país en busca de mejor vida para sus hijos y su familia, los propósitos de Don José son de incrementar su negocio y darles estabilidad a sus hijos en los estudios ya que debido a la situación del país algunas familias se ven obligados a sacar a sus hijos de estudiar por no tener suficiente dinero sus sueños son de establecer otro negocio que le servirá de apoyo para que sus hijos sepan administrar el negocio y el día de mañana no presenten dificultades para enfrentar las situaciones duras de la vida en sus sueños esta que su esposa regrese a Nicaragua con el fin de que encuentre trabajo aquí y pueda cuidar de sus hijos y estar con su familia y logra la calidad de vida que tanto deseaban.

La actividad  económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 16 años, Don José inicio esta por su familia ya que al principio la pulpería estaba a cargo de su esposa y ella empezó con capital propio y decide comprar productos como: huevos, golosinas, arroz, aceite y refrescos naturales su esposo siempre la apoyo en la administración de la pulpería pero ella necesitaba mas ingresos para su familia por lo que decide viajar al exterior en busca de trabajo y es su esposo quien asume el cargo de la administración de la pulpería y es así como trata de sacar adelante a su familia al principio no tenia muchos conocimientos de cómo manejar el negocio por lo que al comienzo fue difícil ya que tenia que realizar las compras tenia que hacerse cargo de sus hijos y además tenia que ocuparse de su casa pero con el tiempo logro hacerse cargo de todas estas cosas y fue así que obtuvo su negocio por lo que ahora pide un financiamiento destinado de capital de trabajo ya que tiene que realizar las compras de granos básicos, golosinas cosméticos y ropa además desea invertir en los útiles escolares ya que se acerca la temporada y quiere ofrecerle a sus clientes la variedad de productos.
texts.en:
José Antonio González is 40 years old and married. José has two children: his older son is 16 and in his third year of high school and his younger son is 11 and in Grade 5. His partner does not live with him for now because she works far from their country trying to make a better life for her children and her family. José's goal is to improve his business and create stability for his sons in their studies: because of the situation in the country, some families are removing their children from school due to a lack of money. His dream is to start another business which will help him, so that his sons can learn to manage the business and that in the future they will brave the hard times in life. He dreams that his wife will return to Nicaragua, that she can finally find work here and care for their children, be with her family and achieve the quality of life which they want so very much. José has been selling groceries from his home for the past 16 years. He started the business for his family; the grocery store was initially his wife's responsibility. She started it with her own money and decided to buy products such as eggs, sweets, rice, oil and juices. Her husband always supported her in managing the grocery store but she needed to make more income for her family and therefore decided to travel and look for work outside the country. Thus, her husband took over the grocery store and has been trying to support his family with the business. Initially it was difficult becaues he did not know much about managing the business - he had to learn to buy the goods - as well as care for his sons and do the household chores. With time, he learned to do all these things. He is now asking for a loan to use as working capital as he needs to buy staple goods, sweets, cosmetics and clothes. He also wants to invest in school supplies as school will be starting soon and he would like to offer his clients a choice of products.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Maria Isabel M. L. es viuda, tiene una hija, ellas tienen viviendo 2 años en su hogar. La señora Maria Isabel tiene un negocio de venta de abarrotes llamado “Abarrotes Marisol” el cual tiene 6 meses en operación y es atendido por ella, este negocio es la principal fuente de ingresos de la señora Maria Isabel con los cuales mantiene a su hija.
La señora Maria Isabel está solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercancía para su negocio y con esto tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, esto permitirá que sus ventas se incrementen y pueda obtener más ingresos los cuales serán necesarios para pagar los estudios de su hija.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel M. Llorenete is a widow and she has a daughter. They have been living in their house for the past 2 years. Maria Isabel M. Llorenete has a business called "Abarrotes Marisol", which is a small grocery store. She started her store about 6 months ago and she works at her store. This business is the main source of income for Maria Isabel and she uses this income to support herself and her daughter. Maria Isabel is asking for a loan to be able to buy merchandise for her store. With this new merchandise she will be able to offer her customers a greater variety of products. This will allow her to increase her sales, and thus increase her income so that she will be able to pay for her daughter's education. Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: El Sr. Vicente S. se dedica a la venta de productos basicos como ser arroz, azucar, manteca, papel higienico y abarroterria en general, su negocio se encuentra bien ubicado en el centro comercial de la Septima Avenida (comayaguela) se vende productos al por menor y mayor, cuenta con clientes fijos los que llegan a su negocioy los que transitan por el lugar, cuenta con dos años de experiencia, el Sr. necesita un credito para poder comprar mas productos y asi tener mayores ingresos, el negocio es atendido por su esposa la Sra. Orbelinda la cual es muy conocida en el centro comercial por su amabilidad con los clientes y esto le permite estar al cuidado de sus dos hijos, el Sr. tambien recibe otros ingresos ya que tiene otro trabajo.
texts.en:
Mr. Vicente S. has been selling basic products like rice, sugar, butter, toilet paper at his general store. His business has been doing well in the mall of Septima Avenida (Comayaguela). For the past two years, he has sold products of all shapes and sizes to customers who pass by his shop along the way.

Mr. S. needs a loan to be able to purchase more products to earn more profits. His wife, Mrs. Orbelinda attends to the business too and is well known for her kindess to all who she encounters in the mall. All this allows her to effectively care for her two children; at the same time, Mrs. Orbelinda also receives other forms of income from her other jobs as well.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various small goods for cooking

loans.name: Miriam Vaneza

texts.es: La Sra. Miriam G. se dedica a la venta de mercaderia como ser pantalones, blusas, calsetas para damas y caballeros, ella se dedica a esta actividad hace 12 años, ella vive en una colonia muy populosa y es conocida en la zona por ser una señora honesta, siempre se mantiene muy contenta y con muchos deseos de superacion pues su negocio es muy bueno ya que cuenta con clientes fijos y asi mismo sale dos veces por mes a vender a la ciudad de marcala y santa barbara de esta forma ha logrado salir adelante y criar a su hija y pagarle los estudios, ella necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor y asi poder tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ms. Miriam G. sells apparel, such as pants, blouses and socks for men and women. She has been in business for 12 years. She lives in a very populous residential area, where she is known to be an honest woman. She is always very happy and has a great desire for self-improvement. Business is good because she has a fixed clientele. Twice a month, she also travels to the cities of Marcala and Santa Barbara to sell her goods, thus she has been able to get ahead in life, raise her daughter and pay for her studies. She needs this loan in order to purchase more wholesale merchandise so that she can increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase apparel for men and women

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Las Vencedoras Group

texts.es: Las Vencedoras son mujeres luchadoras que se conocen, responsables, con deseos de superarse, son vecinas cercanas y con mucha experiencia en su trabajos, Sra. Karen tiene 7 años de dedicarse a la venta de productos por catalogo de belleza y limpieza VOGUE de su negocio dependen sus dos hijos, ella en estos momentos necesita compras mas producto y asi mejorar su negocio. Sr. Urbelina tiene su taller de costura, ella hace camisas, calsonetas, centros para niñas, de este negocio dependen sus dos hijas. Sra. Mirna se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, sandalias, ropa interior de caballero, zapatos, ella tiene su negocio hace 10 años y cuenta con clientes fijos, ella necesita credito para comprar mas mercaderia y poder obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Las Vencedoras (The Winners) are hard-working women who all know each other because they are close neighbors. They are responsible women who have the desire for self-improvement and have plenty of experience in their line of work. Ms. Karen has been selling VOGUE beauty and cleaning products by catalog for 7 years. Her children depend on this business. At this time, she needs to purchase more merchandise so that she can improve her business. Ms. Urbelina has her own sewing workshop in which she makes shirts, shorts and clothing for girls. Her two daughters depend on this business. Ms. Mirna sells new clothing, sandals, men's undergarments and shoes. She has been in business for 10 years and has a fixed clientele. She needs this loan in order to purchase more merchandise so that she can increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase personal care products, lotions, cosmetics, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jakeline

texts.es:
Jakeline  es una persona emprendedora ya que tiene el objetivo de ayudar a su esposo instalando un punto de llamadas ya que con los ingresos que actualmente tiene solo le alcanza para sobre vivencia y su objetivo es tener un punto de llamadas,  e Internet mejorando sus ingresos, para mejorar sus calidad de vida.
Vive en la zona de Escobar Uria de La Paz en la casa de sus abuelos .
El crédito será destinado para la compra de un punto de llamadas (Mini cabina telefónica)
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, las ganas de superarse le dan la oportunidad de poder acceder a este
texts.en:
Jakeline is an enterprising person. Her goal is to help her husband install a telephone booth since their current income is only enough to survive on. Her goal is to have a telephone booth and Internet, improving their income to improve their quality of life.

She lives in the Escobar Uria area of La Paz in her grandparents' house.

The loan will be used to buy a telephone booth (mini telephone booth).

It's the first time she has applied for a loan at Impro and her desire to excel gave her this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase telephone booth

loans.name: Yovanka Daniela

texts.es:
Yovanka se dedica a la compra de vajillas, electrodomésticos pequeños, adornos y otros los mismos lo adorna  y envuelve para venderlo como regalos en un local de fiestas ubicado en la Garita de Lima.
Vive en la zona de Villa San Antonio de la ciudad de La Paz, con su tia en alquiler ya que es madre soltera porque su esposo le abandono.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (vajillas, relojes, frazadas y otros)
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro.
texts.en:
Yokanka sells crockery, small electrical appliances and decorations amongst other things. She decorates and wraps them herself in order to sell them as presents in a party shop in Garita de Lima.

She lives in the Villa San Antonio zone of the city of La Paz renting with her aunt as she is a single mother since her husband abandoned her.

The credit will go towards working capital (crockery, watches, electric blankets and more).

This is the first time she has asked for a loan with Impro.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL/CAPITAL DE TRABAJO

loans.name: Maria Daniela

texts.es: La Sra. Daniela H. se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y carteras desde hace diez años, ella sale a vender ya que tiene clientes fijos en empresas que le comprar al credito y al contado, aparte de este negocio ella esta montando una pulperia y necesita credito monetario para poder establecer bien su negocio ya que con las ventas de zapatos y ropa no le ajusta para el sustento de su hogar, ella tiene todos los deseos de superarse y quiere cambiaar su calidad de via, ella es una persona luchadora y siempre cuenta con el apiyo de su esposo, en estos momentos ellos no tienen hijos.
texts.en:
For the past ten years Mrs. Daniela H. has been selling clothes, shoes, and handbags for a living. She goes out to sell on credit or cash to her clients who work at companies. Apart from this business she is setting up a local store and needs a loan to be able to establish her business in a satisfactory way, as the sales of shoes and clothing do not cover the expenses of her home. She wishes to improve and change her life quality. She is a fighter and she can always count on the support of her husband. At the moment they have no children.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grains, dairy products and meat.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Las Juanas Group

texts.es: El grupo "Las Juanas" esta representada por la señora Giovana e integrada por 16 miembros los cuales un amayoría son mujeres a esepcion de un varon el cual se dedica  ala venta de Cds. el resto de las socias se dedica a la venta y comercio de cosmeticos y material de belleza y accesorios para damas, como cosmeticos, ropa, zapatos y productos Herbalife. Dentro del ámbito laboral en especial el comercial existe gran competencia dentro del mercado por lo que le obliga a los integranrtes del grupo a mejorar la calida de sus productos y a proporcionar un servicio de mejor calidad es por esta razon que requieren de un fianciamiento a travez de la fundacion Agrocapital, para hacer crecer su negocio comprado materiales e insumos y mejorando sus puestos de  venta para ser mas atractiva a la vista de los demandantes. En general las integrantes del grupo no tienen experiencia trabajando con grupos solidarios pero aseguran ser gente responsable y con gran calidad humana por lo que la fundación Agrocapital les brinda la oportunidad de incrementar sus ingresos y de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
The group "Las Juanas" is represented by Ms Giovana and is made up of 16 members who are primarily women. Except for one woman who sells CDs, the members work in the sale of cosmetics and beauty products and women's accessories, like cosmetics, clothing, shoes and Herbalife products. There exists great competition in the market, and thus, the members are forced to improve their product's quality and provide better service. For this reason they ask for a loan through Agrocapital to increase their business by purchasing material and improving their business stands in order to attract clients. In general the members do not have experience working with lending groups, however, they guarantee that they are responsible and well-meaning people. It is for this reason that Agrocapital has given them the opportunity to increase their revenue and to improve the quality of their, and their family's, life.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: La Florida Group

texts.es: El grupo "Florida" esta representada por la señora Silvia  Melina e integrada por 16 miembros los cuales son dinámicos y con muchas ganas D. progresar en sus pequeños negocios. En su mayoría el grupo se dedica a actividades comerciales como la venta D. comida,abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, cosméticos, zapatos y algunos a la prestación D. sevicias D. construcción D. vivienda, transporte público y atencion en cafes internets. Dentro del ámbito laboral en especial el comercial existe gran competencia dentro del mercado por lo que le obliga a los integranrtes del grupo a mejorar la calida D. sus productos y a proporcionar un servicio D. mejor calidad es por esta razon que requieren D. un fianciamiento a travez D. la fundacion Agrocapital, para hacer crecer su negocio comprado materiales e insumos y mejorando sus herramientas D. trabajo para poder brindar un servicio D. calidad y con mayor eficiencia. En general el grupo no tienen experiencia trabajando con grupos solidarios pero aseguran ser gente responsable y con gran calidad humana por lo que la fundación agrocapital les brinda la oportunidad D. incrementar sus ingresos y D. mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The "Florida" group is represented by Mrs. Silvia Melina and has 16 members. They are dynamic and are enthusiastic about making progress in their small businesses. The majority of the group members are in sales such as food sales, neighborhood grocery stores, cosmetics and shoes. Some are service providers, housing construction, public transportation and Internet cafes. In the work field, especially sales, there is a lot of competition in the market. This forces the group members to improve the quality of their products and proviD. better quality service. That is why they need financing through the Agrocapital foundation, to make their businesses grow. By purchasing materials and supplies and improving their work tools, they can offer high quality service with better efficiency. In general the group doesn't have experience working with solidarity groups but they assure us they are responsible and good people. The Agrocapital foundation is offering them the opportunity to increase their income and improve their families' quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Los Tres Amigos Group

texts.es:
los señores del grupo Los Tres Amigos estan ubicados en la aldea de quebrada larga, Jamastran, son buenos en sus negocios, en la actualidad ellos no cuentan con capital de tranajo suficiente para surtir mas sus negocios razon por la cual estan solicitando un credito.
Santos I.: su actividad principal es el comercio tiene 5 y medio años de dedicarse a la venta de carnes de res y pollo, actividad que realiza de manera ambulante en las aldeas de quebrada larga, comunidades y cacerios cercanos de donde el vive, esta casado y es padre de una niña, ademas de dedicarse al comercio tambien se dedica a la agricultura pero sin dejar su negocio de carnes ya que cuando llega de la siembre el sale a vender por las tardes su producto.
Noemi F.: ella se dedica a la venta de ropa americana desde hace 3 años y medio, vive en union libre y es madre de un niño, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, ella comenzo con su negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y ahora ya tiene su clientela, ella distribuye su producto de manera ambulante y algunos clientes la buscan en su casa de habitacion.
Maria I.: ella se dedica al comercio y tiene un mini deposito de helados, actividad la cual inicio desde hace 4 años sus ventas son al por mayor y menor, ya que ella tiene vendedores que salen a vender el producto en bicicletas, ella es casada y de su familia solo depende un hijo al 100%, su esposo trabaja para una empresa del estado desde hace muchos años, con los ingresos que tenga quiere mejorar su calidad de vida y brindarle una buena educacion a su hijo
texts.en:
The group "Los Tres Amigos" is located in the village of "quebrada larga", Jamastran. They are good at their business, but at the moment they do not have sufficient work capital to buy supply for their businesses and for that reason they are requesting a loan.

Santos I.: He is mainly a merchant and for the past 5 1/2 years he has been selling beef and chicken for a living. He is a traveling salesman and sells in the villages of "quebrada larga", the communities and hamlets close to where he lives. He is married, a father of a girl, and he is also a farmer, but always taking care of his business therefore he sells his product in the afternoons during the harvest season.

Noemi F.: She has been selling American clothings for the past 3 1/2 years. She lives with her significant other and is the mother of a boy. Her husband is a farmer. She began her business to support her husband with the expenses of their home and now she has several clients. She is a street vendor and some clients look her up at home.

Maria I.: She is a merchant and has a mini deposit of ice-cream. She started selling wholesale and retail 4 years ago. She has salesmen that sell her products from bicycles. She is married and only one son depends 100% on the family. Her husband has been working for a state company for many years. With her income she wants to improve her life quality and give a good education to her son.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beef, chicken, garments, and ice-cream.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Las Villas Group

texts.es: El grupo "La Villas" esta representada por la señora Norma e integrada por 14 miembros los cuales son dinámicos y con muchas ganas de progresar en sus pequeños negocios. En su mayoría el grupo se dedica a actividades Arttesanales como a la fabricacion de artesanias coloniales, confeccion de polleras y actividades comerciales comerciales como la venta de comida, material escolar, abarrotes en tiendas de barrio, cosméticos, zapatos y algunos a la prestación de sevicios de transporte público. Dentro del ámbito laboral en especial el comercial existe gran competencia dentro del mercado por lo que le obliga a los integranrtes del grupo a mejorar la calida de sus productos y a proporcionar un servicio de mejor calidad es por esta razon que requieren de un fianciamiento a travez de la fundacion Agrocapital, para hacer crecer su negocio comprado materiales e insumos y mejorando sus herramientas de trabajo para poder brindar un servicio de calidad y con mayor eficiencia. Los socios (as) ya trabajaron con grupos solidarios por lo que conocen la modalidad de trabajo grupal habiendo trabajado antes con otras instituciones similares a la fundacion pero dentro de la misma llevan cursando su primer ciclo.
texts.en:
The group "Las Villas" is represented by Señora Norma and composed of 14 members who are dynamic and eager to progress in their small businesses. For the most part, the group is engaged in arts and crafts activities such as community handicrafts, dressmaking, and commercial activities such as selling food, school materials, groceries in neighborhood stores, cosmetics, shoes and services such as public transport. There is particularly strong competition within the labor market that forces group members to improve the quality of their products and provide a better quality of service. This is why they require a loan through the Agrocapital foundation to grow their business through the purchase of materials and supplies and the improvement of working tools to provide quality service and greater efficiency. Partners have already worked in groups so that they known the way of group credit, having worked before with other similar institutions at the foundation and within the same frequency in the first cycle.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Alto Mesa Verde Group

texts.es: El Grupo " Alto Mesa VerD." esta representado por la señora Agustina  y conformada por 17 miembros los cuales aun gran mayoría se conocen ya que residen en la misma localidad. en general los socios (as) se dedican al rubro comercial D. productos como, ropa, comida, zapatos, verduras fresca, bebidas, cosméticos y a actividades como el servicio público. Los socios Saben que dentro del marco comercial la competencia D. ofertas y demandas D. los clientes es granD. pero saben como salir adelante gracias a su gran experiencia en el M. libre. El destino del crédito es para la compra D. materiales e insumos para haces a sus productos mas competitivos. los socios no tienen experiencia en créditos solidarios por lo que es su primer ciclo con la fundación Agrocapital, pero ellos (as) asegura que son gente honesta, responsable y muy trabajadora por lo que no defraudaran a la institución.
texts.en:
The group "Alto Mesa VerD." is represented by Señora Augustine and is composed of 17 members, the majority of which know each other as they resiD. in the same location. In general, the partners engage in a commercial line of products such as clothing, food, shoes, fresh vegetables, beverages, cosmetics, and activities for public service. The partners know that within the commercial market, the competition of supply and demand of customers is great, but they know how to move forward thanks to their great experience with the open market. With the credit, they intend to purchase materials and supplies to make their products more competitive. The partners have no experience with joint credit and it is their first season with the Agrocapital foundation, but they assure that they are honest, responsible and hard-working and therefore not defrauding the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: La Buena Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El Grupo la Buena Esperanza esta formado por 4 personas las cuales se conocen hace varios años y han trabajado juntos por mucho tiempo.
la Sra. M. C. tiene 33 años de edad y se encuentra en union libre con el Sr. Luis M. con el cual han procreado un hijo que tiene 2 años de edad, ella se dedica a la sastreria y tiene experiencia en el mercado competente desde hace 7 años y tiene muchos clientes.
La Sra. Eydi M. tiene un hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos y costura desde hace 4 años, su compañero de hogar trabaja de motorista y los dos sacan adelante su hogar.
la Sra. B. ella se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 20 años en el barrio nacaome, valle, su negocio es bien visitado por muchos clientes ya que les gusta mucho el sabor de sus comidas.
texts.en:
The group "La Buena Esperanza" has 4 partners that have known each other for several years and have worked together for a long time.

Mrs. M. C. is 33 years old and lives with Mr. Luis M.. They have a 2 year-old son. She is a tailor and she has experience on the competitive market and has many clients.

Mrs. Eydi M. has a son. She has been selling cosmetics and clothing for 4 years. Her life partner is a motorist and both maintain their home.

Mrs. B. has sold food for 20 years in the neighborhood of Nacaome, Valle. Her business is visited by many clients as they enjoy the seasoning of her meals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material for tailoring, cosmetics and raw material for candy production

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es: El grupo "San Miguel" esta representado por la señora Karen y conformada por 15 miembros D. los cuales una mayoría se dedican a la actividad comercial D. productos como  ropa, zapatos, cosmeticos por catalogo, embutidos, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio y a actividades como el servicio dental, elavoracion D. pan e instalacion D. gas. Los socios (as) saben D. la gran competencia que existe en el mercado en especial en el rubro del comercio donD. los precios varian D. acuerdo a la demanda D. los consumidores y donD. se tiene que tener un producto acorD. a las necesidades y a un precio bajo para que pueda ser considerado competitivo; es por esta razon que los Socios (as) destinaran los fondos otorgados por la Fundacion Agrocapital para la compra D. mejores materiales e insumos para tener productos competitivos y D. buena calidad para incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias. Para una mayoría D. los socios D. este grupo el trabajar con grupos solidarios es algo nuevo pero cada uno esta conciente D. la responsabilidad y el trabajo duro que se necesita para poder cumplir con sus compromisos en especial para con su grupo.
texts.en:
The "San Miguel" group is represented by Señora Karen and consists of 15 members, the majority of which dedicate themselves to commercial activities, selling clothes, shoes, cosmetics via catalogues, sausages and groceries in neighbourhood stalls. Others are in dental services, bread-making and the installation gas systems.

The members know that there is great competition in the market, especially in the commercial area where prices vary according to consumer demand and where one must have a product that is needed and at a low price so that it can be considered competitive. For this reason, the members have determined the destiny of the funds raised from Fundacion Agrocapital will be to purchase better materials and components in order to have competitive, good quality products so that they may increase their revenue and better their families’ quality of life.

For the majority of this group, working within sympathetic groups is a new experience, but each is conscious of the responsibility and the hard work that needs to be done in order to fulfill their obligations, especially to the group.


Translated from Spanish by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Atardecer Group

texts.es: El grupo "Atardecer" Esta representado por la señora Martha y conformado por 15 miembros los cuales se conocen D. varios años ya que residen en el mismo barrio. En general los socios se dedican a actividades comerciales D. venta D. productos como zapatos, plantas , cuero, materiales eléctricos, venta D. abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio y ropa, algunos se dedican al la fabricación artesanías y al servicio D. abogacía. Los socios D. este grupo tienen bastante experiencia en sus rubros por lo que no les asusta la competencia en el mercado. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. materiales e insumos para su actividad comercial y a la mejora del las herramientas D. trabajo para mejorar la calidad D. sus productos. Es el primer financiamiento que los socios (as) obtienen como grupo solidario pero confían en sus compañeros (as) y se sienten capaces D. cumplir con la fundación Agrocapital que les brinda una oportunidad para mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad D. vida así como la des su familias.
texts.en:
The group “Atardecer” is represented by Señora Martha and is maD. up of 15 members who have known each other for a number of years and live in the same neighbourhood. In general, the members sell various products such as shoes, plants, leather, electrical good, groceries at neighbourhood stalls and clothes. Some make handicrafts and others proviD. legal services.

The members of the group have quite a lot of experience in their professions and titles and as such the competition in the market doesn’t scare them.This loan is destined for the purchase of materials and supplies for their commercial activities and the improvement of their professional tools in order to better the quality of their products.

This is the first loan that the members are requesting as a group but they trust their partners and feel they are able to fulfill the terms of their loan with Fundación Agrocapital, who offers them the opportunity to increase their revenue and improve their quality of life, along with that of their families.


Translated from Spanish by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es: El grupo "Fortaleza" esta representada por la señora Cathy e integrada por 14 miembros los cuales son dinámicos y con ganas D. progresar en su trabajo. En su mayoría el grupo se dedica a actividades comerciales como la venta D. comida, cosméticos, zapatos y algunos a la prestación D. sevicias D. construcción D. vivienda y a la venta D. abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio. Dentro del ámbito laboral en especial el comercial existe gran competencia dentro del mercado por lo que le obliga a los miembros a mejorar la calida D. sus productos para poder luchar contra la competencia. El destino del financiamiento es para el incremento D. capital y a la compra D. insumos y materiales para mejorar sus productos puestos a la venta. En general el grupo no tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios pero aseguran ser gente responsable y con gran calidad humana por lo que la fundación agrocapital les brinda la oportunidad D. incrementar sus ingresos y D. mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The “Fortaleza” group is represented by Señora Cathy and consists of 14 members who are dynamic and willing to progress in their work. The majority of the group dedicate themselves to commercial activities such as selling food, cosmetics and shoes and some are in housing construction and grocery sales in neighborhood stalls.

In the labor market, especially within the commercial sector, there is great competition in the market which forces the members to improve the quality of their products in order to fight the competition. The loan’s destiny is to increase their capital and also to purchase components and material to improve the products they sell.

In general, the group does not have any experience of working in a sympathetic group like this but they guarantee that they are responsible people with great human qualities and as such the Fundacion Agrocapital offers them the opportunity to increase their revenue and better their families’ quality of life.


Translated from Spanish by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Narcisa Del Socorro

texts.es:
Narcisa del Socorro Martínez tiene la edad de 44 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Narcisa tiene 1 hijo con la edad de 12 años y cursa recientemente el 5 grado de primaria, su compañero de vida labora como capataz de la finca Santa Cecilia, sus propósitos son de mantener un buen comportamiento en los pagos ya que si mantiene su record crediticio podrá serle de mucha ayuda para el futuro sus deseos son de abrir otra actividad económica y así incrementar sus ingresos que son necesarios para proporcionarle a sus hijos lo que ellos necesitan para que estos no pasen dificultades para el día de mañana sus sueños son de darle mejoras a su propiedad ya que su familia lo es todo por lo que quiere que sus hijos tengan su propia casa con las mejoras necesarias para que este sea un lugar digno donde vivir y todo esto lo quiere lograr con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo constante.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es el destace de cerdo y venta en pie, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 12 años, Doña Narcisa inicia este negocio por que en su familia ya existía este tipo de negocio y fue de forma hereditaria que logro quedarse con este negocio por lo que no le fue tan difícil desempeñarlo pero en lo que tuvo mas problemas fue en llamar la atención de su clientela porque tenia bastante competencia y todas las personas que se dedicaban a este tipo de oficio ya tenia sus propios clientes por lo que al inicio decide salir a la calles a ofrecer la carne y los nacatamales y los diferentes clientes que logro atraer fueron de otros lugares y así llegaban los clientes a su casa de habitación en busca del nacatamal, fritos y charrascas y sus mismos clientes fueron los que lograron darle fama y así sus vecinos se acercaban a su casa y compran lo que mas les gusta por lo que ahora solicita un financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo ya que tiene que buscar la venta de los cerdos y tiene que recorrer varios lugares en busca de la mejor oferta para ella y sacar provecho de su producción.
texts.en:
Narcisa del Socorro Martínez is forty-four years old and married. She has one son, who is twelve years old and recently entered fifth grade. Her partner is a foreman on the farm Santa Cecilia. Narcisa aims to maintain her good credit record –it will be a huge help to her in the future. Narcisa dreams of opening another business – it could increase her income so that she could better support her children. She wants to give them all they need to live day-to-day without difficulty. She wishes also to make improvements to their property, since it is all her family has. and she wants her children to have their own house with good quality necessities; she wants it to be a decent place to live. She wants to achieve all this with much effort and constant work. Narcisa raises pigs and sells the pork on foot. Her operation is at her house. She has had this business for twelve years. She got involved in the business because this type of business was already in her family. She has stuck with it because it is not too difficult, but she had trouble attracting customers because she has a lot of competition, and all the people in this type of business already had their own customers. This is why, in the beginning, she decided to go out into the streets to try to sell her meat and nacatamales (a special Latin American tamale). The different customers she gained were from other places. They began coming to her house to buy nacatamales, fried foods, and charrascas. These customers made her business known, and her neighbors came by her house and bought more that they liked. Now she is requesting a loan to increase her working capital, since she has to look for pigs and travel here and there to get them at the best price and make the most of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: La Terminal Group

texts.es: El grupo " Terminal" esta representado por la señora Fany quien es la presidenta del grupo conformado por 15 miembros D. los cuales una gran mayoría se dedican al rubro comercial D. productos como artesanías, ropa, perfumes, vidrios y a actividades como al servicio público D. urbano, al servicio domestico, secretaria y otros. Dentro del marco comercial siempre existe la competencia pero para competir solo se necesita capacidad y buenos productos para combatirla. El destino del crédito es para la compra D. insumos y materiales  así como para el mejoramiento D. sus herramientas D. trabajo para la mejor prestación D. servicios. Las socias no tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios pero son gente trabajadora y honesta por lo que la fundación Agrocapital le brinda la oportunidad para que puedan administrar sus fondos y mejorar sus ingresos y así mejor su calidad D. vida y la D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Terminal” is maD. up of 15 members. The majority of the members are in the business of selling handicrafts, clothes, perfumes, and glass. Others work in the urban public sector or as domestic service and secretaries. The president and representative of the group is Fany. Within the commercial sector, there is always competition, but to be able to compete, only aptituD. and good products are needed. The loan will be used to purchase products and materials to improve the group’s work tools and to strengthen the presentation of their services. The bank members do not have communal bank experience, but are hard-working and honest. For that reason, Agrocapital Foundation is giving them the opportunity to manage their loans and increase their income. That way, their quality of life and that of their families will improve.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational Capital

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
Karla Patricia U. Gutiérrez tiene la edad de 37 años, su estado civil es acompañada, Doña Karla tiene 2 niños sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 19 años cursa el 5 año de secundaria y su otro hijo de 12 años cursa el 3 año de secundaria, su compañero de vida labora como agente de seguridad, sus propósitos son de contar con otra fuente de ingresos ya que la vida esta cada día mas dura y los salarios son los mismos por lo que ella se preocupa que su familia depende completamente de ella y debe atender a la responsabilidad de Madre sus deseos son seguir proveyéndoles a sus hijos el dinero suficiente para que estos aprecien los sacrificios que ella realiza para que ellos obtengan lo necesario y que sean personas de bien y sean unos buenos profesionales para el futuro sus sueños son de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda para hacer de su casa un buen lugar para vivir y además dejarle a sus hijos un lugar donde puedan vivir con las comodidades necesarias y así estos crezcan gradualmente con una mentalidad mas madura.

La actividad económica de Doña Karla  es la venta de recarga electrónica y la venta de tarjeta de teléfono de las compañías de Movistar y Claro, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 2 años, ella inicia este negocio con la necesidad de buscar otra fuente de ingresos que pueda dar repuesta a la manutención de la familia ya que un día su esposo termino el contrato y dejo de trabajar y no contaban con nada de ingresos y decide recurrir a este tipo de negocio y obtiene la venta de tarjetas Movistar y sus clientes solicitaban las recargas electrónicas de la compañía Claro pero Doña Karla no tenia los suficiente para invertir en las recargas de la compañía Claro por lo que con las ganancias que obtenía de la venta de tarjetas Movistar las reservaba y mas tarde logra vender las recargas electrónicas de Claro  y es así como logra tener ambos negocios pero necesita el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que así lograra ofrecer a sus clientes una gran cantidad  en tarjetas ya que la ventaja que Doña Karla posee es que es la única con este tipo de venta ya que sus clientes solo llegan a buscar a su casa este servicio.
texts.en:
Karla Patricia U. Gutiérrez is 37 years old, partnered, and has two sons. Her older son is 19 years old and in his fifth year of secondary school. Her younger son is 12 and in his third year of secondary school. Her partner works as a security guard.

Karla's goal is to find another source of income, since expenses rise every day, while salaries remain the same. Karla is concerned about her family's financial security and wants to do whatever she can to be a responsible mother. She wants to be able to continue earning enough money to provide for her sons' needs. She hopes they will appreciate the sacrifices she has made for them and that they will become good people who work in professional occupations. Karla's dream is to make improvements to her home so that she can leave her sons a comfortable place to live, which will enable them to gradually develop maturity.

For the last two years, Karla has sold telephone cards and prepaid cellular phone airtime from her home. She started her business when her partner lost his job and they did not have any income. She began by selling Movistar brand phone cards. Her customers requested that she sell Claro brand prepaid cell phone airtime, but she did not have money to invest in them, as she needed all the money she made from the sale of telephone cards. Later, she was able to introduce Claro's products, and she currently sells both.

Karla is requesting funding for working capital, so she will be able to offer her customers a greater variety of cards. The advantage that Karla has is that she is the only business of this type in her area, so her customers look to her for this service.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es:
