El Señor de Nombre Félix Antonio Berríos M. tiene la edad de 37 años, su estado civil es casado, Don Félix tiene 1 niña su edad es de 5 años y recientemente cursa el 3 nivel de primaria, su compañera de trabaja junto con el ofreciendo los productos, sus propósitos son de incrementar su inventario para ofrecer a sus clientes una variedad de productos sus deseos son de trabajar para darle a su hija una buena educación y que pueda valerse en la vida y a la misma ves que tenga una carrera profesional que le servirá para en un futuro sus sueños son de independizarse de su esposa ya que el negocio lo conforman ambos pero quisiera establecer su propio negocio  en un lugar donde pueda ofrecer sus productos y además de tener este negocio Don Félix brinda el servicio de taxi ya que este negocio le permitió avanzar con el que tiene actualmente ya que el mañana puede beneficiarle a su hija este negocio y podrá subsistir para el día de mañana.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general como lo es: cosméticos, ropa y artículos plásticos, la ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 3 años, Don Félix inicio este negocio por la necesidad de una fuente de ingresos que le ayudara a sacar adelante a su familia por lo que tenia un buen tiempo de trabajar con su taxi pero debido a que su taxi se daño paso mucho tiempo sin trabajar por lo que su esposa y el deciden buscar otro negocio que le proporcione ganancias y con estas ganancias obtener los repuestos necesarios para su auto y así fue que empezaron a comprar ropa para ofertarla a sus amigos y vecinos y poco a poco lograron conseguir lo necesario para la compostura del taxi y es así como logran sacar adelante ambos negocios y enfrentar los problemas que se le presentaron para avanzar con su vida y ahora el financiamiento es para  capital de trabajo ya que así comprara la mercadería variada ya que no la compra en León tiene que realizar la compra en los diferentes departamentos como: Chinandega, Managua y chichigalpa por lo que resulta mas favorable la compra al por mayor.
texts.en:
Félix Antonio Berríos M. is 37 years old, married, and has a five-year-old daughter in kindergarten. He hopes to provide his daughter with a good education so she will be able to take care of herself and have a professional career. His wife works with him as a street vendor. His goal is to expand his inventory to offer his customers a greater variety of products. For now he is satisfied working with his wife, but he dreams of one day having his own shop. Félix also has a taxi service, and that work has helped him develop his current business of selling merchandise. He hopes his businesses will help sustain his daughter in the future.

For the last three years, Félix has sold a variety of merchandise, including cosmetics, clothing, and plastic items. He began his business out of economic necessity. He had worked for quite a while as a taxi driver, but then his taxi was damaged and he spent a lot of time out of work. He and his wife decided to look for another business that could provide money to repair his taxi, and that is how they began selling clothing to their friends and neighbors. Little by little they managed to earn enough to repair the taxi and now they are developing both businesses and are working on confronting the obstacles to getting ahead in life.

Félix is requesting a loan for working capital to purchase a variety of merchandise. He can get items for better prices outside of León, so he will travel to other areas, including Chinandega, Managua, and Chichigalpa.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Amistad Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "AMISTAD" ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA GRACIELA ELLA AL IGUAL QUE SUS COMPAÑERAS VAN CURSANDO SU PRIMER CICLO DENTRO LA FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL PERO SE SIENTEN CAPACES PARA CUMPLIR CON LAS EXPECTATIVAS D. LA INSTITUCIÓN. LA MAYORÍA D. LAS SOCIAS SE DEDICA A ACTIVIDADES D. VENTA D. COMIDA, ROPA, COSMÉTICOS POR CATÁLOGOS, ABARROTES EN TIENDAS D. BARRIO Y A LA COSTURA D. PRENDAS D. VESTIR. LAS SOCIAS RECONOCEN QUE EXISTE LA COMPETENCIA EN EL MERCADO Y PARA VENCERLA SE TIENE QUE CONTAR CON MUCHO ENTUSIASMO Y PRODUCTOS D. CALIDAD Y ES AHÍ DOND. LA FUNDACIÓN COLABORA CON LOS PEQUEÑOS VENDEDORES, BRINDANDO UN APOYO FINANCIERO PARA NUEVOS PROYECTOS D. EXPANSIÓN Y MEJORA D. PRODUCTOS, QUE CONLLEVA A MEJORES INGRESOS PARA BRINDAR A LOS SOCIOS Y A SUS FAMILIAS MEJOR CALIDAD D. VIDA.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Amistad” is represented by Graciela. She and the other bank members are starting their first loan cycle with Agrocapital Foundation. However, they feel capable of meeting the institution’s expectations. The majority of the members are in the business of selling food, clothes, cosmetics for catalogues, groceries in neighborhood stores and tailoring clothes. The members know that there is a lot of competition in the marketplace, and in order to overcome it, much enthusiasm and good quality products are needed. It is with this that the foundation helps the small business owners, by providing finaincial support for new expansion projects and improvement of products, which produces higher income and ultimately a better quality of life for members and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational Capital

loans.name: Santa Barbara Group

texts.es: El grupo "Santa Bárbara" esta representado por la señora Ruly y conformado por 20 miembros D. los cuales 5 son varones y 15 mujeres, todos los miembros van cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando solidaridad, responsabilidad, honestidad  y esmero en el trabajo. La mayorías D. los socios (as) se dedica al comercio D. productos como la carne, pan, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, ropa, cosméticos y algunos se dedican a otras actividades como a la elaboración D. pan, al servicio domestico, al transporte publico y al servicio mecánico. Como lo demostraron en el anterior ciclo son gente muy trabajadora y emprendedora por lo que la competencia no les preocupa para poder salir adelante. El destino del financiamiento es para mejorar la calidad y cantidad D. productos, a la reparación D. sus herramientas D. trabajo y al incremento D. capital. Los socios (as) tienen experiencia trabajando con grupos solidarios por lo que conocen el trabajo en equipo para poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Santa Bárbara” is represented by Ruly and maD. up of 20 members. Of these members, five are men and 15 are women. All the members of this communal bank are beginning their second loan cycle and have shown solidarity, responsibility, honesty, and care in their work. The majority of the members sell products such as meat, bread, groceries in neighborhood stores, clothes, and cosmetics. Others are bread makers, serve as domestic service, work in public transportation and work as mechanics. As they demonstrated in the last loan cycle, they are very hard-working and entrepreneurial, and therefore, they are not too concerned that the competition will prevent them from pulling out ahead. Their loans will be used to improve their quality of life, increase the quantity of their products, repair their work tools, and increase capital. The members have work experience with communal banks, and thus they know about using teamwork to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational Capital

loans.name: Primera De Samuel Group

texts.es: Las integrantes del GRUPO SOLIDARIO FRATERNIDAD viven en el barrio Ricardo Rivera de la ciudad de Diriomo tuvieron la oportunidad de aprobar la primaria lo que les permite ser unas personas bien comunicativas y accesibles en la sociedad. Iniciaron sus negocios ambulantes, vendiendo ropa de forma ambulante. La Señora Araceli del Carmen L. junto a su grupo ha logrado obtener 2 créditos con Adim, tiene pocos meses de trabajar pero la experiencia ha sido muy buena porque ella recibe confianza y siente que debe de responder igual y así lo expresa a su grupo y anima a que sigan con excelente comportamiento, está esperando a asistir a una capacitación a la que está invitada y tiene deseos de salir adelante. Ella vende ropa usada y nueva, en su casa exhibe la ropa usada y la nueva solo la lleva por encargos de sus clientes, cada vez tiene más encargos, tiene dos niños pequeños que ella misma los cuida. Está muy orgullosa de poder tener un negocio y ser reconocida por esto y así el nivel de vida de sus hijos ha mejorado notablemente. Sus créditos lo utilizan en la compra de pacas de ropa seleccionada y así ofrecer un mejor producto a su clientela.
texts.en:
The members of the group “Fraternity and solidarity” live in the Ricardo Rivera neighborhood of the city of Diriomo, Nicaragua. They had the opportunity to finish primary school, which has allowed them to be communicative and accessible people in society. They started their businesses as walking saleswomen, selling their clothes as they walked the streets. Mrs. Araceli del Carmen L., along with her group, has received two previous credits from Kiva field partner ADIM. Araceli has only a few months of work experience, but it has been very good because it has given her confidence and she feels that she should respond equally. That’s how she expresses it to her group and encourages them to continue with their excellent work. She is hoping to attend a training to which she has been invited, and she wants to move forward. She sells new and used clothes. She displays the used clothing in her home, but she carries new clothing solely based on client orders. Her orders are continually growing. She has two small children that she takes care of herself. She is very proud to be able to have a business and be recognized for it, and her children’s quality of life has improved notably because of it. The requested loan will be used to purchase selected clothing in bulk so that she can offer better products for her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase varied clothing to sell to clients

loans.name: German Antonio

texts.es:
German Antonio L. C. tiene la edad de 58 años, su estado civil es acompañado, Don German tiene 3 hijos sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 38 años y trabaja por cuenta propia su otro hijo de 36 años también labora por cuenta propia y su hijo menor de 32 años todos sus hijos están casados y trabajan por cuenta propia, su compañera de vida labora en la atención de una comideria en su casa de habitación, sus propósitos son de darle el mantenimiento adecuado a su camión por lo que sus clientes exigen lo mejor de sus servicios sus sueños son de establecer un billar para que este le genere mas ingresos para su familia además que este negocio es solicitado por lo jóvenes y obtendría afluencia de clientes además podría heredarle a su hijos este negocio para que el día de mañana tengan un respaldo para los ingresos sus sueños son de cambiar su unidad de transporte y que a la ves este sea moderno y grande para que sus clientes tengan una excelente comodidad en su unidad.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es el transporte de personal de la zona rural a la ciudad y viceversa, la ubicación de su negocio en de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 40 años, Don German inicia su negocio en Managua con fondos propios ya que comercializaba con mercancías vendía productos como: cuadros de pintura, jarrones y electrodomésticos pero este tipo de negocio le fue difícil mantenerlo por que algunas veces no vendía toda la mercadería por lo que decide establecer otro negocio de auto lavado pero no tenia mucha experiencia en este tipo de negocio  por lo que no duro mucho este tipo de negocio y decide establecer el negocio del transporte de personas de la zona rural a la ciudad por lo que necesita el financiamiento para capital de trabajosa que necesita darle mejoras a su camión que es el que se encarga de trasladar a las personas y necesita comprar: llantas, frenos entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
German Antonio L. C. is 58 years old, partnered, and has three sons (ages 38, 36, and 32) who are all married and self-employed. His partner runs a small restaurant in their home. German's goal is to provide proper maintenance for his truck to give his customers high-quality service. He would also like to upgrade to a larger and more modern vehicle so that his customers are more comfortable. His dream is to have a pool hall, which would generate greater income for his family. As a pool hall is in great demand from young people, he would have a large clientele and he would be able to pass on the business to his sons so they would have adequate support.

For forty years, German has offered transportation between the city and rural areas. He began his business in Managua, using his own money. Previously he had sold products such as picture frames, vases, and appliances. That business was difficult to maintain because he often was unable to sell all his merchandise. So, he decided to start a car wash, but he did not have enough experience to make that business a success. Finally, he began his transportation business.

German is requesting a loan for working capital in order to make repairs to his truck. He will purchase tires, brakes, and other parts.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Artesanas Unidas Group

texts.es: El g/s ARTESANAS UNIDAS ellos están en su tercer ciclo son de la comunidad de San Juan de Oriente, son personas humildes pero emprendedoras, tiene la primaria aprobada y eso les permites ser bien expresivas y han logrado tener sus talleres en sus casas y así poder ver a sus hijos y dar trabajo a toda la familia. Con el crédito de adim han tenido la oportunidad de mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia, ya que con las ganancias además de invertir en sus negocios también han realizado mejoras en sus hogares. Doña María Elena L. M. es casada, junto a su esposo han logrado hacer crecer el taller, este oficio lo han aprendido de sus padres y al casarse decidieron establecer uno propio, esta señora expresa que con las capacitaciones de Adim ella ha logrado comprender que es microempresaria y como se debe de llevar controles para no perder en el negocio, ella es quien se entiende por entero de fijar los precios y del control de la calidad de sus productos. Espera seguir obteniendo créditos para seguir mejorando ya que su sueño es mejorar su casa y que sus hijos estudien y tengan un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
The ARTESANAS UNIDAS (United Artisans) group is on its third loan cycle. They live in the town of San Juan de Oriente. They are poor but enterprising people who have completed primary education; this enables them to express themselves and they have established workshops in their homes, enabling them to see their children while also providing work for the whole family.

The ADIM loan has enabled them to improve their family's living standards since they invest their earnings in the business and in home improvements.María Elena L. M. is married. She and her husband have expanded their workshop, in which they have been carrying on the trade learned from their parents since they decided, as newly-weds, to go into business.

Training provided by ADIM has enabled her to understand that she is a micro-entrepreneur and taught her how to monitor things so as not to lose money on her business. She personally sets prices and controls product quality. She hopes to continue obtaining loans so as to continue making improvements; her dream is to improve her house and enable her children to study so that they can have a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in producing handcrafts so as to offer more variety to their customers

loans.name: Nice Group

texts.es: Con dos créditos el g/s NICE  está ubicado en la comunidad de Catarina, donde elaboran artesanía en barro y pintura. Son personas responsables y conocidas por su actividad. Una de sus integrantes Doña Ana María, tiene varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad, vive a la orilla de la carretera y esto le permite exhibir sus productos que son de buena calidad. Expresa que hacía mucho tiempo necesitaba un crédito, pero no tenía garantías para poder obtener uno, cuando las oficinas de Adim abrieron en la zona escuchó la propaganda y con ayuda del asesor de crédito eligió bien a los integrantes, lo que le permitió trabajar hasta hoy sin problemas, ella anima a ellos para que salgan adelante cumpliendo con sus pagos. Con el primer crédito compró pinturas para mejorar la presentación de los productos y esto le incrementó las ventas con algunos de sus clientes fijos. Espera seguir creciendo para un día tener una galería.
texts.en:
The NICE group, located in the town of Catarina, has had two loans so far; it makes pottery and painted handcrafts. They are responsible people who are well known for their activity.

One of the members, Ana María, has been working in this activity for several years; she lives beside the main road, enabling her to display her products, which are of good quality. She says that she has long needed a loan but had no assurance of being able to receive one.

When the Adim office opened in the district, she heard the advertising and, with the help of the loan advisor, chose the group members carefully. As a result, she has been able to continue working without any problems, and she encourages her fellow members to fulfil their payment commitments.

She used the first loan to buy paint so as to improve the appearance of her products, enabling her to increase sales to a number of stable customers. One day she hopes to have her own gallery.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve the quality of their products

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 52 años, es madre de cinco hijos, todos ellos independientes y de familia pero viven con ella en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 5 años. Se levanta muy temprano, a las 3:00am  para preparar los diversos platos que vende a los trabajadores de una constructora, lo más demandado es el tradicional caldo de gallina, que es una sopa muy consistente y que generalmente se toma para recuperar fuerzas, a muy tardar Rosa acaba de vender su caldo a las 6:00 am, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos de su buena atención y su buena sazón.  Además le es rentable porque no tiene competencia en la zona. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que solicita va a mandar a construir un kiosco para vender con mayor comodidad, porque hasta el momento lo hace al aire libre.
texts.en:
Rosa is 52 and the mother of five children. They are all independent and have their own families, but they still live with Rosa in the house she owns. For five years she has earned her living by selling meals. She gets up very early, at 3:00AM, to prepare a variety of meals, which she sells to the workers on a construction site. In highest demand is her traditional chicken soup, which is very hearty, and typically eaten to get one's strength back. Rosa is done selling her soup by 6:00AM at the latest. What she likes about her work is that her clients take pleasure in her good service and flavorful food. In addition, business is profitable as there is no competition in the area. This will be Rosa's first loan with MFP. She plans to use the money to have a kiosk built so she can be more comfortable; until now she has been out in the open.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kiosk for her business

loans.name: Sadith

texts.es: Sadith vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a prestar servicios de lavandería a toda persona que lo solicite, sus primeros clientes fueron sus vecinos quienes la fueron recomendando a otras personas y así creció su clientela, esta labor la viene ejerciendo desde hace 7 años en su propia casa con una lavadora automática y con varios lavatorios caseros, Sadith se esfuerza para que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos por su buena labor y le sigan confiando sus prendas. Además de trabajar independientemente tiene un contrato para lavar la ropa para un puesto de salud, y le va muy bien. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, con el dinero solicitado quiere mandar a construir en su casa unos lavaderos de cemento para no seguir lavando en lavatorios de plástico.
texts.en:
Sadith lives in her own house with her husband and their two children. She earns her living by providing laundry services for anyone who needs them. Her first clients were her neighbors, and business grew as they recomended her to other people. She's been runninger her business in her own home for 7 years with one washing machine and a variety of makeshift washbasins. Sadith strives to satisfy her clients with quality work so they will continue to trust her with their garments. In addition to her individual clientele, she also has a laundry contract with a health clinic, which is going very well. This will be her 4th loan with MFP. She plans to use the money to have some cement sinks installed in her house so she doesn't have to keep using plastic washbasins.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build some cement sinks

loans.name: Melina

texts.es: La señora Melina tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo y su hija que es madre soltera y ambos la apoyan mucho. Se  dedica a la crianza  de pollos dentro de su vivienda desde hace 6 años, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es criar adecuadamente a sus animales, para que puedan tener el tamaño y peso adecuado como los prefieren sus clientes. Cada 35 días Melina vende sus aves a los compradores de su zona, que al tener pedidos constantes y seguros, su negocio le es rentable. Lo que dificulta su labor es el espacio, ya que es incómodo criar a todos sus pollos en su casa. Este es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, con el dinero que está solicitando es para la construcción de un galpón para tener un ambiente adecuado para sus animales, también adquirirá pollos bebes y lo necesario en alimento balanceado.
texts.en:
Melina is 50-years-old and lives with her husband and her daughter, who is a single mother. They both give her a lot of support. For the past 6 years she has earned her living raising chickens in her home. What she enjoys about her work is being able to raise her chickens to the size and weight perferred by her clients. Every 35 days Melina sells her birds to local buyers. Orders are steady and secure, so her business is profitable. What's difficult about her work is that she has insufficient space in her house to raise all of her chickens. This will be Melina's third loan with MFP. She plans to use the money to build a chicken coop to provide the right environment for her animals. She will also get some baby chicks and the nutritionally-balanced feed they need.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a chicken coop

loans.name: Octavio

texts.es:
El señor Octavio R. tiene poco tiempo que adquirió su vivienda por medio de su trabajo mediante un crédito del gobierno.
 Con un crédito anterior de FVP a construido la barda, pero le esta haciendo falta el vitropiso y una cocineta. Esta solicitando un préstamo para esa nueva mejora y así tener su casa en mejores condiciones ya que tiene dos niños para los cuales quiere lo mejor.
 Trabaja en una maquiladora en el aria de técnico mecánico   y su esposa la señora Evangélica Perales se dedica a la venta de perfumes, estos son los ingresos de su familia y con el cual planean pagar el crédito. Cuando se realizo la visita al domicilio de Don Octavio se encontraba en su trabajo es por eso que en la foto aparece su esposa Doña Evangélica.
texts.en:
Octavio R. recently bought his home with the help of a government loan.

Using a previous loan from FVP, he built the fence, but now he needs to tile the floor and install a kitchenette. He has applied for the loan to make these improvements and have a more comfortable house for his two children, since he wants only the best for them.

He works as a mechanic in a factory and his wife, Evangélica Perales, sells perfumes; those are the family's sources of income, with which they will repay the loan. Octavio was at work when the loan officer came to visit, so it is his wife, Evangélica, who appears in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tile the floor

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan José E. M. tiene 65 años de edad su estado civil es soltero, Don Juan tiene 1 hijo de la edad de 40 años y cursa el 4 año de secundaria de nivel superior y este a la misma ves trabaja hay que resaltar que su hijo estudia de noche ya que el no pudo estudiar por lo que tenia que trabajar y hoy en día esta estudiando, sus propósitos son de mantener activo su negocio activo y así poder pagar los compromisos contraídos con Fundación León 2000 que no le gustaría quedar mal con su record sus sueños son de comprar otra unidad de taxi para seguir trabajando y además dejarle este negocio a su hijo ya que le beneficiaria para el futuro ya que este seria otro medio de ingresos para el y su familia sus deseos son seguir trabajando para que de esta forma pueda obtener su propia cooperativa de taxi y así dejar de trabajar ya que se siente muy cansado por su edad por lo que este seria su mayor deseo.

La actividad económica es el servicio de taxi, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante por lo que tiene que recorrer las diferentes calles en busca de pasajeros, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 15 años, Don Juan inicio este negocio por cuenta propia y con su dinero como mecánico y además joyero por lo que ambas profesiones las practico por lo que estas no le proporcionaban el ingreso necesario para su familia y decide incursionar en un nuevo negocio como es el servicio de taxi ya que los trabajos que tenia anteriormente no le cubría  lo necesario para los gastos de su hogar y es como decide mas tarde incursionar a otro negocio como lo es el servicio de taxi por lo que  no cuenta con otra actividad económica y este negocio le gusta y es así como decide quedarse con este negocio por lo que ahora necesita financiamiento para capital de trabajo  ya que necesita comprar amortiguadores y chequeo general de del taxi para que sus clientes no peligren con el servicio que le brinda.
texts.en:
Juan José E. M. is sixty-five years old and single. Juan has one son, who is forty and in his fourth year of advanced studies and working at the same time. It is worth highlighting that his son studies at night -- Juan himself could not study when he had to work. These days he is studying. Juan hopes to maintain his business and in this way pay back Fundación León 2000, because he would not like to develop a bad record with them. He dreams of adding another taxi unit to his business, and of leaving this business to his son, who would benefit in the future, even though it would be an investment for him and his family. Juan’s son dreams of having his own taxi business; then Juan could stop working, since he is very tired by his age – this is their biggest dream. Juan runs a taxi service. His business travels, because he must drive around the streets looking for passengers. Juan has had this business for fifteen years. He started it of his own account with money he had earned from being a mechanic and a jeweler (he was both). He decided to start a taxi business since he could not count on the jobs he was working to cover household costs well. He likes this business, which is why he has chosen to stay with it and ask for a loan to purchase shock absorbers and general car servicing for the taxis so that his customers are not put in danger by the service he provides.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Steffanie

texts.es: Steffanie tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres quienes la incentivan a seguir adelante en su negocio. Es una joven con muchas metas, por eso se esfuerza mucho en su trabajo, se dedica a la venta de ropa de modelos variados para todas la edades, vender puerta a puerta por los diferentes lugares de su localidad, dejando al contado o al crédito. En sus momentos libres elabora joyería, tales como argollas, aretes, collares, etc. Le gusta su trabajo porque se relacionarse con muchas personas, y le es rentable porque solo trabaja en base a  pedidos y como sus clientes no tienen donde comprar ropa, siempre esperan la llegada de Steffanie con sus pedidos. Este es su 3er crédito con MFP, con el dinero que ha solicitado quiere comprar más ropa para su negocio, además adquirirá una moto lineal de segunda mano para movilizarse y evitar estar pagando varios pasajes en transporte público cuando se visita a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Steffanie is 19 years old, single, and lives with her parents, who encourage her in her business. She is a young lady with many goals, so she works hard at her job selling various styles of clothing for all ages. She sells door-to-door around her town and accepts cash or credit. In her free time she makes jewelry like rings, earrings, necklaces, etc. She likes her job because she interacts with many people, and it's profitable because she only sells by taking orders. Since her customers do not have anywhere to buy clothing, they always look forward to Steffanie's clothing deliveries. This is her 3rd loan with MFP. With the money she has requested, she wants to buy more clothing for her business and a second-hand motor scooter for travel to avoid paying fares on public trasportation when she visits her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Amador

texts.es: Amador tiene 40 años, es padre soltero, vive con sus 3 hijos que son estudiantes. La casa donde vive es propia. Es propietario de un motocarro que maneja, hace 4 años trabaja para una línea cosmética de perfumes y lencería distribuyendo sus productos a personas e instituciones por diferentes lugares de su ciudad. Amador se siente muy contento de estar en este oficio porque tener este vehículo le ha sido de gran beneficio, y puede trabajar de manera estable para esta empresa donde tiene un ingreso seguro, ya que haciéndolo de manera independiente como taxi, depende de la demanda, el clima y otros factores para ganar una cantidad diaria. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, con la cantidad que está solicitando comprará repuestos para reparar su motocarro.
texts.en:
Amador is 40 years old and is a single father who lives with his three children, who are in school. He owns the house he lives in. He owns the three-wheeled scooter that he drives, and for 4 years he has worked as a distributor for a cosmetic company that sells perfumes and lingerie. He delivers products to people and establishments around his city. Amador is very content with this job and having his vehicle has been beneficial. He enjoys stable work with this company and a secure income, whereas working as a taxi driver depends on demand, weather, and other factors in order to earn daily wages. This is his 3rd loan with MFP. With the loan he is requesting, he will buy spare parts to repair his scooter.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for his three-wheeled scooter

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La señora Norma H. y su esposo el señor Carlos Javier Salazar, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar a los cuales desean darles lo mejor. 
 A su vivienda le está haciendo falta una losa de concreto en el patio ya que cuando están las lluvias se inunda y los niños no pueden salir a jugar. 
Está solicitando un préstamo para poder realizar la mejora lo más pronto posible, planea pagar con los ingresos de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Norma H. and her husband, Mr. Carlos Javier Salazar, have two school-age children. They would like to give them their best.

Their house needs concrete floor slabs on the patio since it floods when it rains and the children can't go out to play.

She is applying for a loan in order to make the improvements as soon as possible. She plans to pay with income from her job.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Concrete floor slabs for patio

loans.name: Tower

texts.es: Tower tiene 26 años de edad, vive con su pareja en casa de sus padres. Se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, empezó como chofer trabajando para otras personas, pero ahora ya es propietario de un motocarro, con el que hace taxi. Este tipo de vehículo es muy común en su región para el transporte público, porque debido al calor las personas prefieren transportarse así que en un bus o camioneta cerrada. Adicionalmente al transporte, Tower es agricultor, tiene algunos terrenos donde cultiva maíz, yuca, plátano, y otros productos que lleva a vender al mercado de su localidad. Estas dos actividades permiten que Tower pueda mejorar la economía de su familia y ahorrar para cuando decidan tener hijos, además de independizarse a una casa propia. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que está solicitando va a comprar un motor para cambiar que el que tiene su moto y está fallando.
texts.en:
Tower is 26 years old and lives with his partner in her parents' house. He provides transportation for people. He started as a chauffeur working for other people, but now he owns his own three-wheeled scooter, which he uses as a taxi. Where he lives, this type of vehicle is a very common type of public transportation. Because of the heat, people prefer them to traveling by bus or closed truck. In addition to transportation, Tower is a farmer and has some land where he grows corn, yucca, bananas, and other products that he sells at the market in town. These two activities help Tower improve his family's financial situation and save money for when they decide to have children and also for buying their own house. This is his 3rd loan with MFP, and with the money he is requesting he will buy a new engine for his scooter to replace the one that is failing.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an engine for his scooter

loans.name: Estela

texts.es: La señora Estela, D. 45 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en edad escolar en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes y pasamanería desD. hace 2 años, negocio que ha implementado en su vivienda; y con el que respalda el sustento económico D. ella y D. su familia. Estela venD. durante todo el día, le gusta su trabajo porque socializa, y como a ella le gusta mucho conversar se divierte intercambiando ideas con sus clientes D. donD. surgen nuevas amistades. El negocio está yendo muy bien hasta ahora, y eso la motiva para continuar invirtiendo en él. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a ampliar su negocio, mejorando las estructuras del espacio donD. lo tiene, y también incrementar sus productos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Estela M. D. R. is 45-year-old and lives with her husband and two school-aged children in her own house. For the last two years, she has sold groceries and general goods from a business she initiated from her home. The business provides economic support for Estela and her family. She sells during the day and enjoys her work because of the social aspect that allows her to have fun interacting and exchanging ideas with her customers and even form new friendships. The business has been going very well up to now, and it has motivated her to continue investing in it. This it is her third loan with MFP. With the funds requested Estela will expand her business, improving the physical space and she will also increase the selection of products she offers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the selection of products and improve the physical space of the business.

loans.name: Martha Azucena

texts.es:
La Señora de Nombre Martha Azucena C. tiene la edad de 49 años, su estado civil es acompañada, Doña Martha tiene 1 hijo de la edad de 14 años y cursa el 2 año de secundaria, su compañero de vida labora como mecánico, sus propósitos  son de sacar adelante a su familia ya que dependen de ella y tiene que hacerse cargo de los gastos de su casa además están los gastos de su hijo, sus sueños son de mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia para que no les afecte la situación económica que enfrentan actualmente ya que la situación económica es la mas difícil de superar es por eso que le gustaría trabajar mas y recaudar lo suficiente para descansar y disfrutar de la vida sus deseos son de transportar frutas a diferentes departamentos del país en un vehiculo propio y ampliar su negocio y así ser una comerciante que pueda vender la mercadería al por mayor y de esta forma obtendría mas ingresos para su familia.

Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general frutas, granos básicos, ropa, calzado y otros, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 20 años, ella inicio su negocio por cuenta propia ya que desde muy temprana edad le enseñaron a trabajar y además tenia que cuidar a su hijo por lo que realizo un viaje a Costa Rica gano dinero con lo cual inicio su actividad y decide empezar ofrecer unos cuantos productos como: ropa para niños y frutas pero con el paso del tiempo piensa que necesita incrementar mas en su mercadería y es capaza de lograrlo ya que utilizaba muy bien su capital de trabajo pero necesita mas dinero por lo que solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de frutas, granos básicos, calzado y plásticos ya que su lugar de confianza para realizar estos tipos de prestamos son Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones que hacen posible el financiamiento para los pequeños empresarios.
texts.en:
Martha Azucena C. is forty-nine years old and lives with her life partner. She has a fourteen-year-old son who is in his second year of highschool. Her partner is a mechanic. Martha’s family depends on her and she wants to keep them afloat. She has to take care of the house expenses and child expenses on top of that. She dreams of improving the quality of life for her family. The economic situation which they face now is most difficult to surpass. Martha wants to work more, so that they will not be affected by the financial difficulty. She wants to make enough money that she can rest and enjoy the life of her dreams; she would like to transport fruit to different parts of the country in her own vehicle, and increase her businesses – then she would be a businesswoman who could sell wholesale, which would increase her income and help her family. Martha sells merchandise: general fruits, basic grains, clothes, footwear, and more. She is a traveling vendor. She has had her business for twenty years. She started her business when she was very young, and learned to work. She also had to take care of her son. It was when she made a trip to Costa Rica that she earned the money with which she started her business. She decided to start selling things like children’s clothes and fruit. She thinks now that she needs to add to her merhcandie. She feels that she is capable of doing this – she already uses her working capital very well – but she needs more money, which is why she is requesting this loan. The money will be used to buy fruits, basic grains, footwear, and plastics. Fundación León 200 and other organizations have confidence in small-business people and make it possible for loans like this to be granted.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Rómulo

texts.es: Rómulo tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años se dedica al transporte de pasajeros a razón de ser propietario de un motocarro, se esfuerza mucho en su trabajo por sus hijos, los mismos que estudian y son su razón de seguir adelante. Rómulo es profesor del nivel primario, pero a causa de no encontrar un puesto seguro en alguna institución educativa es que se dedica al transporte de pasajeros. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar un buen trato a sus clientes y que se sientan seguros mientras los transporta. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que está solicitando mandará a reparar su motocarro.
texts.en:
Rómulo is 40 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in his own house. For the last three years he has earned a living transporting passengers in his three-wheeled motorcar. He works very hard because of his children who are in school and who motivate him to forge ahead economically. Rómulo is a primary school teacher, but because he has not been able to secure a position in an educational institution, he has earned a living transporting passengers. He enjoys that he is able to provide good service to his customers and that they feel safe while he transports them. This is his second loan with MFP. With the funds requested, Rómulo will have his three-wheeled motorcar repaired.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his three-wheeled motorcar.

loans.name: Carla

texts.es: Carla tiene 18 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos. Se dedica a la venta de zapatos, actividad que aprendió de su madre, Carla compra zapatos y los lleva a vender por diferentes lugares de casa en casa, dejándolos a un precio cómodo para sus clientes, empezó este negocio hace un año y le gusta porque se relaciona con muchas personas y se esmera en darles un buen trato. Debido a la calidad y variados modelos que vende, sus clientes están empezando a recomendarla y su clientela empieza a crecer muy rápido. Este e su primer préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que está solicitando comprará más zapatos, también quiere adquirir un porta zapatos donde pueda mostrarlos.
texts.en:
Carla is 18 years old, single, and lives with her parents and brothers. She sells shoes, an enterprise she learned from her mother. Carla buys shoes and then re-sells them at a very fair price, going from home to home in different areas. She began this business a year ago and enjoys it because she is able to interact with many people and she takes pride in giving them a good deal. Due to the quality and variety of styles she sells, her customers are beginning to recommend her and her clientele is quickly growing. This is her first loan with MFP. With the funds requested, Carla will buy more shoes and also acquire a portable shoe display.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene 57 años, es madre soltera, vive con uno D. sus 8 hijos quien es soltero y trabaja para apoyarla en lo posible. La casa donD. vive es propia. La labor  que tiene todos los días es la venta D. plátanos, actividad que viene realizando desD. hace 7 años y que gracias a su buena atención y jovialidad cuenta con una clientela fiel. Lo que le gusta D. su trabajo es tener trato directo con sus clientes con quienes se lleva muy bien, además le es rentable porque donD. vive es la única persona que tiene este tipo D. negocio, y sobre todo que ve ingresos diarios. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y con la cantidad que está solicitado implementará un espacio fuera D. su casa con un techo D. ramas (ramada) que la cubra del sol y D. la lluvia para vender con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Norma is a 57-year-old single mother who lives with one of her 8 children. He is single and works in order to support her as much as possible. She lives in her own house. She sells plantains everyday, as she has been doing for 7 years. Thanks to her great customer service and her cheerfulness, she has established a faithful clientele. What she likes about her job is dealing directly with her customers, with whom she gets along well. Also, her business is lucrative because she is the only person in the area with this type of business, which means she earns profits on a daily basis. This is her first loan with MFP. With the money that she is requesting, she will set up a business space outsiD. of her home with a thatch roof (a ramada) that will shield her from the sun and the rain, thus allowing her to conduct business comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fruit business space

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es: Milagros tiene 28 años, vive con su esposo y su único hijo. Ella es profesora en una institución educativa de su región, también estudio el arte de las manualidades con piedras, perlas y otros elementos, y en su casa, en sus momentos libres se dedica a confeccionar zapatos y sandalias con estos materiales, que luego lleva a vender a sus colegas y amistades dejándolos al contado o al crédito. Le gusta cada día ir perfeccionando su técnica lo que ayuda la práctica constante de este tipo de trabajo manual. Además puede obtener ganancias extras a su remuneración como maestra y esto es por lo que se siente satisfecha y motivada para seguir haciéndolo. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo en MFP, con la cantidad requerida comprará más materiales de bijouteria, y también una vitrina para mostrar sus trabajos.
texts.en:
Milagros is 28 years old and lives with her husband and one son. She is a teacher at an educational institution in her region and is also studying jewelery art to shape stones, pearls and other elements. At home in her free time Milagros makes shoes and sandals featuring these items which she then sells to her colleagues and friends who often pay at a later date. She would like to perfect her technique and constant practive helps with this type of manual labor. She also obtains extra income aside from her job as a teacher and this makes her feel satisfied and motivated to continue. This is the first loan that she has requested with Microfinanzas PRISMA and with the amount required she will buy more materials for finely crafted jewelery and also a window showcase to display her works.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to produce jewelery, shoes and sandals

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es: Ángela tiene 58 años de edad, tiene un hijo que está estudiando, vive con su esposo, y ambos la apoyan en su negocio. La casa que habitan es propia. Se dedica al comercio de ropa y zapatos para niños y adultos, prendas que ofrece de casa en casa a sus vecinos y amistades, y cuando es un cliente de confianza les deja al crédito. Desde muy joven ha trabajado muy duro, y ahora lo sigue haciendo para seguir solventando los estudios de su hijo. Durante todos estos años este negocio le ha sido rentable, por lo que no duda en seguir invirtiendo de su tiempo y dinero para verlo crecer. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y con la cantidad que ha solicitado hará realidad su sueño de tener su propia tienda, ya que mandara a construir un local al costado de su casa para exhibir sus prendas y poder acoger ahí a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ángela is 58 years old, has one son who is a student, and lives with her husband. Both of them support her in her business. They own the house they live in. She dedicates herself to selling clothes and shoes for adults and children, items that she offers door-to-door to friends and neighbors. When it is a trusted customer, she will allow them to buy on credit. She has worked very hard since she was a youngster, and she continues to do so in order to pay for her son’s education. Over all these years, her business has been very profitable and she doesn’t have any doubts about continuing to invest her time and money to see it grow. This is her first loan with MFP and, with the amount she is requesting, she will make her dream of having her own store a reality. The loan will enable her to contract out construction of a site next to her house where she can showcase her products and receive her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a site for her business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 35 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos que la apoyan mucho y una pareja a quien ama y siempre la anima a seguir trabajando por sus metas. Esta pareja se dedica al transporte, su esposo maneja el motocarro que es de Nancy por toda la ciudad haciendo servicio de taxi y ella administra todas las ganancias. Adicionalmente vende comida por las noches en las afuera de su casa. Con ambos negocios y las ganancias de los mismos están sosteniendo a la familia y pagando los gastos educativos de sus hijos. Es la primera vez que Nancy recurre a MFP en busca de un crédito, comprometiéndose a pagar de manera puntual, la cantidad que está solicitando es para el mantenimiento de su motocarro, y también para la construcción de un kiosco para su negocio de venta de comida.
texts.en:
Nancy is 35 years old and the mother of three children who support her a great deal. She has a partner who she loves, and who always encourages her to continue working toward her goals. This couple dedicates themselves to transportation, her husband driving the motocar owned by Nancy throughout the city providing a taxi service. She administers their earnings. Additionally, she sells food in the evenings outside of their house. With both businesses, and earnings from each, they are supporting the family and paying for their children’s educations. This is the first time that Nancy turns to MFP in search of a loan, promising to make her loan payments on time. The amount she is requesting is to maintain the motocar, and also to build a kiosk for her food sales business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain the motocar.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: Carolina es madre soltera, vive con sus dos hijos pequeños en la casa de sus abuelos. Se dedica a vender golosinas en un pequeño kiosco que mandó a construir muy cerca de un colegio, esta labor la viene ejerciendo desde hace 2 años atrás y lo que le gusta es que vende diariamente  y sus principales consumidores son los niños que asisten a ese colegio y los que pasan por allí. Le es muy rentable porque aún en época de vacaciones, la calle donde está ubicada es muy transitada, y definitivamente cuando empiezan las clases (marzo a diciembre) le va mucho mejor. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, esta requiriendo esta cantidad de dinero para comprar mayor cantidad de productos y estar bien surtida para cuando empiecen las clases
texts.en:
Carolina is a single mother who lives in her grandparents’ house with her two young children. She dedicates herself to selling snacks from a small kiosk she had built very close to a school. She has been carrying out this activity for two years and what she enjoys is that she sells on a daily basis. Her primary customers are the children who attend the school and pass near her location. The business is very profitable because, even during the vacation season, the road where she is located is well-traveled. Definitively, when school starts up (March to December), her business does much better. This is her first loan with MFP and the amount she is requesting is to buy products at wholesale so she can be well-stocked when classes start.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise supply.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en la casa de su tía. Desde hace uno año se dedica a la crianza de pollos, implementó corrales en su propia casa para esta actividad, pero a pesar que ha tratado de acomodarlos lo más adecuadamente posible cree que aún necesita más espacio. Lo que le gusta de esta actividad es cada día cuidar de sus pollos con el mayor detalle, alimentándolos correctamente para que obtengan el peso adecuado para venderlos a un buen precio. Este negocio le es rentable porque su producción es rápida y sus ingresos son netos cada 30 días. Es la primera vez que recurre a MFP para un crédito, y se ha comprometido en pagar sus cuotas con puntualidad, el dinero requerido es para la construcción de un galpón para mantener a sus pollos más cómodos, además comprará pollos bebes y alimento balanceado.
texts.en:
Cirila is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two children at her aunt’s house. For the past year, she has dedicated herself to raising chickens, and installed pens at the house for this purpose. Despite the fact that she has tried to better outfit the area, she needs to create more space. What she enjoys about this activity is taking painstaking care of her chickens each day, feeding them properly so they will grow and fetch favorable prices when she sells them. This business is profitable because production is fast, and she nets income every 30 days. This is the first time she turms to MFP for a loan, and she has promised to make her payments on time. The funds she requires are for the construction of a shed where she can keep her chickens more comfortably. In addition, she would like to buy baby chicks as well as balanced feed for the animals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a shed for her chickens.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel tiene 49 años, vive con su pareja con la que tiene 4 hijos, felizmente en todos estos años pudieron adquirir una casa propia que es donde viven. Él es un hombre muy activo, tiene un negocio de venta de abarrotes y golosinas en las afueras de su casa desde hace 4 años, el coloca sobre unas mesas sus producto y otros los cuelga donde pueda atraer miradas del público, empezó así porque notó la necesidad de este tipo de negocio en su zona. Además de atender durante todo el día, Miguel sale por las noches a vender golosinas y cigarros de forma ambulante. Lo que le gusta de este trabajo es que le produce buenos ingresos, es por eso que trabaja duro, ya que él dice que “las ganancias no caen del cielo y hay que esforzarse por ellas”, es por eso que no contento con trabajar todo el día, también utiliza algunas horas de la noche para seguir vendiendo sus productos. Debido a su deseo de seguir progresando, supo de los créditos de MFP, por lo que ahora está participando de su primer préstamo junto a las personas de su banco comunal, la cantidad que Miguel solicita es para construir un kiosco donde pueda colocar mejor sus productos y protegerlos del sol y de la lluvia.
texts.en:
Miguel is 49 years old and lives with his partner, which whom he has four children. Happily, over all these years, they were able to acquire their own home that they now live in. He is a very active man who, for the past four years, has had a business selling groceries and sweets/snacks just outside his house. He displays some of his merchandise on tables, while hanging other items up in order to attract the public’s attention. He started out in this endeavor after noticing that this type of business was needed in his area. In addition to tending to his store all day, Miguel goes out at night to sell snacks and cigars on the streets. What he enjoys about his work is that it generates a good income. This is why he works hard since, as he says, “money doesn’t fall from the sky and one must make an effort to earn it”. This is why he isn’t content to just work during the day, but also spends some hours in the evenings to continue selling his products. As a result of his desire to continue to advance, he knew about the MFP loans and is now participating in his first loan along with other members of his cooperative bank. The amount Miguel is requesting is to build a kiosk where he may better display his products, and to protect them from the sun and rain.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kiosk for his business.

loans.name: Marililiana

texts.es: Marililiana tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con sus 2 hijos, sus hermanos y sus padres, en la casa de estos últimos. La venta de bebidas heladas y dar una buena atención a sus clientes es su rutina diaria, debido a que se encuentra ubicada en un lugar apropiado dentro de su zona, se siente feliz porque concurre mucha gente de varios lugares a su negocio. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 2 años y todo este tiempo le ha sido rentable porque debido al calor de la zona de selva, que es donde ella vive, todos los días las personas están en busca de bebidas heladas, ya sean cervezas o gaseosas. Este es el primer crédito que tiene Marililiana con MFP, y la cantidad que está solicitando es para la compra de mayor cantidad de cervezas,  y de mesas y sillas para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marililiana is 28 years old, a single mother of two children, and lives with her parents and brothers in their house. Her daily routine involves selling cold drinks and providing good service to her customers, given that she is well-located within her zone. She feels content because many people visit her place of business. She has been conducting this activity for two years and, over this period of time, it has been profitable because of the heat of the jungle zone where she lives. Each day, customers arrive looking for cold drinks – both beer and soda. This is Marililiana’s first loan with MFP and the amount she is requesting is for the purchase of a greater quantity of beers, as well as chairs and tables to better accommodate her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase drinks and furniture for her business.

loans.name: Teat

texts.en:
Teat V., 52, works as farmer and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 1990, she has owned a plot of land on which she grows rice for a living and is able to make US$2 per day. Her husband, Rot Him, 56, pictured here, runs a business recharging batteries and normally makes US$8 per day. The has five children, of which two are employed and two are students.

Teat V. told a loan officer that she spends US$40 on food and US$15 on her children’s education every month. In her village, people depend heavily on batteries to power their lights, TV, radio and other appliances, so the battery-recharging business is a profitable one. Teat V. is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase charging tools, a generator and a motorbike to help her husband in this business activity.

loans.use: To purchase charging tools, generator and a motorbike.

loans.name: Vith

texts.en:
Mrs. M. has been selling vegetables since early 2008. She currently sells vegetables in Takmao Market, and can make an average of $5 per day. She is 48 years old and a widow. She is the mother of five children; two of them are single and the other three are married. Her single son's name is Mr. Klem Hem, aged 29, and earns a living by repairing motorcycles. He can earn the amount of $4 a day to help feed his family.

In the past, M. hired a store to sell vegetables. She hopes to own a store; thus, she is asking for a loan as capital to buy a store at the market for selling vegetables. M. currently lives in Kandal Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a store

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
A resident of Kandal Province, Cambodia, Mrs. C. is 47 years old. She currently makes a living selling fish in the market area. As another income, she raises pigs in a stall next to her house.

She is married and has eight children; four of them are single and the others are married. To help meet a little more of their family's food expenses, four of her children are employed as garment workers. Her husband Mr. Horng Heun, aged 48, is in the Cambodia Military, as well as being a domestic land trader.

C.'s business is going well, and in order to make the business more successful, she has applied for a loan of $600 to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Uk

texts.en:
S. was born in 1960 and is a widow. She currently lives with two children in Kandal Province of Cambodia. Both of her children are single; one of her single sons' name is Moeung Sok, who is employed as an accountant supervisor for a company.

She works as a staff member of MARISTOP Organization, and currently gets a salary of $200 per month. S. needs a $1200 loan to buy a motorcycle to use for riding to work, and the remainder of the loan will be used to decorate her house.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for riding to work

loans.name: Asomidin

texts.en:
Vegetable sales are a flourishing business in Tajikistan for the simple reason that every home needs vegetables. S. Asomidin has been selling vegetables in Dushanbe Central market for the past 2 years. He began his own stall with his hard-earned savings as he had always wanted to be an entrepreneur. Asomidin began selling vegetables at the market with very little stock to offer his clients. Slowly he began to increase the goods offered until he managed to get a permanent market stall. Currently his stall is his pride and joy with a zinc roof and ceramic tiles on the floor. Asomidin is a father of two children who are in school. Like any father, he is doing his best in order to ensure his children the best future and to make them well educated. Now he needs a loan for a size of 4000 Somoni in order to increase the stock of his selling goods. He promises to repay the loan within 9 months and expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing of the range of vegetables

loans.name: Mavdjigul

texts.en:
N. Mavdjigul is 51 years old. She is married and the loving mother of 6 children. Mavdjigul owns a successful clothing sales business at the market of Dushanbe, Tajikistan. She has been doing this business for about 8 years. Her business has benefited from a good sales location and constant demand for her products. Mavdjigul tries to offer good prices to her customers while still making a profit. A normal monthly income from her business is around 1000 Somoni. Mavdjigul has requested a loan of 3000 Somoni with the term of 6 months to increase her product inventory. By purchasing additional inventory, Mavdjigul will be better prepared to meet increased demand and earn a good income. We believe her perseverance and natural liveliness will help her continue to succeed in her trade and repay this loan on time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: Increasing working capital

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
Mrs. S. is 29 years old and her husband, Mr. Teun Cheunis, is 30 years old. They both currently live in Kandal Province, where they make a living as garment workers for a garment factory. The couple is responsible for one lively child who is a minor and is enrolled in school.

To earn extra income, S. and her husband hope to have a suitable investment to invest in. In order to make that possible, they would like to ask for a loan of $800 from HKL. They will use the loan to purchase rice to store and then re-sell for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase rice to store and then re-sell for a profit

loans.name: Savdagul

texts.en:
Savdagul is a hard-working entrepreneur from Dushanbe, the capital of Tajikistan. She and her husband have four children. She runs a business where she sells kids' clothing and women's underwear. Savdagul started her business 28 years ago and has run it with both extreme care and seriousness. Her daughters help Savdagul with her business. It is an important source of income for her family of six, considering that her husband does not earn enough money. Savdagul has requested a loan of 2500 Somoni so that she can purchase additional inventory of winter clothing for kids and to continue developing her business. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to grow her business further and help feed her family.

loans.use: Purchase winter clothing for kids.

loans.name: Mohammad Asgher

texts.en:
Mohammad Asgher is the son of G. B. and lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has eight children. He is a farmer who is very interested in agriculture. Every day he wakes up early in the morning and begins to work his land.

He wants to take out an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for a term of 12 months to buy more and different kinds of seeds to plant. He would like to be a really successful farmer in the future.

loans.use: To buy more seeds

loans.name: Mahfuza

texts.en:
Mahfuza is married with two children. This is an average family from Dushanbe, Tajikistan. However, Mahfuza is a unique entrepreneur. She has been selling kids' clothing in the central city market for about 2 years, running her own small venture successfully. The secret of her success is simple: she tries to not only let her customers know the benefits of her products – she also gives them a sense of relationship which brings them back again and again. However, she doesn’t want to stop where she is at with her venture.

Mahfuza is seeking a loan of 3400 Somoni to re-stock the merchandise in her store for the winter season. We believe that Mahfuza’s desire to excel in pleasing her customers will determine her further success and encourage new customers to buy from her.

loans.use: Purchasing  winter clothing for kids

loans.name: Ni Ketut Suci

texts.id: Ni Ketut Suci  merasa sangat senang sekali karena sudah bisa menyelesaikan pinjamannya yang pertama. Ni Ketut Suci bermaksud untuk melanjutkan pinjamanya yang ke dua yang nantinya juga dipergunakan untuk menambah modal usahanya. Dari pinjaman yang pertama sangatlah nampak bahwa dengan tambahan pinjaman modal tersebut Ni Ketut Suci  bisa meningkatkan keuntungan yang di perolehnya Sehingga dengan pengalaman ini Ni  Ketut Suci bermaksud untuk melanjutkan pinjaman periode ke dua dengan jangka waktu 12 bulan dengan pembayaran dilunasi pada akhir periode pinjaman. Dengan tambahan keuntungan yang diperoleh Ni Ketut Suci bisa menambah penghasilan keluarganya yang dipergunakan untuk pendidikan anak anak mereka.
texts.en:
Ni Ketut Suci is happy because she has successfully paid back her first loan. Ni ketut Suci now intends to apply for second loan to increase her working capital. The first loan helped her increase earnings from the business which encouraged her to apply for the second loan with 12 month tenor. Hopefully the additional profit from her business can be used to increase Ni ketut Suci's family earnings and pay for her children's tuition.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Normurot

texts.en:
Normurot K. is 45 years old and was born in Rudaki, Tajikistan. He is the father of five children, and his main work consists of breeding cattle. This very remunerative activity enables him to provide for the needs of his family. An ambitious man, he would like to buy a greater number of cattle and to build a barn to house them in order to ensure their safety. Due to a lack of finances, he is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni for the realization of this project. He promises to repay the loan in 12 months. When his dream is carried out, he will be able to have a greater source of revenue for his growing family. With your help this will be possible.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: Purchasing of the cattle and calves to expand his business

loans.name: Bobomurod

texts.en:
For the past 2 years, Bobomurod has worked in agriculture, raising animals. He raises sheep which he cares for greatly since thanks to them, he can cover his household expenses. Bobomurod showed us his animals with great happiness as his sheep were about to be vaccinated against the various sickness that affect that type of livestock.

For Bobomurod, it is very important to work raising his animals which is why he is currently seeking a loan in order to purchase additional sheep so that in future he can earn more money. That will help his family to generate additional income. We appreciate your support for Bobomurod’s projects.

loans.use: Purchasing sheep to expand his business

loans.name: Shafoat

texts.en:
Shafoat B. is 41 years old. She works purchasing and re-selling cows with her husband. She has 2 children. She would like to request a loan of 1000 USD for the term of 12 months in order to purchase additional cows to increase her inventory and meet customer demands. She believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family.

In the future, she would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business to purchase additional cows and increase their income further. They plan to use the increased income to fund their children’s education. You could become an important part in Shafoat family's life; she deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle and calves for re-sale

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.en:
Shahodat H. is a small entrepreneur from Khujand, Tajikistan. She is married and the loving mother of three children, who are the reason for her daily fight for a better life. Shahodat sells women's traditional dresses and skull-caps in one of the famous local markets called “Panjshanbe”.

Shahodat is a very hard-working woman. She always achieves all her goals and overcomes different challenges with natural optimism. She is requesting a loan of 1000 USD for the term of 12 months to re-stock her inventory. She is hoping to purchase more merchandise at affordable wholesale prices for further retail sale. The only dream of Shahodat is to ensure her children of a good education and to make them happy. We believe Shahodat’s integrity and the consistent growth of her venture in the past years can guarantee further stable expansion of her venture and timely loan repayment.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: Purchasing women's traditional dresses and skull-caps to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Ahmad Zaki

texts.en:
Ahmad Zaki is the son of A. M. and lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has two children. He is a hard-working man who is confident that he can work well.

He has a shop in which he sells car parts and oil for cars. He wants to take out an individual loan of 30000 Afghani for a term of 12 months to purchase additional materials to expand his business. He hopes to be a good businessman in the future to support the family and his society. He is very happy about this loan program.

loans.use: To expand his car business

loans.name: Oliver Sendiwanyo  ‘S Group

texts.en:
Oliver is the leader of a five member group. She is 40 years old and married with five children, who are between five and twenty. All her children go to school. She takes care of no additional family members. She resides in a rented three-roomed house in which eight people stay. They have electricity but no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Oliver works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She operates a retail shop at her home in Mengo Mackay, which is one of the city suburbs. She works seven days a week and uses public transport to and from shopping. She sells to an average of 20 customers a day and to all categories of people.

She is faced with the challenge of transportation during the rainy season and defaulting her would-be customers. Oliver has been in this business for the last seven years and has been in MCDT for two years, now servicing her tenth loan and working all along with the same group mates. Oliver’s monthly expenses include school fees, feeding her family, and paying rent for the home. She wants to use this loan to buy a refrigerator to sell cold drinks.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Ashur

texts.en:
Ashur B. is a loving and self-sacrificing father. Ever since he was very young, Ashur has been around people raising animals, and thanks to this knowledge, he dedicates himself to raising and selling cattle, work that he learned from his humble parents. With experience gained over time in the purchase and sale of cattle, he has been able to bring stability to his family.

The desire that Ashur harbors in his heart is that of increasing his capital to invest in acquiring more animals. In this way, he can create more income for his family. Above all, he hopes to offer a better quality of life for his beloved children, who always support him unconditionally in his daily work. He requests 1000 USD for the term of 10 months. Let’s get together behind the request of this devoted father to help him keep bringing well-being and security to the members of his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing  cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Mrs. K. owns a medium beauty salon to provide her service as a hairdresser. She is 29 years old and is also a good mother who cares for one young child. She married to Choun Ny, 31, who is a local construction supervisor. The family lives in Kandal Province, Cambodia.

K. currently runs her investment very well; a lot of customers recognize the good service she provides because she has been skilled in hairdressing for a long time. In order to meet her customers' requirements, K. is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase more hairdressing materials and a generator to make electricity to supply power for her investment.

loans.use: To purchase more hairdressing materials and a generator

loans.name: Shamsiniso

texts.en:
Shamsiniso D. is 20 years old. She is not married and is living with her parents. She is a well-known seamstress in her community, seeing that she has been working there for more than 4 years. Shamsiniso decided to take advantage of her reputation and bought a tailoring machine and since then she is providing the service of a tailor.

The entrepreneur says that she has now a well-established clientele, the majority of whom are young girls who often order traditional dresses. In this way, she constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow. Now she is requesting a loan of 700 USD for a term of 6 months for purchasing new modern fabrics for sewing traditional dresses. You can help improve the quality of life of her family. Shamsiniso and her family are grateful for your generosity and support.

loans.use: Purchasing new modern fabrics

loans.name: Maksudjon

texts.en:
I. Maksudjon has dedicated much effort to the business of agriculture for the past ten years. He has 0.8 of a hectare of land where he produces a variety of vegetables and a number of apricot trees. He also plants wheat and gets a rich harvest every year.The income from his land has allowed him to arrange the weddings of his two children. Currently Maksudjon is asking for a loan of $725 USD to purchase fertilizer, fuels and lubricants to prepare his land for the upcoming season. Maksudjon is very confident that he will be awarded this loan and assures you that the money will be repaid on time, without default.
