loans.use: Purchasing fuels, lubricants, mineral fertilizer and saplings

loans.name: Shall

texts.en:
Shall M. is an educated man. He has an Ag process land where he works. He has been working in agriculture for a long time and has a good number of customers.

Shall M. used his first loan to expand his stock, which enabled him to continue his business with more success. He is still working to improve his business. Now he has requested a second loan to further enlarge his business and involve one of his sons in the business. He wants to work hard to make a better future for all his family and is sure the loan will enable him to make his business more successful.

loans.use: To buy animals and seeds for his land

loans.name: Mary Namwanje   ‘S Group

texts.en:
Mary is the leader of a four member group. She is 31 years old and married with 4 children, between 6 and 12 years old. All her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She resides in a rented one-room house in which two people stay. They have electricity and piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day. She works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala.

Mary sells second-hand clothes in the Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala. She works six days a week and rents her business premises for 80,000 per month. She sells to an average of 20 customers a day and sells to all categories of people. Before resorting to selling clothing she first sold vegetables but because they were perishable she changed to clothing. Mary sells both retail and wholesale. She has been in this business for the last ten years and has been in MCDT for five years, now servicing her tenth loan and working all along with the same groupmates. Mary‘s monthly expenses include rent, food, and school fees. She wants to use this loan to buy more clothes and aspires to own a permanent shop.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Abdul Khalil

texts.en:
A. Khalil is the son of A. R. and lives in district 16 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has two children. The whole family, including his father and mother, benefit from the income he generates through his catering business. 

He would like to apply for an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for a term of 12 months to buy more supplies for his shop. By expanding his business, he hopes to support his family in the best way possible.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his catering business

loans.name: Maria Nakiganda  ‘S Group

texts.en:
Maria is the leader of a five member group. She is 41 years old and married with 2 children, aged 20 and 22. Her children don’t go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She resides in a rented two-roomed house in which four people stay. They have electricity and piped water at home and the family gets two meals a day. She works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala.

Maria owns a pub in Ndeeba and sells beer, soda, water, and other liquors in one of the markets in the Kampala suburbs. She works seven days a week and rents her business premises at 100,000 per month. She sells to an average of 20 customers a day and to all categories of people. She sells both retail and wholesale and has been in this business for the last five years. She has also been in MCDT for five years and is now servicing her tenth loan working all along with the same groupmates. Maria’s monthly expenses include rent and food. She wants to to use this to buy more crates of beers and sodas and aspires to build a house in the plot she bought using previous loans.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda and beer to sell.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
M. Muhabbat is a very responsible and hard working woman. She is married and has 3 adorable children. Fifteen years ago Muhabbat decided to start her own business. She was working in a garment factory near her home and knew a lot about making clothing, so with some savings she opened a small seamstress shop in her house, helping her husband support the family. In time, she gained customers and a good reputation for her work. Initially she had only one sewing machine. She has expanded her business and now has three sewing machines and three workers. On average she sews 3 to 4 dresses per day. She is asking for a loan of 3400 Somoni (1000 USD) that will be invested in buying a computer-based sewing machine to make the quality of her dresses at a high level. She commits herself to return the amount in 10 months. Help this family improve the quality of their life by contributing to the growth of Muhabbat’s business. They will sincerely thank you for your generosity. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. loans.use: Purchasing a computer-based sewing machine.

loans.name: Muminakhon

texts.en:
M. Muminakhon is 41 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is married and the loving mother of two children. Her father's hard and demanding character showed her, from the time she was a little girl, the significant value of work, and therefore she has been successful in various activities throughout her life. Now she dedicates herself to raising and selling cattle. With the income she generates she provides a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy and have become her best friends. She is asking for a US$700 loan with the term of 5 months in order to buy more young cattle to later sell when they are fully grown. With this investment she will be able to substantially increase her earnings and improve her quality of life. Let’s support this dedicated mother's proposal.
