loans.use: Purchase spare parts to repair his taxi

loans.name: Jamilya

texts.ru: Турдиева Джамиля проживает в городе Турсун-Заде. Работает в городской поликлинике-медсестрой. Возраст 39 лет, разведена и имеет двоих детей. Имеет участок земли . где сеет пшеницу. Для этого вида деятельности и запрашивает кредит, который нужен для покупки семян. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Jamilya T. lives in Tursunzade. She is 39 years old, divorced and has two children. She is a nurse at a municipal polyclinic, and she owns a plot of land where she grows wheat. She would like to get a loan for buying seeds. She plans to pay it off within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to puchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Babirye Sumayiya's Group

texts.en:
Sumayiya is the leader of a five member group. She is 35 years old and married with four children, who are between the ages of 2 and 12. Two of her children go to school. She also takes care of her old parents. She resides in a rented three-roomed house in which eight people stay. They have electricity but no piped water at home. The family gets two meals a day.

Sumayiya works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She sells charcoal from her home in Mengo Mackay, which is one of the city suburbs. She works seven days a week and doesn’t have any transport costs. She sells to an average of 20 customers a day and to all categories of people. She is faced with the challenge of the rainy season and defaulting of her would-be customers.

Sumayiya has been in this business for the last seven years and in MCDT for one and half years. She is servicing her second loan, working all along with the same groupmates. Sumayiya‘s monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family. She wants to use this loan to buy a more sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ayubboy

texts.en:
S. Ayubboy is 47 years old, married and has five children. He sells cattle. He purchases young cattle at the central market, feeds them and then resells them at higher prices at the local market. He has been in the business for fourteen years and knows very well how to choose the animals, how to breed them and how to look after them. He rises early each day to feed and look after his animals. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business a success and it generates a considerably good and stable income for his large, supportive family. Because he knows that today the prices for the animals are favorable, but will certainly increase, Ayubboy is planning to enlarge his herd and purchase more cattle. For this purpose, he has requested a loan of $875 US for a term of six months. You could become an important part in Ayubboy's family's life. He deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was a key post along the Silk Road and where the rule of Alexander the Great ended. loans.use: Purchase more cattle to expand business.

loans.name: Olateju

texts.en: Olateju A. is 42 years old and married with 3 children. She sells women's and men's shoes. She has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more shoes to sell. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Longole-Aisha Deya Group

texts.en:
Aisha D. (right) is 45 years old. She is a married mother of 5 children of whom one is working and the rest are still in school. Aisha has been running a restaurant for 3 years now. Her menu comprises of local dishes and delicacies. 

She needs a loan to enable her to stock foods like grains and cereals which have a long shelf life. Her dream is to open up a handcrafts workshop. She hopes that the income from the business enables her to support her husband in educating the children.

This is a group loan, where each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: To purchase grains and cereals.

loans.name: Ariyo

texts.en: Ariyo O. is 33 years old and married with 2 children. He lives in Ibadan, Nigeria. He sells motor spare parts, something he has done for a long time. He needs a loan to purchase more motor spare parts to sell. He says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more motor spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Nazirqul

texts.ru: Каршиев Нарзикул проживает в городе Турсун-Заде. Возраст 43 года. Работает главным бухгалтером в городской поликлинике. Женат и имеет шестерых детей. Как и многие жители сельской местности он занимается сельским хозяйством. Имеет участок земли  который засеивает пшеницей. Поэтому обратился к нам для того, чтобы закупить семена пшеницы , а так же удобрений. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nazirqul K. lives in Tursunzade. He is 43 years olf. He is Chief Accountant at the municipal polyclinic. Nazirqul is married and has six children. Like many other rural residents, he is involved in agriculture. Nazirqul has a plot of land where he grows wheat. He is applying for a loan so that he can buy wheat seeds and fetilizers. He would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to puchase wheat seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ugiloy

texts.en:
B. Ugiloy is 39 years old, married and the loving mother of four children. She is a vendor and for the last thirteen years has been selling cottonseed oil at the local market. In the traditional Tajik cuisine the majority of meals are fried or cooked using cottonseed oil. Our national dish “Oshi palov” especially uses a great deal of cottonseed oil to make it delicious. So the goods that Uguloy sells are in great demand by the population. Today she is planning to increase her business and for this reason she has requested a loan of 3000 Somoni for the term of twelve months. The loan will be used to purchase more cottonseed oil in order to increase her inventory. Ugiloy is counting on your help and thanks you for your support. loans.use: To purchase more cottonseed oil in order to increase her inventory

loans.name: Yulduz

texts.en:
M. Yulduz is 45 years old. She is a widow and the loving mother of two children. Since her husband passed away she has served as both father and mother for her children and has been their sole provider, thanks to her perseverance and dedication toward her work. She sells clothing for men and, little by little, the business has progressed and given Yulduz favorable results.  It has filled her with satisfaction and joy. Her hard work has helped improve the quality of life for her family. Of course Yulduz wants to keep prospering along with her business and keep advancing the family, helping her beloved children enter University. To help her carry out her goals, Yulduz is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni, for the term of 12 months, to purchase more articles for her business to sell so she can increase her income. This exemplary and courageous mother waits for your kind support and good hearts to help move her and her family ahead.

loans.use: To purchase new childrens' clothing to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Hidoyatullo

texts.ru: Гулямхусейнов Хидоятулло житель города Турсун-заде. Возраст 47 лет. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Работает таксистом. Имеет свою автомашину , которую и использует в своей работе. Кроме этого  он занимается бизнесом. Торгует овощами и фруктами. Скупает рано утром у дехкан свежие фрукты и овощи , а затем продает розничным торговцам. Для того , чтобы расширять свой бизнес хочет получить кредит сроком на 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Hidoyatullo G. lives in Tursunzade. He is 47 years old, married and has 4 children. He works as a taxi driver, and he uses his personal vehicle to drive clients. In addition, he makes a living selling produce. He buys fresh produce early in the morning from peasants and sells it to retailers. Hidoyatullo would like to get a 10-month loan that would allow expanding his business.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cah flow

loans.name: Malohat

texts.en:
N. Malohat is 31 years old. She is married with two children. She started her own business 11 years ago because her husband’s salary was not enough for their family's expenses. Malohat sells confectioneries such as candies, cookies and pastries in the local market.  Her family is living with her husband's parents and the generated income allows Malohat to support her large household. Malohat dreams of her children getting a higher education. 

Today she requests a loan of 3000 Somoni for the term of 12 months. She is going to use the funds to purchase a wider range of confectionery goods.  With the income she plans to buy her own store and educate her children. Malohat thanks everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan on time, as she did with her previous loan.

loans.use: Enlarge the range of goods and with the generated income purchase her own store

loans.name: Ozodakhon

texts.en:
For many years Ozodakhon has been selling fabrics for women’s clothing at the market. She knows her business very well and her fabrics are among the best at the market. By now she has many clients. Ozodakhon is a young mother with one child and her husband works as a taxi driver. She wants to borrow money to purchase more goods to sell, thus increasing her profit, which she will use to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics and expand the business

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.ru: Гулямхусейнов Ибрагим житель города Турсун-Заде. Кассир группы "Хидоят". Возраст 44 года , женат и имеет пятерых детей. Занимается торговлей фруктами и овощами уже 8 лет. Планирует получить кредит и увеличить свой товарооборот. Погасить крелдит планирует в течение 10 месяцев. Ибрагим очень активный и профессиональный бизнесмен , но если он сможет получит кредит , он сможет развивать свой бизнес еще быстрее.
texts.en:
Ibrohim G. lives in the city of Tursun-Zade. He is a cashier for the company Hidoyat. He is 44 years old, married, and has five children. For the past 8 years he has worked selling fruits and vegetables. He decided to take out a loan to increase his sales volume. The loan will be repaid over 10 months. Ibrohim is an energetic and very professional businessman, but if he can obtain a loan he will be able to develop his business even faster.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is a 40-year-old man who is married and has three children. He lives in Al Kousaibi, Southern Lebanon. In 2000, Abbas opened a shop, specializing in electrical equipment and telephones. Now, Abbas would like to borrow $1000 to further diversify his shop's inventory.

loans.use: Buy Inventory

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 44-year-old man who is married and has one child. He lives in Houla, Southern Lebanon. Ali owns a small traditional Lebanese restaurant in his village. He serves his village and all the surrounding villages. Ali is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy a new refrigerator for his restaurant.

loans.use: Buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en: Nidal is a 39-year-old woman, living in Amchit in Mount Lebanon. Nidal used to work from her house, doing sewing, and selling stockings. One year ago, she opened her first shop, where she now has more clientele. Nidal is requesting a loan of $1200 in order to buy more inventory.

loans.use: Buy Inventory

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Баракаева Мухаббат проживает в районе Шахринау. Замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Муж работает таксистом . Кредит понадобился для того, чтобы закупить запчасти для ремонта автомашины мужа. погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Muhabbat B. lives in the Shahrinaw district. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a taxi driver. She needs the loan in order to buy spare parts for repairs to her husband's car. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare auto parts

loans.name: Yatimy

texts.ru: Ятими Бердизод проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 37 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. Образование среднее. Имеет свой бизнес. Привозит из Пакистана калоши .Продает оптом и в розницу жителям своего кишлака. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Yatimy B. lives in the Shahrinaw district. He is 37 years old, married, and has four children. He has a high school education. He has his own business, importing galoshes from Pakistan. He buys wholesale and sells retail to residents of his town. He decided to request a loan in order to increase his sales volume. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales Volume

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael S. M. is a Tanzanian business man. He runs a food shop at Ilalaa district in Dar es Salaam. Shop businesses in Tanzania make up almost seventy percent of the total micro businesses in town. Michael sells a variety of products such as wheat flour, maize flour, beans, groundnuts, cashew nuts, sugar, etc. to customers. The business is three years old. He is requesting a loan to buy more products.

loans.use: To buy more stock.

loans.name: Olim

texts.ru: Алиев Олим житель района Шахринау. Очень молодой , но амбициозный молодой человек. Женат , детей пока нет. работает таксистом , хотя имеет высшее образование. Так как деятельность приносит хорошую прибыль. Тем не менее обратился за кредитом , для того , чтобы на полученные деньги  купить автозапчасти. Это поможет сделать капитальный ремонт и таки образом улучшить качество обслуживания  и привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en:
Olim A. lives in the Shahrinaw district. He is a young but ambitious man. He is married, so far without children. He works as a taxi driver even though he completed university, because that work provides a good income. Still, he is requesting a loan which he will use to buy spare parts. This will help him complete major repairs and in doing so improve the quality of service he offers and attract new customers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua A. is a 44 year old local restaurant operator. She is married and has three children and two of them attend school. Akosua lives at Abuakwa, a suburb of Kumasi in the Ashanti region. She has lived there since she started her local restaurant. Akosua husband is very supportive in providing the basic needs of the family.   

She prepares and sells local foods like fufu, banku and other local dishes. Fufu is prepared by pounded cassava and plantain, and taken with all kinds of soups. Banku is prepared from milled maize grain and it is eaten with hot pepper or soup. With her tasty meals, she has attracted lots of customers in the area she serves. Therefore it has become necessary to employ additional employees to assist her in food delivering service. 

Akosua says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to  meet her operating expenses. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to prepare her meals. She would be grateful for that assistance.
 
Akosua belongs to a village bank called Regina. She hope to receive a loan of GH¢500 to make business expand by increasing her inventory. This would enable her save more to support the husband with taking care of the Children's educational needs.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Issam

texts.en: Issam is a 43-year-old man, living in A. Ghobeiri in the Beirut suburbs. He used to work as a taxi driver but due to health problems, he opened a small grocery store in 2000. Today, Issam wants to borrow US$ 500 in order to buy more inventory and diversify his products.

loans.use: Buy more inventory for his little store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru: Солиева Халима живет в городе Турсун-Заде. Возраст 41 год. Замужем и имеет двоих детей. Образование среднее. Торгует на рынке "Саховат" города Турсун-заде. Опыт работы в данной сфере уже 13 лет. Запрашивает кредит для ввоза нового товара, что поможет увеличить товарооборот , а так же привлечь новых клиентов. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Halima S. lives in the city of Tursun-zade. She is 41 years old, married, and has two children. She completed a high school education. She is a seller at the Sahovat market in Tursun-zade. She has 13 years of experience in this field. She is requesting a loan for import of new goods, which will increase stock turnover and thus attract new customers. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida O. is a 43 year old woman. She is widowed and a mother of three kids. Through hard work Vida has supported the oldest child to the polytechnic, one child in the senior high school and her last born is still in the junior high. Vida resides at Abuakwa with her family. She said she was born there and since then she has not actually traveled apart from the surrounding towns. Her husband died painfully through a prolonged sickness. She was almost in tears when we were talking because she believes he has left so much responsibility on her.

She is a food vendor who sells kenkey in her neighborhood. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch or supper. 

Vida wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise more income to support her youngest children especially in their education. 

She hopes to receive a loan of GH¢600 to expand her business by increasing her inventory. This would enable her save more to support the Children's educational needs.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Fadhil

texts.en: Fadhil I. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. His business is to sell lumber and furniture at Buguruni Ward in Dar es Salaam. Buguruni is a market center for timber from different regions in Tanzania. He purchases wholesale from the wholesale shops and sells retail. Also he is a carpenter; he makes several varieties of furniture which he sells to customers. He needs a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to buy more stock.

loans.use: To buy more lumber

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 24-year-old man, living in Al Chwaifat in Mount Lebanon. Mohammad has owned an electrical equipment maintenance shop in his village for seven years. Mohammad wants to buy more inventory in order to satisfy his clientele's needs and to increase his profits. He is requesting a loan of $1000.

loans.use: Buy Inventory

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Холматов Рустам житель района Рудаки. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Имеет бизнес . Он ездиет в Китай за товаром . Привозит женские халаты. Кроме того занимается животноводством. Разводит крепких бычков для реализации на мясо. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы купить бычка. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rustam H. lives in the Rudaki region. He is married and has four children. He has a business. He travels to buy goods from China. He buys women's robes. Besides that he also does animal husbandry. He breeds strong calves for meat resale. He plans to get a loan to buy another calf. He will pay off the loan within six months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Las Hermanas De Pantoja Group

texts.en:
Oneyra Y. L. is the mother of two and the head of the Bank of Hope called Las Hermanas de Pantoja. She owns her own business selling personal products and plans on using her loan to replenish her supplies and to invest in her business. This will be Oneyra's third loan.

Thank you for your interest in supporting this group!

loans.use: Replenish business supplies and invest for growth

loans.name: Jabiri

texts.en: Jabiri A. runs a shop at Kisiwani at Buguruni Ward in Dar es Salaam. He is a Tanzanian married man with two school-age children. He purchases business items from the wholesale shop at Kariakoo city market and other cereal  products directly from the farmers. Income from the business is used to meet children's school fees and daily family needs. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000 to buy more stock for his business.

loans.use: To buy more stock for his business

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana Boapong is 38 years old and a divorced mother with four children. Three of her children are currently in school. Juliana divorced her husband because she felt he was unfaithful to her.

Juliana sells meat in the local market of Abuakwa to support her family. She buys her type of meat in a large quantity and then roasts it on the fire before selling it in the market. Juliana says roasting gives the meat a very good taste and also preserves it from getting spoiled. She says the demand for her meat is high but she does not have enough capital  to meet these demands. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more meat to enable her to raised enough income to support her children education. She is a member of the loan group called Partners. Members agree to guarantee each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Juliana belongs to a village bank called Regina. She hopes to receive a loan of GH¢500 to expand her business by increasing her inventory. This would enable her to save more to support the Children's educational needs.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of meat.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María es madre soltera, vive con una de sus 3 hijas y sus 2 nietos. La casa donde habitan es propia. Desde hace dos años se dedica a la venta de comida y bebidas, su amabilidad y buena atención han hecho de ella una mujer de negocio, incursionó en esta actividad a razón de separarse del padre de sus hijas, esta mala experiencia la incentivó a superarse por sí sola, por lo que no fue motivo de sufrimiento sino de mejora. María vende diariamente desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 12 del día, le gusta su trabajo porque se siente útil e independiente y porque siempre está buscando innovar, por lo que aprende a preparar nuevos platos. Luego de su separación, lo más difícil para ella fue sacar adelante a sus hijas, sola; tenía que pagar sus gastos de educación, además de sostener el hogar, pero el amor por ellas, la hizo enfrentarse a todo, y ahora está recogiendo los frutos de su esfuerzo ya que le está yendo muy bien en su negocio. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y con la cantidad solicitada mandará a construir un kiosco donde pueda estar más cómoda y atender mejor a sus clientes. Su meta a futuro es tener un restaurante con todos los implementos necesarios.
texts.en:
María is a single mother who lives with one of her three daughters and her two grandchildren. She owns the home she lives in. For the past two years, she has sold food and drinks. Her kindness and good service have made her into a businesswoman. She started her business because she separated from the father of her daughters. This bad experience motivated her to improve her situation: so this became a way not to suffer but rather to grow. María sells daily from 8 A.M. to noon; she enjoys her work because she feels useful and independent. Because she is always looking for new things to do, she is learning to prepare new dishes. The hardest part of separating was raising her daughters alone. She had to pay for their tuition as well as the household expenses, but the love she has for them allowed her to face any and all situations and now she is reaping the fruits of her efforts as her business is doing well. This is her first loan with MFP. She will use the loan to build a kiosk where she can be more comfortable and take better care of her customers. Her goal is to own a restaurant with all the implements needed.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kiosk for her business.

loans.name: Sarela

texts.es: Sarela tiene 24 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus dos hijos y sus hermanos en la casa de sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes pero no en un local, sino que lo lleva y ofrece por los caseríos que están lejos de la ciudad y donde no hay es fácil acceder a estos productos fácilmente, es por eso que Sarela tiene muchos clientes que le solicitan productos constantemente y además ella les cobra un precio justo, sin aprovecharse de la situación como otras personas que suelen vender a precios muy altos. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 8 años, como le gusta conocer nuevos lugares no tiene problema de trasladarse todo el tiempo de una zona a otra. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y con la cantidad que está solicitando quiere comprar más abarrotes, y también mandar a construir un pequeño local que le sirva de almacén de sus productos para no tenerlos todos en su casa.
texts.en:
Sarela is 24 years old. She is a single mother living with her two children and her brothers in her parents' home. She sells groceries but not from a fixed location, rather she travels to sell them to farmhouses which are far from the city and which do not have easy access to these products. Because of this Sarela has many customers who constantly ask her for products. In addition, she sells at a fair price without taking advantage of the situation, which others do who sell at inflated prices. She has had this business for eight years. As she likes going to new places, she has no problem travelling from one area to another. This is her first loan with MFP: she will use the loan to buy more groceries and arrange for a something small to be built which she will use as a warehouse so that her goods are not all in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 33 años, es madre soltera de dos hijos; Junior de 10 y Erlin de 8, con quienes vive en su casa propia. Se dedica a la elaboración de prendas en su pequeña sastrería desde hace 13 años, a ella siempre le ha gustado el oficio de corte y confección y es por eso que se dedica a realizar este trabajo en el cual se siente muy bien, ya que decide sus horarios y se exige ella misma para acabar las prendas que le solicitan. La confección de ropa es un trabajo que requiere de mucho esfuerzo para un buen acabado final, muchas veces Julia se llega a cortar o a punzar con las agujas y alfileres, siendo esto las dificultades en su trabajo, a lo que ella ya se acostumbró sabiéndolo sobrellevar pensando que son los gajes del oficio. Julia se encuentra en su octavo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, demostrando en este tiempo, casi 4 años con MFP, ser muy responsable y puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de tela para confeccionar más prendas y así aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Julia is 33 years old and is a single mother with two children: Junior, 10 and Erlin, 8. She lives with her children in the home that she owns. She works making clothes in her small tailoring shop and has done so for the past 13 years. She has always liked designing and making clothes and that’s why she has this job. She really likes it because she decides her schedule and she challenges herself to finish the clothing [her customers] order. Making clothes is a job that requires a lot of effort in order to have a good finished product. The difficult part of her job are the many times Julia has cut or jabbed herself with needles and pins. But she has learned how to deal with this and knows it is just one of the risks of being a seamstress. This is Julia’s eighth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and in her 4 years with MFP she has always been very responsible and on-time with her payments. With this loan money she will buy more material and fabric to make more clothing and increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric for making clothes

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en: Bakari S. M. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. He runs a clothing shop at Kigamboni Tanzanian Island in Dar es Salaam. He purchases business commodities from the wholesale shops in Kariakoo and Karume city market. He is requesting a loan of T.shs 800,000 to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for his shop

loans.name: Hicham

texts.en: Hisham is a 44-year-old man who is married and has four children. He lives in Al Ghazieh, Southern Lebanon. He owns a small shop where he sells and fixes curtains and decorations. Using the money from his last micro-loan, Hisham started working in the field of home decoration. Today, he wants to borrow $1200 in order to increase his inventory.

loans.use: Buy Inventory

loans.name: Damiana

texts.es: Damiana tiene 38 años, vive con sus hermanos en la casa que le dejaron sus padres. Se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos, negocio en el cual trabaja con sus hermanos desde hace ya 13 años, este trabajo le permite subsistir y poder salir adelante en busca de un futuro mejor. Lo que le gusta a Damiana de su trabajo es que puede trabajar al lado de su familia y todos juntos poder salir adelante. La venta es buena, ya que tienen mucha producción de ladrillos, los cuales llevan en camionadas a la cuidad de Juliaca y alrededores, para su posterior venta, la cual cada vez es mejor. Damiana se encuentra en su octavo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero que está solicitando comprará material para elaborar más ladrillos y también pagará la reparación de del camión con el que transporta su producción.
texts.en:
Damiana is 38 years old and lives with her siblings in the home their parents left to them. She works as a brick-maker and has done so, along with her siblings, for the past 13 years. Her job supports her and helps her get ahead in life and search for a better future. What Damiana likes most about her job is that she can work side-by-side with her family and they can all get ahead together. Sales are good since they are producing a lot of bricks. They take the bricks by truck into the city of Juliaca and the surrounding areas in order to sell them later. Each time, sales are better than before. This is Damiana’s eighth loan with Microfinanazas Prisma and she is always on time with her payments. With this loan she will buy material for more brick-making and she will also pay for repairs for the truck that transports her bricks.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making bricks

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa K. is a 43 year old local restaurant operator. She is married and has five children. Three of them attend school while the remaining two are learning a trade in glazing work. Yaa lives at Abuakwa, a suburb of Kumasi in the Ashanti region. She has lived there since she started her local restaurant. Yaa's husband is very supportive and provides the basic needs of the family.   

She prepares and sells local foods like fufu, banku and other local dishes. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, and is eaten with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. With her tasty meals she has attracted many customers in the area where she serves. Therefore it has become necessary to employ additional hands to assist her in food delivering service. That was when we visited her at her local restaurant. 

Yaa says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the assistnce of a loan to enable her meet her production expenses. With the loan, she wants to purchase more supplies like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to prepare her meals. She would be grateful for that assistance. Yaa belongs to a village bank called Charity. She hopes to receive a loan of GH¢450 to make business expand by restocking her inventory. This would enable her  to save more to support the husband in taking care of the Children 's educational needs.

loans.use: To buy supplies like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 27 años, es natural de la ciudad de Juliaca, vive sola en casa de unos familiares. Se dedica a la venta de comida en su pequeño restaurante, el cual puso en base a mucho esfuerzo y dedicación hace 6 años y felizmente le arroja buenos resultados, ya que los ingresos cada vez son mejores, gracias a los clientes que cada vez prefieren su sazón. Lo que le gusta a Vilma de su trabajo es la cocina, siempre le ha gustado la preparación de ricos platos los cuales son el deleite de sus clientes, lo complicado muchas veces es el abastecerse para cocinar para tantas personas, para lo cual a veces no se da abasto. Vilma al hacer crecer su negocio decidió obtener un préstamo de Microfinanzas Prisma para lograr expandirlo y desde entonces le ha ido muy bien, este es su cuarto préstamo en esta entidad y es muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero que solicita quiere comprar algunas mesas, ollas, y otros utensilios para mejorar la atención y si es posible contratar a un asistente de cocina que le ayude a abastecerse para toda su clientela.
texts.en:
Vilma is 27 years old and is from the city of Juliaca. She lives alone in the home of one of her relatives. She works selling food in her small restaurant, which she started with a lot of effort and dedication 6 years ago. Happily, she has had good results and her earnings continue to grow, thanks to her customers that choose her seasonings. What Vilma likes most about her job is cooking; she has always liked preparing delicious dishes, much to the pleasure of her customers. The complicated part of her job is gearing herself up to cook for so many people, sometimes she doesn’t have the energy. Vilma decided to apply for a loan with Microfinanzas Prisma in order to help her business grow and expand. Since then, things have gone very well for her and she is now in her fourth loan with this organization. She is always on-time with her payments. With the money she is asking for she wants to buy some tables, cooking pots and other utensils in order to improve her service. Also, if possible she would like to hire a cook’s assistant to help her feed all of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables and food for her restaurant

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is 36 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Ibadan, Nigeria. She sells electronics and phone accessories. She hopes to expand her business. She needs the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more electronics and phone accessories to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics and phone accessories to sell

loans.name: José

texts.es: José es un hombre muy trabajador que ha vivido muchas experiencias en su vida, a sus 58 años vive solo en su casa propia, ya que se divorció y no tuvo hijos. Se dedica a dar servicio de transporte desde hace 20 años, al terminar sus estudios secundarios le fue imposible continuar con una carrera profesional, pero José no se lamenta y está muy orgulloso de ser taxista, ya que es un trabajo donde puede ser libre y además hacer buenos amigos debido a que es muy carismático, siempre tiene una sonrisa y logra sacarle unas a las personas que suben a su taxi. Felizmente para José el negocio es bueno y le permite vivir cómodamente, y es por eso que ha pensado en mejorarlo. Es así que al enterarse de los créditos de Microfinanzas Prisma no dudo en sacar un préstamo encontrándose ya en su cuarto préstamo, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero que piensa obtener en esta oportunidad quiere refaccionar y mejorar su taxi, al cual le dará un buen mantenimiento para brindar un mejor servicio y lograr mayores clientes en un día.
texts.en:
José is a very hard-working man who has experienced a great deal throughout his life. At 58 years of age, he lives alone as he is divorced and never had children. For the past 20 years, he has dedicated himself to providing transportation services. After completing his secondary school education, he found it impossible to continue on and pursue a professional career. Regardless, José is not regretful and is instead very proud of being a taxi driver. It is work where he can be free and make good friends, seeing as he is very charismatic. He always has a smile at the ready, and manages to bring out the same from those who ride in his taxi. Happily for José, business is good. It allows him to live comfortably, and his desire to improve it is how he found out about the loans of Microfinanzas Prisma; he had no doubts about taking out his first loan. He is now in his fourth loan, and has always made his payments in a timely manner. With these funds, he is thinking about refurbishing and improving his taxi. He will maintain it well so he can provide a superb service and attract more customers per day.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make repairs to his taxi.

loans.name: Jubril

texts.en:
Jubril A. is 44 years old and married with a child. He lives in Ibadan, Nigeria. Jubril prints and publishes books. He hopes to expand his business and needs a loan in the amount of 50,000 naira (USD$350) to purchase more printing materials.

Jubril says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more printing materials.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.es: Jeanette tiene 38 años, vive soL. ya que es soltera, habita en L. casa que le dejaron sus padres, donD. puso su tienda D. abarrotes. Trabaja usualmente desD. muy temprano para lograr buenos ingresos, comenzando desD. las 6 D. L. mañana y cerrando a las 9 o 10 D. L. noche, elL. es conciente que si trabaja más logrará mayores ingresos económicos, es por eso que trata D. esforzarse al máximo para tener éxito en las ventas. A Jeanette le gusta mucho su trabajo y es por eso que le pone tanto empeño, pero en algunos casos se siente muy agotada, y esa es L. parte fea D. su trabajo, pero sobrellevando este inconveniente elL. sabe que toda ganancia requiere su sacrificio. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, y se ha comprometido a ser puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero que se le facilite en este crédito implementará mejor su tienda para tener más variedad D. productos y lograr mejores ventas.
texts.en:
Jeannette is 38 years old, is single and lives alone. She resides in a house she inherited from her parents where she has installed a grocery store. She usually works from very early in the morning to generate income, starting at 6 am and closing at 9 or 10 pm in the evening. She is conscious of the fact that, the harder she exerts herself, the more earnings she will have. This is why she works her hardest for successful sales. Jeanette enjoys her work greatly, which is why she puts forth such effort. However, in some instances, she feels exhausted which is an unappealing aspect of her work. Overcoming this obstacle, she knows that all gains require a sacrifice. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has committed to being timely with her payments. She will use her loan to set up her store better, to have a greater variety of products and generate increased sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina A. G. is a 31 year old woman. She is married and a mother of four children. Regina says all her kids are in school. She resides at Abuakwa with her family. She was born there and has not actually traveled anywhere apart from the immediate towns around where she buys her raw materials. Her husband is very supportive in taking care of the children, but the unfortunately, he does not have a permanent job.

Regina is a food vendor who sells kenkey in her neighborhood. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers, as many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch or supper. In addition, she wants to add the sale of soft drinks to her business as it is frequently demanded by her customers. 

Regina wants to use the loan to buy more supplies like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, firewood and bottles of soft drinks.  She hopes to raise more income to support her children especially with their education. Regina belongs to a village bank called ‘Regina’. She would like to make a loan for GH¢500 to expand her business by restocking her inventory. This would enable her save more to support her husband in taking care of the children's educational needs.

loans.use: To buy more supplies like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables,firewood and soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
Adrian se dedica a la joyería, es una persona de la tercera edad, su esposa se dedica  a  labores de casa y todos sus hijos ya son casados e independientes.
Vive en la zona de Villa Nueva Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz, en casa propia.
El crédito será destinado para la refacción de su vivienda y mejorar sus condiciones de vida
Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en el pago se sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Adrian makes jewelery and is a senior citizen. His wife takes care of the house and his children are all married and independent. He lives in the Villa Nueva Potosí zone of La Paz city, in his own house. This loan will be used to renovate his house and improve his living conditions. It is his 5th loan from Impro. His repayment history qualifies him as a good, responsible borrower.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home renovation

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda vive en su casa propia con sus dos hijos; Zenaida de 21 y Wilson de 18 años y utiliza su trabajo en carpintería para hacer estudiar a sus hijos. Con 14 años de experiencia en el negocio de la carpintería, hace 6 meses, a base de mucho esfuerzo, logró poner su negocio propio, en el cual trabaja con un ayudante, quien realiza el trabajo más pesado. Su negocio es muy concurrido por las personas las que le hacen muchos pedidos, los cuales cumple a tiempo y con mucho gusto, ya que disfruta de transformar la madera en un bien útil para las personas y aunque los peligros están latentes en su negocio ella no duda en ponerle todo su empeño y sacrificio. Es el primer préstamo que Yolanda realiza con Microfinanzas Prisma y espera cumplir con todos los pagos y acceder a otro préstamo muy pronto. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más cantidad de madera y por ende aumentará la producción de muebles en su carpintería.
texts.en:
Yolanda lives in her own home with her two children; Zenaida, 21 years old, and Wilson, 18 years old. She uses her work in carpentry to send her children to school. After fourteen years of experience in the carpentry business she was able to, with much effort, open her own business six months ago. She works there with one assistant, who does the heaviest work. Her business is popular among the people, and they place many orders that she fulfills on time and with much pleasure as she enjoys transforming raw wood into a useful piece. Although there are hidden risks in her business, she has no doubts about giving it all her effort and sacrifice. This is the first loan that Yolanda realizes with Microfinanzas Prisma. She hopes to complete all her payments and have access to another loan soon. She will use the funds to purchase more lumber, which will result in her being able to augment the production of furniture in her carpentry workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity of raw wood.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 51-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon with his wife and their four children. He has been working as an electronics repairman for two years. He repairs and does maintenance for all types of electricA. materials. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase new tools for his business. This is the first time that Naseem has requested a loan.

Naseem is speciA. in his work because he has good relations with his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He decided on doing his business because he has experience in his work. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase new tools for his business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia elabora habas saladas en la casa de su familia, que está hecha de adobe, vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos, la pequeña Milagros de 7 años y Jimmy de 06. Son ya 7 años que lleva en este negocio, todas las mañanas se dirige hacia el concurrido mercado Tupac Amaru, donde sus habas saladas son degustadas por sus asiduos clientes, los que hacen que su negocio sea uno de los más rentables del mercado. Virginia comenta que lo más tediosos de su trabajo es tener que embolsar las habas saladas, ya que las bolsas son muy delgadas y le toma mucho tiempo, pero ella es muy feliz con su negocio, ya que puede interactuar con sus clientes. Virginia solicitó por primera vez un préstamo en Microfinanzas prisma, ya que confía en la seguridad y respaldo de esta entidad recomendada por sus amistades. Con la cantidad que requiere planea modernizar su negocio comprando la maquinaria adecuada para elaborar mucho más rápido sus habas saladas.
texts.en:
Virginia prepares salted beans in her family's house, which is made of adobe. She lives with her partner and their two children, little Milagros who is seven years old and Jimmy who is six. She has been in this business for seven years. Every morning she heads for the crowded Tupac Amaru market where her salted beans are relished by her devoted customers, who make her business one of the most profitable of the market. Virginia says that the most tedious part of her work is to have to package the beans, because the bags are very thin and it takes a long time, but she is very happy with her business since she can interact with her customers. Virginia requested a loan for the first time from Prisma Microfinance since she trusts the security and backing of this organization recommended by her friends. With the amount she is requesting she plans to modernize her business by buying the machinery needed to prepare her beans more rapidly.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy machinery to make salted beans.

loans.name: Gabina

texts.es: Gabina es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, está casada y vive con su esposo Carlos, quien es moto taxista y sus dos pequeños hijos Cesar de 6 años y Haydee de 4, en una pequeña casa de adobe, que  pertenece a sus padres. Se dedica a vender carne en la plaza dominical, donde tiene un pequeño puesto ambulatorio, con el cual mantiene a su familia, lleva 4 años en este negocio, el cual año a año ha ido creciendo debido al gran carisma y deseos de superación que posee, siendo cada ves más rentable. Gabina es muy feliz cada vez que un cliente alaba la buena carne que vende, pues le hace sentir que su carne es la mejor del mercado y aunque a veces tiene que defender su mercadería de uno que otro perro ladrón, ella se siente satisfecha con la labor que realiza, ya que es mediante esta que puede mandar a sus hijos a estudiar. Felizmente, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo Carlos, quien la apoya económica y moralmente, cuando se presenta algún problema. Gabina se enteró de los créditos de Microfinanzas Prisma, por una amistad y con el ánimo que la caracteriza decidió solicitar un préstamo para hacer crecer su negocio. Con el dinero requerido espera hacer crecer su negocio comprando mayor cantidad de carne.
texts.en:
Gabina is a very hard working mother, is married, and lives with her husband Carlos, who is a motorbike taxi driver, and their two young children, Cesar who is six and Haydee who is four, in a small adobe house, which belongs to her parents. She sells meat in the dominical plaza, where she has a small movable stand, with which she maintains her family. She has been in this business for four years. Year to year it has been growing due to her great charisma and desire to succeed, becoming more and more profitable. Gabina is very happy every time a customer praises the good meat she sells, since it makes her feel that her meat is the best in the market. Although she sometimes has to defend her merchandise from various robber dogs, she is satisfied with the work, since it is the means through which she can send her children to study. Fortunately, she counts on the help of her husband Carlos, who supports her economically and morally when there is a problem. Gabina learned about the credits of Prisma Microfinance from a friend. With her characteristic spirit she decided to apply for a loan to expand her business. With the money requested she hopes to grow the business by buying a larger quantity of meat.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise by buying more meat

loans.name: Ghaleb

texts.en:
Ghaleb is a 43-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their seven children. Ghaleb has been working as a workshop operator in construction for twenty years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Ghaleb has requested a loan.

Ghaleb is special in his work because he is good and moreover, he is fast. His clients can be anybody. When he first started his business, he had difficulties starting up the business. He decided on doing his business because he needed to have a bigger income in order to cope with his family needs. In the future, he plans to expand his business and gain more cash.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo es un amable vendedor de golosinas, vive con su pareja, en una casa que le dejaron a custodiar en calidad de cuidante. Endulzando el paladar de la gente, con sus ricas golosinas, Wilfredo pasa sus días desde hace 6 meses, caminando por toda la ciudad de Juliaca vendiéndolas, para forjarse un mejor futuro, él siente que su negocio es muy divertido ya que puede conversar con mucha gente e interactuar con ella, pero lo que le resulta molesto y muy cansado es tener que caminar durante todo el día por la calles. Su negocio es muy rentable, ya que por lo general al final del día acaba con la mayoría de sus golosinas. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma y asegura ser muy puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que está solicitando comprará más golosinas y ampliará así su negocio.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is a pleasant seller of candy and lives with his partner in a house where he is the caretaker. Sweetening the palate of the people with his rich confections, Wilfredo has been spending his days for the last six months walking around the entire city of Juliaca selling the sweets to shape a better future. He feels that his business is very enjoyable because he can talk with many people and interact with them, but it is annoying and is very tiring having to walk all day in the streets. His business is very profitable, since usually by the end of the day he has sold most of the sweets. This is his first loan with Prisma Microfinance and he guarantees to be very punctual in the repayments. With the money he is requesting he will buy more sweets and expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his inventory of candy

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey S. is a Tanzanian micro-entrepreneur. He runs a kiosk at Vituka Ward in Dar es Salaam. He sells various soft drinks including fresh milk and juice. The business has many customers because Dar es Salaam is hot, thus cold drinks are mostly preferred by many people. He has been running the business for four years. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000 to boost the business

loans.use: To boost the business

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa B. started her "wailey" meat business 5 years ago in Abuakwa, a suburb of Kumasi, where she lives. Yaa prepares and serves her customers with a very tasty and good quality "wailey" meat and because of that many customers buy from her stand. She is now 40 years old and married with four children, who are all independent.

Wailey, as it is popularly called, is prepared from cow skin. Yaa goes to the butchers and buys the skin and then she roasts it on a fire. It then becomes very hard and it is used to prepared many kinds of our local dishes like okro soup, stew etc. But before you finally consume it, you need to cook it for a long time, otherwise it cannot be chewed. Some say its gives protein and others say that it does not give the body anything. But then, if you consider the number of people who buy wailey, it would amazed you.

Yaa wants to use the loan to increase her stock of assorted wailey meats. This would increase her sales and the income to support her grandchildren and business growth. Yaa belongs to a village bank called ‘Regina’. She would like a loan of GH¢400 to expand her business by restocking her inventory. This would enable her save more to support her husband with taking care of the home.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of "wailey" meat.

loans.name: Hanganu

texts.en:
The main activity of Hanganu V. is to raise grain. He has extended this business since 2002. V. grows corn, wheat, barley, and sunflowers. He farms 4.3630 ha of agricultural land with the help of a tractor. V. has been working alone in his business. The business is located in Ungheni district. The borrower has been in business for about 6 years.

In 2007, he also had a loan from MicroInvest to purchase vehicles, as working capital for agricultural activities, which was repaid in full. The purpose of this loan is to secure working capital (seeds, diesel, and mineral fertilizer). This year, V. wants to buy watermelon seeds, to plant on a plot of lower quality, but adequate for watermelons. Last year the borrower obtained 4 tons of corn, 3 tons of wheat, 3 tons of barley, and 2 tons of sunflowers from his land.

loans.use: to buy seeds, diesel and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is 53 years old and married with four children. She lives in Ibadan, Nigeria. She sells kerosene in wholesale and retail, a business she has been doing for a long time.

Mary needs the loan of 50,000 naira (USD$350) to purchase more kerosene to sell. She is indeed grateful to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael L. sells pepper soup and drinks. The demands for her pepper soup and drinks are high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. To do so, she needs a loan of 100,000 naira (USD$675) to purchase more drinks and pepper soup ingredients.

Rachael is 46 years old and married with four children. Her eldest child is an undergraduate at the university of Ibadan.

In the photo, you can see Rachael standing with her husband. She says thanks to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and soup ingredients.

loans.name: Prepelita

texts.en:
This client’s business is to grow cereals and grapes. The business was launched in 1998. V. lives together with his parents and farms 2 ha of arable land on which he grows corn, sunflowers, and grapevines. V. has been working by himself. The location of his business is in the Ungheni district. He is very experienced in growing cereals and has been in business for about 10 years.

This client also had a loan with Microinvest in the amount of 5000 lei to purchase grapevine seedlings; the loan was repaid in full without delay. In November he requested another loan in the amount of 5000 lei of working capital for agriculture for the procurement of seeds, diesel, and mineral fertilizer. Now the purpose of the loan is the same: to purchase seeds, diesel and mineral fertilizer. Last year this client obtained 3 tons of corn, 1.5 tons of sunflower and produced 1.5 tons of wine. The corn is used in the household for growing animals . From the sunflower seeds, he produces oil and sells it to the villagers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, diesel and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Ally

texts.en: Ally K. M. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. He is married and he runs a tailoring mart at Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam. He makes various clothes of different designs for different people, including school uniforms. He has been in the business for four years. Business materials are purchased from Kariakoo and Karume wholesale shop and sometimes from retailers. He meets his family's daily needs from his business income. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to buy more business materials.

loans.use: To buy more business inventory

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
El señor Lucio C. Aruquipa vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposa, la señora Primitiva Laymeguanca.
El señor Lucio trabaja como albañil en construcciones particulares de nuestra ciudad y su esposa es comerciante ambulante.
Con anteriores créditos construyeron dos habitaciones en obra gruesa, las mismas que quieren concluir para que su esposa pueda poner una tienda de barrio y así poder tener mejores ingresos para su familia.
El crédito es para la construcción en obra fina de dos habitaciones: un dormitorio y una  tienda.
Esta es la quinta vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Lucio C. Aruquipa lives in his own house in the Pasankeri zone, the western hillside, of La Paz city, with his wife Primitiva Laymeguanca. Lucio works as a construction worker in the city and his wife is a street vendor. With previous loans they built two basic rooms, which they would now like to finish construction on so that his wife can run a neighborhood store and earn more money for their family. The loan will be used to finish construction on the two rooms: one will serve as a bedroom and the other will be the store. This is their fifth loan request and the analysis of their application qualified them to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish construction of a bedroom and store in their house.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
La señora Modesta A. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Callapa, zona peri urbana de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo, el señor Celso Aduviri y sus dos hijos.
La señora Modesta elabora mantas de vicuña y alpaca que vende de casa en casa y su esposo recolecta arena del río próximo a su vivienda, que vende a las construcciones privadas.
Recientemente adquirieron la propiedad en la que viven actualmente y de la que eran cuidadores, para lo que utilizaron sus ahorros.
El crédito que ahora Modesta solicita es para la compra de lana para elaborar sus mantas, ya que su capital fue invertido en la compra de su vivienda.
Esta es la cuarta vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Modesta A. lives in her own house, in the Callapa zone just outside La Paz city, with her husband Celso Aduviri and their two children. Modesta makes blankets from vicuña and alpaca wool and sells them door-to-door. Her husband gathers sand from the river near their house, which he sells to construction companies. They recently acquired the property where they live now, using their savings to buy it. The loan Modesta is requesting will be used to buy wool to make her blankets, as she used the rest of her money to invest in her home. This is her fourth loan request and the analysis of her application qualified her to received another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vicuña and alpaca wool to make blankets.

loans.name: Mykhaylo

texts.en:
Mykhaylo is married with two small sons. He runs a drug store business. Mykhaylo used to work for a government drugstore. Then he decided to start one of his own. Hard work and clear purpose - to provide for his family - made his business grow. Now Mykhaylo has three business locations, one in the city and two in small towns, that provide people with necessary medicine.

Mykhaylo is asking for a loan of 5,000 UAH to increase the assortment of medicines. This business is the only source of income for his family, so Mykhalo wants to run it well.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of medicines

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza vive en la calle “ Huancane”   de la zona villa Amor de Dios en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
La señora es separada, vive en casa propia junto hijo el cual trabaja particularmente

Trabaja vendiendo comida por las mañanas, en las distintas ferias de la zona en su puesto ambulante. También trabaja como ayudante de minibús por las tardes.
 
El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de materiales de construcción para la refacción de su muralla principal del terreno donde vive. 
 
Es el primer   crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Esperanza lives on Huancane Street in the Villa Amor de Dios zone of El Alto city. She is separated and lives in her own house with her son, who works. She works selling food in the mornings from her cart, in each of the street markets in that zone. She also works as a minibus (public transportation) assistant in the afternoons. This loan will be used to buy construction materials to renovate the main wall around her property. It is Esperanza’s first loan with Impro, and after evaluation she has been qualified to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials to renovate the wall around her land.

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en: Furaha H. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. She runs a Tailoring mart at Kigamboni Island in Dar es Salaam. She makes varieties of clothes of different types and designs for different people, including school uniforms. She has been with the business for five years. Her family's daily needs depend on support from the business income. She is requesting a loan of  Tshs  600,000 to buy more business items.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.es:
Eulogio se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).
 
Vive en la comunidad de Ancocagua Sector  Pucarani   de la Provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado a cuatro horas de la ciudad de La Paz. 
Como segundo trabajo, se dedica a la construcción como maestro albañil, en la ciudad de El Alto.
 Tiene seis hijo que van desde  16  años  hasta  el menor que tiene 7 años. 
 
El crédito lo destinará en la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mejorada y así aumentar su producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos..
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Eulogio raises bovine cattle and sells their milk to PIL Andina (an industrial milk processing plant). He lives in the community of Ancocagua Sector Pucarani of the Provincia Los Andes del departamento de la Paz, located four hours from the city of La Paz. As a second job, he works in construction as a master mason in the city of El Alto. He has six children who are between the ages of 7 and 16. He will use the loan to purchase a high quality milk cow to help increase his production of milk and his earnings. This is his first loan with Impro and the evaluation proved he is qualified to be granted the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow in order to increase his production of milk

loans.name: Zulfa

texts.en: Zulfa S.M. is a Tanzanian micro-entrepreneur and a married woman. She runs a shop at Kigamboni Island in Dar es Salaam. She sells varieties of items among which cereal crop products are the dominant commodities. She purchases the business items from Kariakoo city market and sometimes direct from the producers. She has been running the business for four years. She requests a loan of Tshs 1,400,000 to buy more business items.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa es una joven de 25 años, está casada y tiene una pequeña bebé recién nacida la cual la acompaña a sus jornadas de trabajo diarias. Ella vende jugo de quinua con manzana y jugo de cañihua para generar ingresos para su familia, su esposo también la ayuda cuando tiene días libres la apoya en la venta, ya que ella con una bebé pequeña y recién nacida aun no puede dedicarse netamente al trabajo que requiere de esfuerzo, ya que gracias a Dios Elisa tiene mucha clientela. Lo más difícil de su labor es la preparación bebido a que requiere ser muy minuciosa con los ingredientes para preparar los jugos como a ella y a sus clientes le gustan. Elisa se encuentra en su 8vo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos, ya que los préstamos que solicita le son de mucha ayuda para su negocio. Con el dinero requerido comprará mayor cantidad de ingredientes para preparar su rico jugo de quinua y también para refaccionar el triciclo en el cual ofrece estas bebidas y así brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Elisa is a young woman of 25 years, is married, and has a small newborn baby who accompanies her daily while she is working. She sells quinoa with apple juice and cañihua juice to generate income for her family. Her husband helps her with the sales when he has days off, since with a little newborn baby she still can not devote herself completely to the work that requires such effort, since - thanks to God - Elisa has many customers. The hardest part of her work is preparing the drinks which requires being very meticulous with the ingredients to prepare the juices the way she and her clients like them. Elisa is seeking her eighth loan with Prisma Microfinance and is very punctual with the payments since the loans she requests are of great help with her business. With the requested money she will buy a larger quantity of ingredients to prepare her rich quinoa juice and repair the three wheel cart with which she offers these drinks and so provide a better service.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for the preparation of her juices

loans.name: Geogina

texts.en: Geogina M. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. She runs a traditional clothing shop at Kisiwani Ward at Buguruni in Dar es Salaam. She purchases the business items from Mnazi Mmoja Traditional Clothes shopping center from the wholesale shops. She has been running the business for three years. She needs a loan of Tshs 600,000 to boost the business.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Janet Lola

texts.en:
Janet Lola L. sells cosmetics and provisions such as toothpaste, noodles, toothbrush, and so on. She hopes for the loan amount of 80,000 naira (USD$550) to purchase more cosmetics and provisions.

Janet is 50 years old and married with two children. She lives in Ibadan, Nigeria. She says thanks to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Sultan

texts.en: Sultan D. is a Tanzanian micro-business owner and a married man. He is a carpenter. He makes various furniture at Buguruni Ward in Dar es Salaam. Buguruni is a timber-selling point in Dar es Salaam. He purchases the timber direct from the wholesalers and then retails it. He receives furniture orders from schools and individuals for domestic use. He requests a loan of 600,000 to boost his business.

loans.use: To buy more lumber to use and/or re-sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia K. B. is 52 years old, married, and the mother of four children. The children are currently in school. Cecilia lives with her family at Abuakwa, a suburb of Kumasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Cecilia never had the privilege to attend school because of financial constraints, as is the problem for most of our mothers in Ghana. Cecilia decided to start in the trader business in order to take care of herself, as that was the only option open to her at that time. She has been trading in the sale of used cloths for the past 8 years now. 

Selling of used clothing is an important market in Ghana, as brand new cloths are very expensive for the poor. Therefore, selling of used clothing has become a big market for many women like Cecilia. With the loan, she wants to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory. She plans to use this loan to rent a store to trade and with the increased profits, save for her children’s future education. 

Cecilia belongs to a village bank called ‘Regina’. She would like a loan of GH¢400 to expand her business by increasing her inventory. This would enable her save more to support her husband in taking care of the home.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing and rent a store to trade.

loans.name: Biola

texts.en:
Biola S. is 38 years old and married with two children. She lives in Ibadan, Nigeria. She sells wine and gift items and needs a loan of 80,000 naira (USD$550) to purchase more wine and gift items to sell.

Biola wishes to thank all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more wine and gift items.

loans.name: Rene Hilario

texts.es:
Rene Hilario M. R. tiene la edad de 49 años, su estado civil es casado, Don Hilario tiene 1 hijo su edad es de 7 años y cursa el 5 grado de primaria, su compañera de vida labora como dependiente de farmacia, sus propósitos son de seguir trabajando para sustentar a su familia y así pagar las deudas contraídas con la Fundación León 2000 sus sueños son de conseguir otra unidad de transporte por que la que posee actualmente no esta en muy buen estado pero debido a la difícil situación económica en la que el país se encuentra es muy difícil cambiar la unidad de transporte además con lo que gana tiene que mantener a su hogar sus sueños son que su hijo logre prepararse lo suficiente para que pueda tener un buen futuro además quiere que su hijo se prepare ya que el no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar y no le gustaría que su hijo pase por este tipo de situación es por eso que el trabaja muy duro para que su hijo tenga la posibilidad para que sea una persona preparada en el ámbito del estudio.

Su actividad económica es el servicio de taxi, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 2 años, Don Rene inicio este negocio como chofer de un camión de transporte y lo que le pagaban lo conservaba ya que sus intenciones eran las de comprar un carro y lo ocuparía para dar los servicios de taxi ya que este seria el medio de trabajo que utilizaría para mantener a su familia pero debido a la situación no pudo completar el dinero y mas tarde su hermana se encargo de ayudarlo para que Don Rene pudiera comprar su unidad de transporte y es así como obtiene su taxi sus experiencias obtenidas con los clientes al dar este servicio le ha gustado mucho ya que le gusta servir a la población y su familia lo apoyado en lo necesario ya que es un trabajo digno y humilde además por medio de esto es que logra que su familia obtenga lo necesario, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo es para mejorar la unidad y consiste en la compra de amortiguadores traseros, espirales traseros, foco delanteros y juego de valineras y todas estas cosas las consigue en un buen precio en Managua además agradece la oportunidad del crédito otorgado por la Fundación León 2000 y las diferentes organizaciones.
texts.en:
Rene Hilario Mondragon Ramirez is 49 years old, married, has one son who is seven years old, and attended school through the fifth grade. His life partner works as a pharmacy sales clerk. His plans are to continue working to support his family and pay the loan from Foundation Leon 2000. He hopes to get another transport vehicle because the one he now has is not in very good condition, but because of the difficult economic condition the country finds itself in it is very difficult to replace the vehicle, since with what he earns he needs to maintain his home. His dreams are that his son is able to prepare himself sufficiently so that he can have a good future. Also, he wants his son to study since he did not have the opportunity to study and he does not want his son to face this type of situation, which is why he works so hard, so that his son has the possibility to be prepared for studying. His work is to provide taxi service, moving around. He has had this business for two years. Don Rene started this business as a truck driver and saved what he was paid since he was planning to buy a car and use it to provide taxi service. This would be the type of work that he would use to maintain his family but due to the situation he could not get all the money together, but later his sister took it upon herself to help him so that Don Rene was able to buy his vehicle and that's how he got his taxi. His experiences with his clients, providing this service, have pleased him a lot, since he likes to serve the public. And his family has helped him as necessary since it is dignified and humble work, plus it is through this means that he assures that his family obtains what is necessary. The financing is for working capital to improve his vehicle and will be used to buy rear shock absorbers, rear springs, front headlights, and a set of ball bearings. All these things can be obtained at a good price in Managua. He is grateful for the credit opportunity offered by the Foundation Leon 2000 and the different organizations.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to improve his taxi

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en:
Taiwo A. is a hairdresser. She also sells hair materials like shampoo, hair extensions, hair cream, et cetera. She hopes to expand her business and she needs the loan amount of 70,000 naira (USD$475) to purchase more hair materials.

Taiwo is 38 years old and married with four children. She says thanks to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more hair materials.

loans.name: Sabanalamarino Unido Iii Group

texts.en:
Angela L. is the bank coordinator for Group 3 in the Sabanalamarino Unido Bank of Hope in Hato Mayor. Her group has five members. She has two small children, ages 4 and 8. She has a clothing business where she sells both new and used items. Her business is in her own house and most of her customers live in her neighborhood. She has already received five loans from Esperanza and is about to receive her sixth loan.

With these loans she has been able to invest in refurbishing her business. Her immediate purpose with this loan is to expand her business to selling snacks such as juice and cupcakes. She thinks this has good potential in her neighborhood. On a longer term, she would like to have her business in a location separate from her home, where she can have a clothing store and a bakery. She hopes that her business profits will help her to keep providing for her two children and achieve her dream to have a house of her own. On behalf of Esperanza and this Bank of Hope, thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchase new merchandise for clothing business and expand to snack-selling

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
EDITH LOPEZ C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Solidarias”, ubicado en el Jr. Calvop de Araujo Nº 507 del Distrito de Callería, tiene 62 años de edad, 03 hijos, su esposo le ayuda en su bodega.

El primer prestamo que recibio fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró abarrotes como: sao de arroz, saco de azucar, caja de leche, aceite, y otros productos pequeños de tal manera que puso su bodega pequeña dentro de su casa, crecía pocoa poco el negocio pues su esposo le ayudaba.

Con el préstamo que recibió de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, amplió su compra, pues ya tiene más clientes, la bodega es grande ubicada en una esquina vende hasta artículos de ferreteria, compró 02 sacos de arroz, 02 sacos de azúcar, 02 cajas de leche, detergente, jabon y otros artículos pequeños.

Esta muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos por la oportunidad que le brindó para continuar trabajando junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Edith Lopez C., is part of the Community Bank "Mujeres Solidarias", located in the Jr. Calvop de Araujo Nº 507 in the District of Calleria. She is 62 years old and has 3 children. Her husband helps in her store. The first loan she received was for S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles (~$100 USD). She used the loan to purchase groceries. She purchased a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, a case of milk, oil, and other similar small products, which she put in her small store, located within her house. Slowly but surely she grew her business along with the help of her husband. With the loan for $325 she will be able to make a much larger purchase. She now has many customers and a large store located on a corner where she sells everything down to hardware supplies. She will purchase 2 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar, 2 cases of milk, detergent, soap, and other small items. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for the opportunity she has given her to continue working together with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase hardware items, 2 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar, 2 cases of milk, detergent, soap, and other small items.

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en:
Kemi A. is 45 years old and married with two children. She sells kitchen utensils like spoon, pots, plates, et cetera. She started this business in 2002.

Kemi needs the loan of 50,000 naira (USD$350) to purchase more kitchen utensils to sell. She wishes to thank all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Ena

texts.es:
ENA M. D. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Líderes” ubicado en el Jr. Tapiche N° 457 del Distrito D. Callería, tiene 52 años D. edad, 04 hijos, su esposo es chofer.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró artículos D. primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, huevo, leche, detergente, jabón, fideos, enlatados todo en poca cantidad, para venderlos en un puesto  del mercado N° 03 del Distrito cerca a su casa, por el buen trato y la buena administración que tenía crecía su negocio.

Con el préstamo D. S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compró más productos, pues ahora es una bodega granD., tiene su propio local, 02 sacos D. arroz, 02 sacos D. azúcar, leche, 02 cajas D. aceite, el progreso continúa.
