Gracias a Manuela Ramos ella crece cada vez más.
texts.en:
Ena M. D. Median belongs to the Community Bank "Mujeres Lideres", located in Jr. Tapiche N° 457 of the District of Callería. She is 52 years old and has 4 children. Her husband is a chauffeur. The first loan she received was for S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles (~$100 USD). She used the loan to purchase necessary items such as: rice, sugar, eggs, milk, detergent, soap, and noodles, all of which were tinned in small quantities. She sold the products in her stall at market N° 03 in the district near her house. Through good negotiation and management she was able to grow her business. With the loan for $325, she will purchase more merchandise. Now that she has her own large store she will purchase 2 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar, milk, and 2 cases of oil, which she will use to continue to grow her business. Thanks to Manuela Ramos she is able to grow more each time.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more merchandies: 2 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar, milk, 2 cases of oil.  All of which will help her store grow

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
FLOR DE MARIA AB. T., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Líderes” ubicado en el Jr. Tupac Amaru N° 585 – 09 de Octubre del Distrito de Callería, ella tiene 55 años de edad, repara máquinas de coser y es costurera, con 05 hijos, y su esposo es motosierrista.

El primer préstamos que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles y compró una máquina de coser de segunda mano, confeccionó camisitas, shores, pantalones para niños, lo vendía por su distrito con la ayuda de su esposo para entonces el no tenia trabajo.

Con el préstamo que recibió de S/.1,800.00 Nuevos Soles y compró agujas, repuestos para máquina, telas para seguir confeccionando sus vestidos para niñas.

Ella viaja por la ribera del río Ucayali, brinda sus servicios de arreglo de máquinas de coser y vende sus confecciones.

Está agradecida de Manuela Ramos,. Por la confianza y apoyo que le brindó.
texts.en:
Flor de Maria AB. T. belongs to the Community Bank "Mujeres Lideres", located in Jr. Tupac Amaru N° 585 – 09 de Octubre of the District of Callería. She is 55 years old. She repairs sewing machines and is a seamstress. She has 5 children and her husband is a chainsawman. The first loan she received was for S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles (~$100 USD). She used the loan to purchase a used sewing machine with which she made shirts, shorts, and pants for children. She sold her clothes in her district with the help of her husband, who did not have a job at the time. With the loan for $600 she will purchase needles, spare sewing machine parts, and fabric to continue making outfits for girls. She travels along the river bank of the Ucayali river, offering to repair sewing machines and selling her hand sewn clothing. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for her confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase needles, spare sewing machine parts, and fabric to continue making clothing for girls.

loans.name: Julian

texts.en:
Julian B. is divorced and a mother with two children, who are currently in school. She is a 43 year old trader. She lives at Abuakwa, in the Ashanti region of Ghana, together with her family. Julian was formerly in the trading business with her husband until they divorced. She works very hard to take care of her children since her husband abandoned the family.

She trades in, lace and clothing materials. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations. Clothing materials are often sewn and worn at almost every occasion, especially on Fridays. She started this business three years ago. Through hard work and commitment she saves part of her profit so that she has enough to take care of the kids. 

For lack of adequate working capital, Julian buys only a few supplies of lace and clothing materials which she sells through hawking. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to a higher level. With the loan, she wants to purchase bulk supplies of lace materials and textiles. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with aquality education.

Julian belongs to a group called ‘Regina’. She hope to receive a loan of GH¢500 to increase her business by restocking her inventory. This would enable her save more to support her home.

loans.use: To purchase bulk supplies of lace materials and textile

loans.name: Bolanle

texts.en:
Bolanle A. owns a salon. She makes lovely hairstyles for her customers and she has been in this business for a long time. She also sells hair materials. She needs the loan amount of 80,000 (USD$550) to purchase more salon materials to sell.

Bolanle is 32 years old and single. She says thanks to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more salon materials.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
GLADYS D. A. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Líderes” ubicado en el Jr. Cajamarca N° 148 D. Distrito de Callería tiene 49 años de edad, 05 hijos, su esposo es chofer.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró maderas cortas de cedro y caoba, confeccionó colgadores de ropa, cuadros, repisas para adornos de diferentes tamaños, su esposo le ayudaba en sus momentos de descanso.

Con el desembolso que recibió de S/.1,800.00 Nuevos Soles, compró madera como cedro y caoba, laca, 01 balde, clavos de 1”, 1 ½”, 2”, 2 ½”, sin cabeza un kg., de cada uno, cola 1 kg., lijas de todos las medidas para confeccionar roperos, colgadores, diferentes adornos.

Está muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos por confiar en ella.
texts.en:
Gladys D. A. P. belongs to the "Women Leaders" Community Bank, located in the Callería neighborhood. She is 49 years old, has 5 children, and her husband is a driver. The first loan that Gladys received was for S/.300.00 Peruvian Soles, which she used to buy cedar and mahogany wood to create clothes hangers, picture frames, and shelves of different sizes. Her husband helped her in his free time. With this disbursement of S/.1,800.00 Peruvian Soles, she will buy cedar and mahogany wood, lacquer, a pail, 1 kg of 1", 1.5", 2" and 2.5" nails, and sanding sheets of all sizes to create dressers, hangers, and different adornments. Gladys is very grateful to Manuela Ramos, a Kiva Partner, for believing in her.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cedar and mahogany wood, lacquer, a pail, 1 kg of 1", 1.5", 2" and 2.5" nails, and sanding sheets of all sizes to create dressers, hangers, and different adornments

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is a fashion designer. She makes lovely designs for her customers and she also sells tailoring materials.

Mary needs a loan of 50,000 naira (USD$350) to purchase more tailoring materials to sell.

Mary is 37 years old and married with three children. She is indeed grateful to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials.

loans.name: Fansi

texts.en:
Fansi O. is 44 years old and married with a child. She sells jewelry and she has been in this business since 2005.

Fansi is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. She needs the loan amount of 70,000 naira (USD$475) to purchase more jewelry to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry.

loans.name: Sabanalamarino Unido V Group

texts.en: Barbara A. is the bank coordinator for a group of 5 in the Sabanalamarinos Unidos Bank of Hope in Hato Mayor, Dominican Republic. She has three young children ages 3, 5 and 7. She sells clothes in her small business. She has already received four loans from Esperanza and is about to receive her fifth loan.  With these loans she has been able to invest in a freezer and a gas cylinder. She would like to increase her sales volume and the clothing variety available and hopes to one day open her own real store. Her dream is to have a house of her own where she can see her children grow up. Thank you for supporting this loan!

loans.use: Refurbish business with new clothing to sell

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es:
JUANA ISABEL F. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Amistad ”, ubicada en el Jr. Huancayo Mz. A, Lt. 04 del Asentamiento Humano “Nuevo Bolognesi” de la C.F.B. km. 7.00 del Distrito de Callería, tiene 35 años de edad, 01 hija, es madre soltera, como socia 03 años en Manuela Ramos.

El primer préstamos que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró cuyes, carnero, hizo sus corralitos, los criaba, luego los vendía cuando crecían. Debido a que su granja estaba muy lejos y no tenía tiempo de verlos, le robaban, decidió dejar de criar.

Con este préstamo de S/.3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compró balones de gas industrial como oxígeno, distribuye en la ciudad a diferentes lugares.

Esta muy agradecida de Manuela Ramos por apoyarle, ya que ella es madre soltera y le brindó la ayuda en el momento que más necesitó.
texts.en:
Juana Isabel F. C. belongs to the "La Amistad" Communal Bank, located in the Bolognesi District. She is 35 years old, and is a single mother with one daughter. She has been a partner with Manuela Ramos (CrediMujer) for 3 years.

The first loan she received was for S/.300.00 Peruvian Soles, with which she bought guinea pigs and rams, made corrals, and cared for the animals, and sold them once they grew. Because her flock was very far way and as she was not able to constantly watch them, they were stolen, and she decided to stop raising animals.

With this loan of S/.3,000.00 Peruvian Soles, she would like to buy tanks of industrial gasses like oxygen, and distribute them to different places throughout the city. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos, a Kiva Partner, for her support, since she is a single mother


Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tanks of industrial gasses to distribute

loans.name: Libertad Solina

texts.es:
LIBERTAD SOLINA V. D. V., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Solidarias” ubicado en el Jr. Pachitea N° 902 del Distrito D. Callería en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, tiene 63 años D. edad, 7 hijos mayores D. edad que trabajan con ella.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles vendía comida en el frontis delantero D. su casa por 08 años, gracias a Dios y a Manuela Ramos, poco a poco implementaba su bodeguita.

Con este préstamo D. S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, compró 01 saco D. arroz, 01 saco D. azúcar, leche 02 cajas, 1 paquete D. detergente, 10 kh., D. fideos spaqguetti, 50 huevos, ambientación D. su local.

Muy agradecida D. Manuela Ramos por brindar el apoyo que necesitaba en su momento propicio
texts.en:
Libertad Solina V. D. V. belongs to the "Mujeres Solidarias" Communal Bank, located in the Callería District in the city of Pucallpa. She is 63 years old, and has 7 adult children who all work with her. The first loan she received for S/.300.00 Peruvian Soles she used to begin selling food in front of her house, which she has done for 8 years, and thanks to God and to Manuela Ramos (a Kiva Partner), little by little she was able to fill out her small store. With this loan of S/.1,500.00 Peruvian Soles, she will buy a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, 2 boxes of milk, a packet of detergent, 10 kg. of spaghetti noodles, 50 eggs, and use it to improve the atmosphere of her store. Libertad is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for offering this much-needed support.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, 2 boxes of milk, a packet of detergent, 10 kg. of spaghetti noodles, 50 eggs, and to improve the atmosphere of the store

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
El señor Alfonso G. G. es viudo, el vive con su hija y con su nieto, ellos tienen 13 años de vivir en su hogar. El señor Alfonso trabaja como mensajero desde hace 5 años, siendo este trabajo su principal fuente de ingresos con los cuales mantiene a su familia.
El señor Alfonso está solicitando un préstamo para contratar mano de obra para impermeabilizar el techo de la segunda planta de su casa por que hay mucha humedad en esa parte de su hogar. (En la fotografía no aparece el señor Alfonso, sino aparece su hija).
Esta mejora a la vivienda del señor Alfonso permitirá que él y su familia puedan vivir cómodamente.
texts.en:
Alfonso G. G. is a widower and lives with his daughter and grandson, who have lived in his home for 13 years. His daughter appears in the photograph above in Alfonso's stead.

Alfonso has worked as a messenger for 5 years, and this has been his principal source of income with which he is able to support his family. Alfonso solicits this loan so that he can hire workers to waterproof the roof of his house as there is a high level of humidity on the second floor. This loan will help him improve his home to ensure that he and his family are able to live comfortably.


Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Waterproof the roof of his home

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
MARIA ELENA T. SERRRUCHE, pertenece al Banco Comunal “De la Amistad” ubicada en el Asentamiento Humano 20 de Diciembre Mz. B, Lt. 10 en el distrito de Yarinacocha, tiene 36 años de edad, 02 hijos, su esposo trabaja en construcción.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, confecciono una caja en general, al frontis de la Posta de Salud Nuevo Bolognesi.

Con este prestamos de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compro frutas en variedad todos de la región, preparó comida para vender,  golosinas en general.

Muy agradecida de Manuela Ramos por apoyarle en el momento que mas necesitaba, se siente muy bien y contenta.
texts.en:
MARIA ELENA T. SERRRUCHE belongs to the Communal Bank "La Amistad” (Friendship) situated in the 20th of December Settlement in the District of Yarinacocha, in the Peruvian Amazon region. She is 36 years of age and has two children. Her husband is a construction worker. With her first loan of 300 New Sols, she built herself a stand in front of the Nuevo Bolognesi Health Post. With this loan of 1000 New Sols, she will buy fruits of all varieties of the region, food prepared for sale and various sweets. Maria Elena greatly appreciates the support she received from Manuela Ramos/CrediMUJER at a time when it was most needed. She now feels very well and satisfied.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar frutas en variedad todos de la región, preparar comida para vender y golosinas en general.

loans.name: Melina Leania

texts.es:
MELINA LEANIA L. MUÑOZ, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Amistad ” ubicada en el Jr. Los Frutales Mz. F, Lt. 01 del Distrito de Callería, tiene 01 hijo, es Técnica en Enfermería con 30 años de edad, trabajó en la posta de salud de Nuevo Bolognesi, su esposo es Constructor Civil.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, y el bajo sueldo que recibía su esposo no alcanzaba para el sustento familiar, ella compró ropas, como shores, blusas, zapatos, vendía a sus amigos de la Posta de Salud, para entonces no trabajaba solo estudiaba.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, ahora ya es profesional, compró medicinas, estetoscopio, en su casa atiende como tópico por las tardes, compró más ropas, ahora ya tiene clientes seleccionados, solo trabaja con pedidos.

Muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos por darle la mano en el momento que más ha necesitado.
texts.en:
MELINA LEANIA L. MUÑOZ, belongs to the Communal Bank “La Amistad” (Friendship) situated in the Nuevo Bolognesi Settlement in the Callería District of eastern Peru. She is 30 years old with one son. She works as a Medical Assistant at the Health Post in Nuevo Bolognesi. Her husband is a Civil Constructor but the low wages he was receiving were not sufficient to sustain the family. With her first loan of 300 New Sols she bought clothing such as shorts, blouses and shoes which she was selling to her friends at the Health Post. After that, she was only studying and not working. Now that she is a health professional, she will use part of this loan of 1200 New Sols to buy medicines and a stethoscope. She will also buy more clothing which she sells out of her home most afternoons. She now has a regular clientele and sells only to order. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos/CrediMUJER for giving her a hand at the time when it was most needed.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar medicinas, estetocopios, para el tópico que tiene en su casa y tambien comprar ropa para venderlo a sus clientes seleccionados

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu A. is 37 years old. She is divorced and the mother of two kids. Currently all her kids are in school. She loves selling goods, the business through which she earns her daily source of livelihood.  She has been a food vendor for twenty five years now, and has made an income that has supported her family. She sells Fante kenkey which is one of the favorite foods enjoyed by many Ghanaians, because it supplies carbohydrate components in diets. Fante Kenkey is prepared from milled maize and is made into stew or soup and it can also be mashed for ice kenkey. 

Salamatu buys her supplies directly from farmers. This enables her to avoid middlemen who would buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy a bulk supply of maize to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school. Salamatu belongs to a village bank called ‘Regina’. She would like to receive a loan of GH¢500 to make her business expand by increasing her inventory. This would enable her save more to support her family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
RITA F. APAGUEÑO, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Amistad” ubicado en el Jr. Oroya Mz. H, Lt. 02 del Asentamiento Humano Nuevo Bolognesi, de la C.F.B. km. 7.000 del Distrito de Callería.

La señora Rita tiene 49 años de edad, ella es costurera, vende comida por las noches de lunes a viernes y los fines de semana sábado y domingo se va a su fundo, para el arreglo de las tierras y plantas.

El primer préstamo S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles la hizo hace 3 años, compró arroz, azúcar, aceite, pollo, pescado, en poca cantidad y empezó a vender comida en el frontis de su casa, dejo de vender porque se enfermó, se dedicó a la costura.

Con este préstamos de S/.1,500.00 que recibió compró telas, hilos, elásticos, para la confección de vestidos, shorest, para niños, trabaja con sus hijos y esposo en la venta de las confecciones.

Está agradecida con Manuela de todo lo que tiene, se siente muy útil y sobre todo cumplió con su meta de unir a su familia.
texts.en:
RITA F. APAGUEÑO, belongs to the Communal Bank “La Amistad” (Friendship) situated in the Nuevo Bolognesi Settlement in the Callería District of eastern Peru. Rita is 49 years of age and is a seamstress. She sells food in the evenings from Monday to Friday. On the weekends she goes to her farm to take care of the fields and the crops. Three years ago, she received her first loan of 300.00 New Sols which she used to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, chicken and fish, in small quantities. She began to sell food out of the front of her house, but gave it up when she became ill and now concentrates on her needlework. With this loan of 1500 New Sols she will buy fabric, thread and elastic in order to make children's clothing. Her husband and children work with her to sell what she creates. Rita is grateful to Manuela Ramos/CrediMUJER for all that she has. She feels useful and above all she has carried out her goal of uniting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar telas, hilos, elásticos para la confección de vestidos, shorest para niños.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
ROSA F. S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valientes” ubicado en el Jr. Lima Nº 296 del Distrito de Calleria, tiene 60 años de edad, 06 hijos todos ellos mayores de edad, su esposo es obrero, es socia de Manuela ramos hace 06 años.

El primer prestamo que recibio fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compro arroz, azucar, fideos, aceite, leche y golosinas, hizo una pequeña bodeguita en la esquina de su casa de ahí se inicio.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compro mas abarrotes, entre ellos gaseosas 06 cajas, amplio su local e hizo arreglos interiores, como pintar mas andamios.

Muy ahradecida con Manuela Ramos por confiar en ella.
texts.en:
ROSA F. S., belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres Valientes” (Valiant Women) located in the Calleria District of eastern Peru. She is 60 years of age and has six grown children. Her husband is a laborer. Rosa has been associated with Manuela Ramos/CrediMUJER for six years. The first loan, of 300 New Sols, that she received was used to buy rice, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, milk and sweets. She created a small grocery store in the corner of her house; that is how she got started. With this loan of 1000 New Sols she will buy more groceries including six cases of carbonated beverages. She will also expand her shop and make interior improvements, such as painting the shelving. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for the trust they have shown her.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar más abarrotes, entre ellos gaseosas 6 cajas, ampliar su local e hizo arreglos interiores (como pintar más andamios).

loans.name: Rosa Lily

texts.es:
ROSA LILY RODRIGUEZ D. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Solidarias” ubicado en el Jr. Ricardo Palma Nº 225 del Distrito D. Callería en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, tiene 65 años D. edad, 04 hijos mayores, todos ellos, su esposo es constructor.

El primer prestamo que recibio fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró ropas D. segunda, viajaba a diferentes lugares D. la ribera del Río Ucayali, vendiendo sus mercaderías.

Con este préstamo D. S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, compró un fardo D. ropas usadas, pescado seco 02 sacos. Está lista para viajar nuevmente por la ribera del Río Ucayali, pues sus clientes le esperan.

Agradecieda D. Manuela Ramos por apoyarla, confiar en ella a pesar D. su edad avanzada, pero con muchas energías D. trabajar.
texts.en:
ROSA LILY RODRIGUEZ D. M., a member of the Banco Comunal "Mujeres Solidarias" located in the Jr Ricardo Palma Number 225 in the Calleria District in the city of Pucallpa, is 65 years old, has 4 older children, and her spouse is a construction worker. The first loan she received was in the amount of s/.300.00 New Soles, with which she bought second-hand clothing, and utilized to travel to different locations along the coast of the river Ucayali selling her wares. With this loan of S/1,500.00 New Soles, she bought a bundle of used clothing, and 2 sacks of dried fish . She is ready to travel once again down the shore of the Ucayali river, for her clients await her. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for helping her and trusting in her great willingness to work in spite of her advanced age.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar un fardo de ropas usadas y pescado seco (2 sacos).

loans.name: Rosana

texts.es:
ROSANA C. A., pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Amistad ”, ubicado en el Jr. Tacna N° 489 en el Distrito de Callería, ella tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos, es socia de Manuela Ramos, 02 años.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual se inició a comprar frutas de la costa en poca cantidad, construir un pequeño stand para mostrar su mercadería, gracias a la gran acogida que tenía sus productos y al buen trato que ella brindaba a sus clientes, necesitó de mas dinero.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, compró un exhibidor (máquina para refrigerar las frutas) frutas de la costa en toda la avenida.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por su confianza y está muy contenta con ello.
texts.en:
ROSANA C. A., is a member of Communal Bank "La Amistad", located in the Jr Tacna Number 489 in the Calleria District. She is 24 years old, single, has no children, and has been an associate of Manuela Ramos for the past 2 years. The first loan she received was for s/.300.00 New Soles, which she used to buy a small quantity of coastal fruits, build a small stand to show off her merchandise and, thanks to the great reception of her goods and services and the good treatment she gave her clients, she required additional funds. With this new loan of s/.1,500.00 New Soles, she is buying a display freezer (a machine to refrigerate the fruit) and selling coastal fruit along the entire avenue. She thanks Manuela Ramos for her faith in her and is very happy about it.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar un exhibidor (máquina para refrigerar las frutas).
